campaign.story:
About Duty Free: A Documentary Film
After working every day of her adult life, my mom - a single mom - was fired from her job at age 75. To help her deal with the pain of this loss, I encouraged her to write out a list of all the things she could never do while on the clock, and one by one, we ticked the items off her bucket list. Throughout these adventures, my mom really lived -- she took a hip hop class with a "Hamilton" dancer; she finally got to visit her sister's grave in the UK; she reunited with her daughter and the granddaughter she hadn't seen in a decade. But without an income, the realities of unemployment loomed.
The documentary tells the story of this growing tension between freedom and a lack of security; it highlights the universal, and inevitable, role reversal of parent and child. And it shows the reality of life today for middle-class senior citizens.
Our Goal: 
One day, every one of us will need to step up for our mothers, in some way. Whether the Mom in your life is your biological mother, adopted mother, father, grandmother, teacher, or neighbor, let's give all of them an experience that they'll never forget. With your support, millions of sons and daughters around the world will watch "Duty Free" and be inspired to make memories with their mothers that will further bond them together.
More broadly speaking, we are living in a society that is leaving older generations behind. As demand for established skills shift and social security and pension plans remain woefully underfunded, the future well-being of older generations is unclear. 
Upon successful completion of our Kickstarter campaign, we will partner with a recognized streaming service to maximize the film's reach and foster empathy for our mothers everywhere -- they are our gems!
About the FIlmmaker:
  I've made a career out of telling important stories both in front of, and behind, the camera. I've contributed on-camera pieces to CNN, HLN, MTV, CBS and more, around pop culture and social justice issues. I've written for outlets across the lifestyle space, and created my own publication, Swagger, which now has over 1.5MM fans. Though I've told longer-form stories professionally, this is my first documentary.  
In today's oft-divisive world, I know this is my opportunity to tell a powerfully true story about someone we can all get behind: our moms. Along with an experienced production team, I'm excited to create an impactful movie that we believe speaks to millions.
About My Mom:
My mom has worked in hospitality her entire adult life. An immigrant from the outskirts of Liverpool, she arrived to the States in the late 60s as a cultural ambassador to from England; she taught Americans an English song, an English dance, and how to cook and typical English meal. She's gone on to spend decades at numerous Boston hotels in Housekeeping, and spent twelve at her most recent job.  My mom has one daughter who lives in England, and two sons, both on the East Coast.
Use of Campaign Proceeds:
Your money will go toward one thing: Production Costs -- which are outlined below.  
Our Crew: I'm so grateful to be working with a wonderful, passionate, and talented group of videographers, audio professionals, and editors (shout outs below!). They all need to get paid fairly. But beyond capturing the footage, we'll need sound engineers, color correctors, and other post-production staff to make this as beautiful as anything you've seen on Netflix or another service.  
Our Bucket List Items: The biggest-cost items are behind us. All seven of the future bucket list items will happen in the US (less cost!), but will require travel and associated fees to execute. Some upcoming bucket list items include skydiving, walking the Boston Marathon route, and returning to my mom's first home in Detroit.
How Many More Shoots: I estimate seven more bucket list shoots, with four shoots slotted for unplanned moments that require filming. Given my mom's shifting life, it's important to be ready to capture raw moments that no one could have expected. Most of these shoots will require a crew of four, around the country.  
Estimated Delivery: We plan to wrap up the larger shoots by the end of 2017, and edit through much of 2018. Estimated delivery is Fall 2018. My mom and I will not be using ANY of the funds for personal use.  
*Crew shoutout: Thank you to EVERYONE who has helped to make this happen -- Mom, Meredith Chin, Joey Dwyer, Barbaros Kaynak, Pierce Jackson, Ben Phelps, Miguel Rodriguez, The Sweet Family, Hope Easterbrook, The Carneys, The Mitchells, Cassandra Alcide, Joe Regis, Nimchy Regis, Jen Chadwick, The Nolans, The McCarthys, Nicole Ahern, Jen Gomo and everyone else I've called, emailed, asked for help, etc throughout this process!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge we'll face is being there for the twists and turns that come with my mom's current life situation. Without a consistent job and uncertainty with her housing, so many factors are at play. I want to be there to capture as many as possible to show what real life is like for her. Your donations will make it easier to drop everything and capture authentic moments in real time.

Luckily, I've found various folks along the way, from filmmakers to editors, to storytellers, and production managers, who are excited for this project and happy to help me see it to completion. If you want to help, please email me at dutyfreefilm@gmail.com.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

It's a special gift to last a lifetime.

campaign.story:
The 2016 Bloom
The Project
Ten Thousand Suns is a summer-long botanical performance started in the Summer of 2016 in which over 10,000 sunflower seeds were planted and nurtured over the course of the summer months on land that until recently sat under a highway, with high compaction, low-organic material, and embedded with toxicity. A portion of the performance is simply the presence of the community members who volunteered to care for the field, with no other motive than “developing” a garden/park for everyone to enjoy. 
Project location
The Planting 
Planting the seeds
The results from last year: After a long hot and dry couple of months, the first sunflower bloomed, and soon after others joined, like a slow fireworks display taking place in the coming weeks. It was now finally quite evident what we were up to all summer and the land became activated with a flurry of people inhabiting the space for a variety of unplanned intentions, including yoga, picnics, and music. The response was incredible. The simple joy that a simple flower could bring to people was the most consistent of comments I received, and one of my favorites, a young girl out with her mother on their evening stroll always insisted they go “the sunflower way.”
The People
The people of 10,000 SUNS
I found these responses rewarding, but perhaps even more so was the conversations I had through the summer as people approached me to ask about the project, and formed many new friendships I might of otherwise not of made. Simply seeing people take initiative to cultivate an idea seemed to evoke a new appreciation for what the urban landscape in Providence could be, raising the expectations for quality site-sensitive development that will inevitably one day be built on this land.
 The New Proposal
10,000 SUNS 2017 Proposal Image
Building upon the success of 10,000 Suns from the Summer and Fall of 2016, the project looks to add certain layers based on community feedback and lessons learned from last season to improve the growth and health of the sunflowers. 
Water
Help us put in temporary irrigation so we can sleep at night, rather than water. (Picture taken at 2:30am)
Watering was an issue in 2016 and the hours spent keeping the project going will be reduced this year by implementing a necessary, temporary, and simple irrigation system. It was also evident that the soil quality of the parcel was not conducive to optimal growth so we are looking for considerable addition of compost.
New Features
The added layers mentioned previously aim to make the field not only aesthetically significant but a place for respite. We propose relocating the strange border of granite curbs and repurposing them for seating amongst the sunflowers (seating was the most common request from the community). For simple shade for these areas we propose using a series of scattered Lombardy Poplar trees, which are very fast growing, tolerable to tough urban conditions, and with wonderful gold fall color.
Within each of the center of the circles of sunflowers, this year we propose an added surprise in each, whether it be a painted red piano, a set dining or chess table, or other interesting curiosity.
Also new to this we year we are proposing to  expand the project to the adjacent parcel. The addition creates a “river of meadow and sunflowers” and constructs a 10’ high landform with a winding grass path to the top, creating a unique perspective to the city and sunflower field. Two smaller landforms create more intimate seating spaces. This “River of Flowers” would be composed of both sunflowers and wildflower meadow mix. 
Please help us in the creation of this unique crowdfunded park for Providence.
2016 Proposal Drawing and Final Result
 Rewards
10,000 SUNS LOGO T-SHIRT W/ $50 DONATION

Save
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Some of the challenges we learned last year we are addressing with new additions to the project. We hope to add a temporary irrigation to create an efficient time and water-saving system, which will allow the project to thrive in both dry and wet periods. Given the popularity of last year's project we are also looking to expand our volunteer base to attend to the continued maintenance of the project throughout the summer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
SMOKO loves bringing joy to your everyday living. Like many folks, we really look forward to unwinding when we get home and getting a good night's rest before a brand new day. Sometimes it's hard to get good rest when the weather's being angry and we're not feeling our best. That's when we decided to create this gem!
Meet Elodie
Meet Elodie, she's a chubby unicorn reincarnated as a diffuser. We think she's pretty darned cute, if we do say so ourselves.
Elodie Mist Mode
This little hard working diffuser will work to humidify the air for a good six to eight hours. She's also equipped with timed auto shut-off modes. Amp up your relaxation by adding your own favorite essential oils (our go-to scent is lavender, gotta get that R&R!). 
Mist Mode
10-12 hours running time until water runs out
60, 90, 180 minutes auto shut-off
Multi-color Options
But, of course, Elodie doesn't stop there. In true magical fashion, Elodie has several different LED color options to help you set the mood.
Elodie and Kid
Elodie's friendly; she's pretty good with kids too!
Elodie's Hard Working
Elodie works hard so you can get well rested. We hope her presence leaves you feeling refreshed!
Elodie at Home
How cute is she?! When not in use she still manages to bring cuteness to your space.
CONCEPT SKETCHES
Elodie Unicorn Diffuser Concept Sketches
PROTOTYPE
Elodie Unicorn Diffuser 3D Prototype
PLEDGE REWARDS
Pledge Rewards
 Elodie Ceramic Mug
Elodie Unicorn Ceramic Mug
Elodie Mini Light (portable, 3 x AAA batteries required)
Elodie Unicorn Mini Ambient Light
Elodie Ceramic Ramen Bowl Set
Elodie Ramen Bowl Set
  Ramen Set is Two Bowls in One
Smoko Crew Mini Cruiser (Limited Edition)
Smoko Crew Mini Cruiser
Size: 22 x 6 x 3.5" Weight: 3.8 LB 3.25" Thick Aluminum truck ABEC-7 Carbon Bearing
SPECIFICATIONS
Dimension: 5L x 6W x 5H" 
Material: PP + ABS Plastic, multi-color LED light bulb
Weight: 12 OZ
Capacity: 200 ML
International buyer will receive international plug.
Powered by USB, Input: 5v 1A 
PROJECT TIMELINE:
May-June: Kickstarter campaign
June-July: building production mold 
August: preparing for shipment
September - October: estimated delivery

Please note: International backers will be responsible for applicable tariffs and customs fees.
LET'S KICK IT! 
For additional information, please visit our website www.smokonow.com  Life is fun with Smoko!

@Estaban T. You fill it up with water to the ridge or fill line. Then you can add several drops of HIGH quality pure essential oils. I use doTERRA brand but you should be able to find something in your area. You must use water with the diffuser. Also be sure to clean it periodically. I clean mine every couple of months with equal parts water and white vinegar. Run it for about a half hour.... also take a cotton swab and gently wipe the "sensor" at the bottom in order to remove any buildup on the sensor. You should have many years of use if you take care of it and maybe even if you don't. Cheers!!

campaign.story:
Set in a quiet beach town in grunge-saturated 1994, Pans puts a feminist twist on the classic, Peter Pan. Wynne Darling, 15, is physically broken, socially displaced, and emotionally torn between her newly separated parents. 
With nowhere to turn, Wynne hooks up with a new crowd led by bad boy skateboarder, Pete, and his riot grrrl sister, Belle. Surrounded by "lost boys” and with the help of found friendship, Wynne learns what it means to grow up of her own free will...
PLAY

Thematically, PANS is a deeply personal story about sexual assault and the isolation and shame that keeps many young women and girls from sharing their stories and outing their assailants. It's also the story of unlikely sisterhood, solidarity, and the timeless and systemic complexities of growing up girl. 
In this vert ramp meets surfer-bro Neverland, the “lost boys” are the skateboarders and the “pirates” are the surfers and Wendy/Wynne and Tinker Bell/Belle are teenage girls who must break out of their archetypal “mother” and “mean girl” molds in order to redefine who they are to each other and themselves. 
I wrote PANS to empower and validate teenage girls and embolden young women to be unapologetic in their art, awareness, and necessary rebellion.
Why "Peter Pan"?
I spent much of my childhood LOVING Peter and the lost boys while despising Wendy and Tinker Bell, who were depicted in the book and Disney adaptation as overly protective/maternal-to-a-fault/wet blanket (Wendy) and jealous/vindictive/mean spirited/mean girl (Tinker Bell).
In Peter’s world, as well as in my learned experience, boys were curious adventure-seekers who slouched and got dirty and had all kinds of fun being irresponsible and boyish. They were curfew-less mischief-makers, digging their tools into trees and their heels onto gas pedals. They crashed into each other with their bodies and everyone applauded. They were allowed to be WILD. 
Over the years I drew parallels between the story of Peter Pan and my own adolescence. I grew up, in the way Wendys do, and in doing so realized there was much more to this story—that in so many ways, Peter Pan represented what was lacking in fairy tales and bedtime stories and all works of art written, directed and conceived by men.
I read Barrie's Peter Pan several times through the years, always looking for a Wendy I couldn’t find. It became clear to me that while Wendy was intended to be the heroine all along—the protagonist—she remained practically invisible. Ubiquitous, yes, but also unnecessary—a girl transported into a world of boys only to be used as a sort of tool for contrast. Wendy's practicality and realism gave Peter and the boys that much more appeal. As for Wendy, we never got a chance to see her magic. And I realized I had been living my story within the pages of other people's manuscripts --  appeasing the stories of others, at the risk of losing my own. 
I wrote PANS to change the story—to change OUR story. 
 The Future is Female
Over the last decade, I have marveled at teenage destination sites like Teen Vogue, Rookie Mag, School of Doodle—all fearless in their exploration of issues pertaining specifically to teenage girls. I have also worked personally as a blogger on the Internet, uniting with women and girls in my community to support, elevate and empower female-driven storytelling. If girls and women are successfully finding and embracing themselves and each other on the Internet, why aren’t they seeing themselves on the big screen? Where are the films portraying the trials and triumphs of sisterhood, of girls fearlessly and shamelessly telling their truths? PANS is the movie I wished we had as teenaged girls. It's also the movie I wish we had now.
Me @ Wynne's age
So much kismet happened while working on PANS -- reminders at every turn that making this movie is not only important for me and countless other women, but young girls who don’t have the opportunity to watch their stories on the big screen -- specifically stories about what it means to rise up against rape and resist the culture that supports it.
In PANS, Wendy reclaims her power after being stripped of it by her assaulter and her female community who didn’t believe her side of the story. This theme resonates now more than ever.
In the last few months, I have looked to myself and other women in my community to be the leaders. I have looked to my peers and a younger generation of outspoken young people who are unafraid and unapologetic in their dissent. I have repeated ad nauseam to my children, to my family, to myself, that maybe it was never about one woman leading the free world but MILLIONS OF US leading ourselves and each other. Maybe WE ARE THE ONES WE'VE BEEN WAITING FOR. 
Sometimes it takes the rise of a villain for us all to become superheroes. And sometimes it takes writing fictional stories for us to realize our truths. If more women could tell the stories...if more women could cast more women, could hire more women, could explore more women’s stories, maybe we wouldn't have to fight so hard to be heard. 
Hollywood certainly prides itself on being a liberal mecca but pay attention and you'll see that toxic masculinity, whitewashing, racism, misogyny and chauvinism (showvanism?) are Hollywood institutions. Female directors STILL make up only 7% of the top 250 grossing films and the vast majority of films lack female representation behind the camera. 
ED: In 2014, 85% of films had no female directors, 80% had no female writers, 33% had no female producers, 78% had no female editors and 92% had no female cinematographers, according to the Center for the Study of Women in Television and Film at San Diego State University. And while sexism is CLEARLY a problem behind the scenes, on-screen storytelling ripples WORLDWIDE. Consumers have always been in control. We don't have to eat what is put on our plate. We can (and I believe we should) demand better. 
  We're incredibly excited to be working with actors Sydney Park (Walking Dead, Instant Mom, Once Upon) and Avan Jogia (Victorious, Tut, Midsummer Night's Dream.)
As well as casting an inclusive and female led cast, we are currently crewing up with the goal to employ as many women on set as possible.
And also to Danielle Hull for designing our T-shirts and pins! 
    You can snag your own by backing our campaign and strutting down the street in all of your unapologetic glory because YESSSSSSSSSS.
         We love you. We need you. (We are so grateful for your help!) 
Beyond donating to our campaign (THANK YOU SO INCREDIBLY MUCH!) we SO appreciate your support in helping us get the word out about this campaign. 
Crowdfunding is a grassroots effort and in order to make this campaign successful, we need YOU and your social media prowess! 
We would love for you to follow us on twitter, here, like us on Facebook, here, and join us on Instagram, here. PLEASE SHARE FAR AND WIDE with anyone you think might be interested in supporting our campaign! And also with people who might not be interested because YOU NEVER KNOW, YOU KNOW!? 
Thank you! We love you! SO much.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Raising money to fund a film about teenage girls rebelling against the nuances of rape culture is a bit of a challenge. The subject matter is something we take very seriously and our first priority is to support our teen heroines as well as women and girls who relate to the universality of Wynne and Belle's experiences. 

By supporting our project you are giving us the autonomy to tell our story authentically. 

Riot Grrl and Bikini Kill front woman Kathleen Hanna famously stood on her stage, microphone in hand and screamed, “GIRLS TO THE FRONT!” before playing her shows. She did this because she wanted girls and women to feel safe in the mosh pit. She wanted to create an atmosphere that empowered women and girls to find each other and help each other grow into better versions of themselves. And that is exactly what this film aims to do. 

Thank you so much for helping make our film come true.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Yes, we're still here. Better yet? We're back...
updates.update_content:
Dearest Backers,
I know.
It’s been… a while since I’ve updated Kickstarter on the progress of this project, but there are about a dozen reasons why and I’m going to try to make this as succinct as I can because… a lot of life happened since I last updated.

updates.update_userinfo: Yes, We're Alive! And very much KICKing!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Beloved Backers!
On behalf of Team Pans, we hope this update finds you well. As always we are so grateful for your support and patience as we navigate this WILD ride that is MOVIE MAKING. In other words, AHHHHH! and WOOOOHOOO! and AHHHHHHH! and SHAJHJKHJK.
Even though we've been quiet on the outside, we have been VERY LOUD and VERY BUSY behind the scenes. We are especially busy with casting and are VERY EXCITED to share that information with you when we are in the position to do so.
Since our last update, the PANS team continues to grow. Because of our amazing cast and crew, we have become a bigger and bolder project than originally anticipated. Which means, we still have much to do before we start principal photography.

Hey, Pans fam!
We hope this finds you well, wonderful and VERY cozy in your November best. Because it's November. Which is insane. 
Apologies (or should I say NO APOLOGIES!) for our lapse in updates but we have been VERY busy working on ALL SORTS OF THINGS and while we are unable to disclose much on the production front, we are ELATED to be working with a growing team of incredibly talented and passionate humans, all made possible with your support so THANK YOU, as always for backing our film.

Hey, friends!
We are two months post campaign and IT FEELS LIKE ONLY YESTERDAY... sort of. Okay so not really it actually feels like two months. Plus more months. It feels like MANY months. 
We would like to thank you all for your continued enthusiasm for this project. We are SO EXCITED that you are excited and can't wait to share more Pans production news when we can.

updates.update_userinfo: What Now + What Next? A quick update...
updates.update_content:
Hello incredible humans!
I hope this update finds you well, wonderful and enjoying the sweetest of summertime vibes...

updates.update_userinfo: We did it! Because of you. THANK YOU.
updates.update_content:
A few moments ago, our Pans Kickstarter campaign came to an end. I watched the clock as it ticked down and had one last battle cry -- of which there have been many -- over the last four weeks. 
Over the course of 28 days, 21 hours and eighteen minutes and with the love of 1501 backers, we made it to $117,579 which is just so beyond incredible. YOU GUYS. 
There are so many people I want to thank -- so many of my heroes and idols, mentors and guides, friends and family that have not only backed this project but reached out to me personally with support. To my sisters and brothers who elevated this campaign REPEATEDLY, who stood cheering as we pushed past each percentage point....

updates.update_userinfo: WE DID IT. And I cried.
updates.update_content:
Beloved Friends & Backers,
This morning we met our 100k goal. I was at Target shopping for poster board and laundry detergent. And pencils. And pillow cases. I also bought some yogurt, toothpaste, and bandaids. Anyway, I found out that we had reached our goal as I was pushing my cart to my car. 
And I cried.

updates.update_userinfo: T minus 6 days + last batch of rewards!
updates.update_content:
Good afternoon, AMAZING HUMANS! 
First off, yesterday we passed 1000 backers which is SO INCREDIBLY EXCITING and AMAZING and we are so totally grateful! 
As of right this very second, we are 87% funded thanks to 1,046 (!!!) backers and are WELL ON OUR WAY TO MEETING OUR GOAL!

campaign.story:
WHAT’S THIS ALL ABOUT THEN?
BEAST is a little gothic fairytale – the story of three generations of women dealing with the aftermath of divorce. When Alice’s mother, Grace, tells her that her father’s a “beast,” she begins to question who or what she really is.
We’re going for something along the lines of Pan’s Labyrinth meets Terms of Endearment – a sprinkling of magical realism mixed with a family drama.
We shot the bulk of the short film last year and headed back for one day in January. We were lucky enough to be supported by Creative England’s Emerging Talent scheme, which got us through the bulk of the shoot but now find ourselves in post production with our credit cards maxed out, desperate to finish our little movie.
WHO ARE YAS?!
LEONORA LONSDALE - WRITER/DIRECTOR 
A Student Academy award nominated filmmaker, Leonora's films have screened at festivals internationally, received a Hollywood Foreign Press grant and Jury Recognition Awards. She was selected as one of the 12 finalists of this year's iFeatures scheme and is currently in post-production on her documentary, Ziona. She received her MFA from NYU Tisch's graduate film program, which she attended with a scholarship.
Leonora Lonsdale
JACK SIDEY - WRITER/PRODUCER
Jack recently joined Oscar-winning Portobello Productions as Head of Film/Producer, developing a slate of film/tv and theatre projects. Previously, Jack worked at Working Title – most recently as Production Supervisor across their slate of movies. His credits there included: Hail Caesar, Legend, Everest, and The Theory of Everything. He has also produced music videos, comedy sketches for FunnyorDie, infomercials for the World Health Organisation and a handful of short films.
Jack Sidey
SOPHIE REYNOLDS - PRODUCER
Sophie produces short and feature length films through her own company Sona Films. She has previously worked as an assistant on international feature films such as Kingsmen: The Secret Service and A Monster Calls. She also produces commercials & branded content for brands such as Google, Samsung and EE. Sophie has produced several short films including award-winning Murmur (dir. Aurora Fearnley) and The Lights, which was part of Film London's 'London Calling' scheme.
Sophie Reynolds
MORE IMPORTANTLY… (OUR CAST)
We were lucky enough to work with three gob-smackingly brilliant actresses...
GRACE - Billie Piper
Billie Piper in Beast
Billie Piper recently wowed audiences with her performances in Yerma, for which which she won the Evening Standard & Critics Circle Awards for "Best Actress ". She has also just been nominated for an Olivier Award. Her recent film and TV credits include City of Tiny Lights, Penny Dreadful and Doctor Who.
PENELOPE - Sinéad Cusack
Sinéad Cusack in Beast
Sinéad Cusack is a two-time Tony-award nominated actress and former winner of the Evening Standard and Critics Circle Awards for Best Actress, and the Irish Film and Television award for Best Supporting Actress. Her numerous film and television credits include: V for Vendetta, North and South and Eastern Promises.
ALICE - Poppy Polivinick  
Poppy Polivnick in Beast
She may be only seven but Poppy can certainly hold her own on set. Poppy’s previous experiences include The Nest, acting alongside Vicky McClure, and the TV Series Man Up. A star in the making, Poppy blew us all away with her performance and heroic, humbling professionalism.
OUR CREW
From our mega talented DoP Patrick Meller (Best Cinematographer at the MVA's, nominated at Camerimage), to our Production Designer Extraordinaire Polly Davenport - we were blessed with an insanely talented crew. We’ll be updating y’all about the others in the not-too-distant. Watch. This. Space.
SO WHAT DO YOU NEED OUR MONEY FOR???
I know, right?! We’ve already shot the film… what could we possibly need? Well, we may have had to obliterate our collective credit cards to get us through the shoot. We weren’t expecting to have to pay for that final day. But going forward… we’re lucky enough to be pulling in favours from wonderfully generous folk all over the place but could really use some help to take this movie to the proverbial next level. So… some examples of where any money would be going:
EDITING – We’re lucky enough to be working with Matthew Gray (This is England 90 among others) and would love to be able to pay him for a little more of his time – even at an extremely generously reduced rate.
MUSIC – The big one. The missing link – capable of elevating our little film and taking it beyond low-budget amateur status. We have a terrific composer and music editor helping us, Yann McCullough, who’s music editor credits include teeny films you’ve probably never heard of like Spectre, Ex Machina and Brooklyn. We’d absolutely love to be able to have him record with a big ol’ orchestra. And we’d love a little extra dosh for a cripplingly expensive music license or two.
ANIMATION – So… we don’t wanna spoil anything for you but we do have a little animation sequence in the film – or we will do, if we’re successful here. We’re very proud of spotting our director of animation, Jac Clinch, whilst he was still studying at the National Film & Television School. He’s since been Bafta-nominated, and we’d love to be able to give him the time and tools to make something really special, that we think will really enhance the film.
Jac Clinch's "The Alan Dimension"
  Course, there’s loads of other bits and bobs, and we’ve been bowled over (as they say) by our collaborators' generosity, but we don’t wanna give you an essay to digest so we’ll leave this at that.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks? Challenges? Pffff…We hope there aren’t any on the horizon. We just really want to make the best movie possible. That would be nice, wouldn’t it?
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Finished Archaeopteryx Prototype, Posing on a Beach
  Hello Kickstarter! My name is Rebecca Groom, and I am the person behind Palaeoplushies™; a series of realistic soft sculpture dinosaurs that I design and sew myself. I have previously run a successful Kickstarter campaign to produce Velociraptor plushies and other Velociraptor-related goodies. My focus on scientific accuracy has been warmly received by palaeo-fans and those from the palaeontological community alike.
The experience of running the previous Kickstarter has taught me a lot about the plush manufacturing process what to be prepared for. This time I hope to put that knowledge to good use to produce a number of life-size, accurate Archaeopteryx soft toys! I aim to make the toys bigger, fluffier and more cuddly than the Velociraptors, whilst retaining their palaeontological accuracy.
Archaeopteryx is an iconic bird-like dinosaur known from the Late Jurassic (150mya) of southern Germany. It was first named from a single feather in 1861, there are now 12 mostly complete fossils known. The largest species, Archaeopteryx lithographica, could grow to around 50cm in length.
Often touted as the "first bird", or Urvogel, it is a small theropod dinosaur closely related to dromaeosaurids such as Velociraptor. Is often used as an example of a "transitional fossil" as it has features of both birds and extinct non-avian dinosaurs. It was discovered two years after Darwin's publication of On the Origin of Species and played a part in confirming Darwin's hypothesis.
A lot is known about Archaeopteryx' life appearance as there are a number of complete fossils known, often showing beautifully preserved feathers. Archaeopteryx had multiple layers of stiff flight feathers, whilst the body may have been covered in more fluffy, fur-like feathers (1). It sported "trousers" of stiffer feathers around it's legs (2). The presence of preserved melanosomes found in the wing coverts indicates that they were likely to have been black (3). Black feathers are stronger than lighter coloured feathers in modern birds, so dark pigmentation in the flight feathers is very possible for Archaeopteryx.
For such a well-known and historically important species, it has surprisingly little representation in the way of educational toys. Those that do exist are often inaccurate and don't do a good job of showing our current knowledge of how this species would've really looked. I hope to change that by bringing a life-size (~50cm long) fluffy Archaeopteryx to life in the form of a soft toy, as well as pin badges, t-shirts and other Archaeopteryx themed products.
References
1) Christensen, P; Bonde, N. (2004). "Body plumage in Archaeopteryx: a review, and new evidence from the Berlin specimen". Comptes Rendus Palevol. 3 (2): 99–118.
2) Longrich, N. (2006). "Structure and function of hindlimb feathers in Archaeopteryx lithographica". Paleobiology. 32 (3): 417–431.
3) Vinther, Jakob (1 June 2015). "A guide to the field of palaeo colour". BioEssays. 37 (6): 643–656.
  I produced the initial design (Fig. 1) to get an idea of the kind of product I wanted to see made. The first prototype was designed and sewn by me (Fig. 2 "Originalopteryx"), the pattern I created was then sent off to the company Shinedown plush who have worked with the factories on my behalf to produce a plush that matches my vision as best possible. We've been through a number of samples and prototypes (Fig. 2) to get to the finished design that I'm very happy with!
The Finished Archaeopteryx Prototype
Whilst this was all going on I was busy designing pin badges, T-shirts and the like. I have companies lined up already to produce all these items, so all that is left to do is to raise the funds!
   Plush Production - Over half of the cost is for the production of the plushies, including development costs and safety testing.
Fees and Taxes - The boring bit! This covers Kickstarter's fees, card payment fees and customs duty when importing the plushies to the UK.
Shipping - Another large chunk of the cost goes towards shipping. The plushies will be shipped to me, and then I will ship all the incentives out to my backers!
Incentives - This is how much it will cost to produce all the rewards such as embroidered patches, badges and t-shirts!
Unforeseen Circumstances - Most of the time, the unexpected happens. I've budgeted a little extra in case of surprise fees, price fluctuations or miscalculations. This gives me a little wriggle room!
    Pin Badge- Your choice of one "Natural" or one "Black and Gold" 30 mm enamel pin badge of a heraldic Archaeopteryx design! The Natural pin will feature translucent enamel dark coloured wings to simulate iridescence that may have been present in life. The "Black and Gold" pin will be gold plated with black hard enamel fills. Add £6 to pledge for one add-on pin badge of your choice
Embroidered Patch- a 70mm embroidered patch with an iron-on backing (can still be hand-sewn if you'd like!) featuring a heraldic Archaeopteryx on a shield. Add £4 to pledge for add-on Embroidered Patch
T-shirt- Heather-effect Grey t-shirt available in sizes XS to 2XL. The heraldic Archaeopteryx design will be discharge-ink printed. This process removes colour from the shirt rather than laying ink onto the surface, resulting in a more hard-wearing design with a much softer finish which should survive the life of the shirt! Add £18 to pledge for add-on T-shirt
Lifesize Archaeopteryx Plush - The main event! These plush toys are 47cm long, which is around the upper limit of a large Archaeopteryx lithographica. They have printed details on the feet and beak, with two small soft claws poking out of each wing. Embroidered details on the wings and tail show feather patterns. They have blue-grey plastic safety eyes. These toys will be EN71 Safety Tested and should be suitable for children over 3 years of age. Add £30 to pledge for add-on Plush
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project, there's always unforeseen risks and challenges. I have completed a successful similar Kickstarter before I have already encountered a few of the things that can go wrong- luckily everything went smoothly in the end and I know what to expect this time! 

For example, last time I was hit with unexpected customs charges, this time I have taken this into account in the budget. I'll also strive to improve the postage and packaging this time, as a few pin badges were damaged in the post by the postal franking machines, this time I will send them in protective card boxes.

One possible cause of delay would be due to the manufacturing process- as I've already approved the samples so we should be ready to go with manufature as soon as payment has cleared. There might be slight variations of the final product from the samples, which can be expected in larger runs of plushies. I will keep everyone informed when it comes to production updates and will let everyone know if I think we're going to encounter delays.

The pin badges, t-shirts and embroidered patches will probably be ready sooner than the plushies. I will be using UK based companies I already have a working relationship with, and they've proved reliable in the past- their products are of a high quality and are produced quickly. 

I've already made arrangements with the local post office and warned them in advance of the large quantity of items I might want to drop off one day!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello all!

I hope you're all doing well and you've all received your items by now! (If not, shoot me a message and I'll sort it out!)

I just wanted to let you all know I've started another, much smaller Kickstarter project, this time to get some T-shirts featuring a heraldic style Microraptor made. They'll be the same style shirts as the Archaeopteryx ones, but in black.

Hello everyone!

This is just a quick notification for people still awaiting their plushies.

I'm really sorry but a few of the orders were delayed at the Post Office -  I dropped the last lot of around 150 parcels off before I was away for 3 weeks and it turned out I didn't quite have enough on my Drop and Go card to cover all the orders. Around 10 parcels were held at the Post Office until I got back (I was out the country and my phone wasn't working so the Post Office had no way of contacting me to top up like they normally do).
As such, a few of the orders were only just shipped on the 1st June so may take a bit longer to arrive. If you have any concerns, contact me and I can check if your order was one of the ones effected by this.

I really appreciate everyone's continued support, understanding and patience.

I hope everyone is having a lovely spring (or autumn if you're in the Southern hemisphere).

All the best,
Rebecca

Hi all!

Just a follow-up to my last update as there's been quite a few questions.

I haven't received an email from Backerkit saying my item is shipped, should I be worried?
No! Don't worry. They've all been shipped, some people have received confirmation from Backerkit, other people haven't and I'm not sure why. If you log into Backerkit itself it should be marked down as shipped.

This is to let you all know that -all- the Archaeopteryx are now shipped and you should've received notifications via Backerkit. I've been packing and posting them in batches over the past 2 weeks so some have already arrived, yay!

I've dropped the last car load of orders off at the Post Office today, and they should be processed by Wednesday at the latest.

Did you know a Citroen C1 can carry at least 130 Archaeopteryx? No? Well, you do now.

Keep an eye out for parcels over the next few weeks! UK parcels should be here this week at the latest as well as other EU ones, parcels heading further afield could take 2-3 weeks depending on customs etc.

I'm so glad they're all done now packing 400+ Archaeopteryx and all the extras myself seemed like a better idea before I started, but they're done now! Thanks everyone for your patience!

updates.update_userinfo: Archaeopteryx set to arrive on the 17th April!
updates.update_content:
Hello!

Just a quick update for you all. The Archaeopteryx will be delivered to me on the 17th April and I plan on posting them out to folks ASAP.
I plan on shipping in this order:

-Backers who pledged for Archaeopteryx-only
-Backers who pledged for Archaeopteryx + small items
-Backers who pledged for Archaeopteryx + t-shirts

updates.update_userinfo: Plushies Inbound, set for Week of 16th April
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!

Once again I'd like to thank you all for your patience and understanding. There's been a few delays outside of my control, so I thank you profusely for not being too annoyed about this.
I've just had a call from the Logistics company handling the importing of the plushies for me. They've informed me that they were shipped from the US around a week ago, so are set to be delivered on what should be the week of the 16th April. I plan on beginning to ship them to backers ASAP.

updates.update_userinfo: Plushies are -still- on their way. For real this time.
updates.update_content:
Hello!
Thank you all for your patience.
I've been chasing up the plushie's location- it turns out that they were delayed upon export from the USA due to a safety inspection/trademark inspection, something to do with EU customs. They'll be in UK inbound customs within 2 weeks, and from there they will be transported to Scotland for me.

Hello!

Just a quick update to keep everyone in the loop. Plushies are still on their way to me, somewhere between the USA and the UK.
I haven't heard anything so I'm hoping they'll turn up any day now. If they haven't arrived soon I'll be chasing up on their location.

updates.update_userinfo: Plushies are still on their way to me! + Addresses unlocked on Backerkit.
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! I hope you've all had a good Christmas and a Happy New Year!

Just to let everyone know I've paid for the final shipment of the plushies from the USA to the UK. They should be on their way to me soon. They're coming by ocean again so it could be a month or so until they arrive.

I've also unlocked everyone's surveys on Backerkit as it's been much longer than expected and I'm sure a few people will need to change their addresses/update details. I'll let everyone know when they arrive and when I'll be shipping them. I hope to here.

campaign.story:
"Mischief is the only word that can be used in regard to Brownies. They are small, they are noisy and they are the biggest show-offs you are ever likely to meet.
Naked and hairy with outrageous hair and beards, pink naked bottoms and sticky-out ears, they are, on the surface, seemingly harmless and rather amusing."  - Excerpt from Strangehollow
Hi, I’m Emily and I have been fascinated by everything to do with myths, folklore and fairytales since I was a very little person. I suspect that one reason I was so drawn to the strange and mysterious side of things is that I grew up living next to a tumbledown old barrow known as The Fairy Toot, and I'm sure some of the strange fairy magic made its way into my subconscious. 
Your pledge will help me to produce a beautiful art book filled with whimsical watercolour paintings and drawings. I am so excited to share Strangehollow with you!
(Note for everyone! All backers over £20 will have any stretch goal bonuses past and future added to their rewards, don't worry if it doesn't mention it in your reward tier)
  (Mock up image of how the book might look)
Strangehollow will be 10 x 8 inches perfect bound, with a matt laminated cover and at least 60 interior pages filled with watercolour paintings and detailed descriptions about the forest and its inhabitants.

A BIG THANK YOU
To my beloved Matt who is my best friend, partner and an endless stream of inspiration for me. You are my rock.
To my patrons. This would not have been possible in so little time were it not for my amazing patrons. I have been running my Patreon page for just over a year and the support and feedback from my patrons has been so valuable. They have made brilliant suggestions and have given me nothing but support, it means the world to me. 
To Katie Stork for the amazing proofreading.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks are very low. I have successfully self published and produced three books with my partner Matt Dixon. I have been creating artwork to deadlines for many years so I am confident that I can bring you a high quality product. The artwork for the book is finished and all that remains is completing the layout and the commissions.

Payments process within 2 weeks of the end of the campaign and I have set aside time to complete the commissions and rewards generated by the project, so I hope to be able to start sending out your orders in August barring illness or unforeseen difficulties!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Countdown To My New Book - Cauldron!
updates.update_content:
One year ago today my Strangehollow book project came to an end here on Kickstarter. You all made it the most incredible experience!
I’m currently working on a new book which I hope will be ready to launch here by the end of June! It is about witches! There may even be the odd character from Strangehollow in there...
Thank you all so much for your support for my book, you have literally changed my life! If you’re interested to get sneaky peeks of the making of the book and get involved with naming of characters etc then you can always join me on Patreon. There are lots of other exclusives too including discounts and prints and videos! www.patreon.com/artbyemilyhare

Hi folks!
I hope all is well with you and that you're looking forward to springtime as much as I am (at least in the northern hemisphere!). 
I wanted to give a heads up for my very amazing other half, Matt Dixon for his new kickstarter which has just launched today. I know it's not creatures, but it's worth a look if you like gorgeous robots with loads of character!

campaign.story:
Over a year ago, we began working on our ambitious project- filming a full, shot-for-shot, scene-for-scene, exact remake of Dirty Dancing. 
What started as a joke between a few friends and coworkers has blossomed into a driven passion project that’s been the main focus of our lives for the past 14 months. Over the summer, with your help, we were able to raise $300 dollars to buy a microphone and several key costume components, rent a steadicam and a dance rehearsal space, and of course, satisfy all of Ben’s fondue needs.
More than anything, our initial Kickstarter helped spread word of our project. The support we’ve received from friends, both old and brand new, has been nothing short of amazing. Your kind words, your financial donations, but most importantly your belief in us, has helped us see this project through to its final stages.
Our original goal was to release this past fall, but due to conflicts in scheduling, and ultimately our desire to deliver the highest quality product we were capable of, we decided to delay our release. For those of you who have not been following our progress, we have since been on a production-tear. We re-filmed scenes that were lacking, became more active in releasing weekly content, and we nailed down our technique for getting the most out of every scene.
Recently we were stunned by the news that ABC is trying to rip us off by creating a Dirty Dancing remake of their own, premiering May 24th. We’ve never been afraid of the bigger guy, and so we’ve set a hard deadline to premier on May 23rd. It’s a classic match-up, David vs. Goliath, Rocky vs. Apollo Creed, Johnny Castle vs. Robbie Gould - and we will not be beaten. We’re confident with our progress, and our non-stop coordinating, filming, and editing has paid off in now having over an hour of complete, edited footage! With that being said, we have just over a month of filming - and a few very important scenes left (including one involving Baby and the world’s smallest corner). When we set out to make this film, we did so with the intention of doing our due diligence to the original film - and as such we don’t want to cut corners in the filming of some of the film’s most iconic scenes (unlike ABC).
We are setting a goal for $2000 dollars to pay for the following:
1. Renting locations for three huge shoot days. 
2. Paying additional camera personnel to help out on those shoot days.  
3. Any excess funds we have will go towards renting a screening space for our premiere on May 23rd.
We want to thank you for taking part in this crazy journey with us, and regardless of whether you can donate or not- we’re glad to have you with us. Please stay posted for information of our premiere on May 23rd. And follow us on instagram @boiz.club.fancy.pants for all of the Boiz Club Dirty Dancing content you could ever desire.
Yours in love, fashion, and the dirtiest dancing,
Boiz Club Fancy Pants
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks: 
As we mentioned the first time around, the main risk of donating to our project is that nobody will care! Are we just shouting in an empty room?
We don't particularly care. 
We're going to see this project through to the end. Whether we make $2000 from this Kickstarter or $2, we're going to finish it before May 23rd. We're going to be the second best version of Dirty Dancing and the first best remake. We have loved, and are going to love, every second of the process. It's never been about money, publicity, or playing by the rules. It's always been, and always will be, about doing this because it's a great fucking time. And when we're finished with this project we'll move on to the next one. That's our promise to you.


Challenges: 
The main challenges we face at this point are the amount we have left to film, and financing the final locations. To address these challenges we have created an intricate production schedule, along with shot-lists to ensure we will be finished before our May 23rd deadline. We have also worked tirelessly to locate spaces in NYC for our final scenes, and we have put deposits down on the dates we are filming.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Arcana: Secrets or Mysteries.
Arcana Creamery was created out of Ryan Kurr's passion for ice cream. He saw the potential for it to be used as a tool for communication, using the dessert as a creative way to express ideas, emotions and inspire thoughts, smiles and feelings in those who taste it. There are only a few places in New Orleans that have great ice cream, and Arcana's secret is making thoughtful ice cream with interesting and unique flavors, using great local ingredients. Arcana will be a place to enjoy delicious ice cream and coffee with the carefree abandon of a summer day, with a little help from ice cream lovers like you!
We are raising funds to help bring this idea to fruition! The money raised will help secure the location, help purchase equipment and assist with the build out of the space so we can serve the community-and we can't wait to do it! We plan to include local businesses in our promotions and outreach programs to further encourage a sense of diverse community and build on what makes New Orleans so special, so unique.
We know what we're doing too, Ryan Kurr is a trained Pastry Chef having worked under numerous high profile Chefs across Chicago and New Orleans and the General Manager, John Pagliai, grew up in the restaurant industry and has had management experience with large scale groups like Lettuce Entertain You, Foodlife and Boka Restaurant Group. Our creative Graphic Designer Allison Layman has utilized her skills in design and combined it with her impeccable attention to detail to help create the unique aesthetic for the mysterious Arcana Creamery brand. 
Musically inspired flavors like "Hey Jupiter" (Smoked Blueberry and Roasted Cinnamon) will be a part of the rotating flavor menu.
  "Pennies From Heaven" Hibiscus ice cream with an orange blossom marshmallow swirl and white chocolate pennies.
  Arcana will offer a rotating menu with a few select staples. There will be a flavor for each Zodiac sign that will only be available during its own time of the year. Sorbet and vegan ice creams available too!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

Ryan has been a part of other businesses, some successful and others not, giving him an idea how what to do and not to do when starting a business. Any business venture is a risk, but with open communication between Arcana Creamery and the community of New Orleans, small business assistance programs and people such as yourselves, the venture will be a successful one and a great addition to this magical city for all the enjoy.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Arcana would like to thank each and every one of you that helped us meet and exceed our goal, a very unexpected and inspiring surprise! Thank you to everyone who contributed, encouraged and helped spread the word! Arcana Creamery is on the way to fruition...truly a magical dream come true.

Thanks to all of your support, we met our goal! This is truly the most exciting experience and thank you all for being a part of it; it is greatly appreciated! Arcana is looking forward to serving you soon!
We are now 93% funded! Only a little bit more to go; thank you so much for each and every one of you and your confidence and support!

Wow!! In just under 24 hours, I'm already over halfway to my goal! Thank you all so much for the continued support and confidence in my vision and passion. Let's try and keep a buzz going; I have so many flavors I want to share with all of you!

Congratulations, Ryan!

campaign.story:
The Anka Cooperative helps Syrian refugee women reach for more.
The purchase of ONE RUG 
Will empower and employ ONE REFUGEE 
For up to ONE YEAR.
Background 
10,000 refugees lived in Turkey in 2012. Within five years, as the Syrian conflict raged and destroyed lives, the number of refugees has swelled to over 3 million.
The vast majority of these refugees struggle to find the work necessary to support their families and provide meaning in their own lives. They are forced to depend on others for their own well-being.
Ms. Hind weaves a Shirvan carpet Sanliurfa refugee camp
The Anka Cooperative is a social enterprise created to empower Syrian women refugees by teaching them transferable skills, providing them dignifying work, and enabling cultural integration into their new society through the creation of fine carpets and traditional crafts.
We currently empower 250 weavers in two camps. By pledging for a world-class quality carpet through this campaign, you'll allow us to expand into a third refugee camp and employ more weavers. 
This Kickstarter will sustain our initiative and move us towards our goal of impacting 20,000 refugees by 2020.
Join us! 
One weaver can knot about 10 sq ft per month; this rug will employ these women for nearly a year
  Our Rugs
We have partnered with Woven Legends, an industry leader for decades, to make the highest quality rugs in the world.
Hertz 8x10––Woven in Adiyaman Camp, this rug employed one refugee for over 8 months and contains nearly 650,000 knots
  This peaceful Ushak is both calming and inspiring
  All our rugs are painstakingly designed and inspired by carpets made in the 14th to 18th centuries
  Wool: we only use hand spun, lanolin rich wool sourced from sheep free grazing in Eastern Anatolia. The wool is never treated to chemicals through the cleaning process, resulting in lustrous and stronger yarn, giving the finished rug a glowing aura that will last for a century or more.
Dyes: we only use the highest quality natural, vegetal dyes. Naturally-dyed carpets will not fade and the colors will never run––they blend poetically and the color and richness will last for generations.
Naturally Dyed Handspun Wool
Weaving: we partner with master craftswomen to train, supervise, and instruct our weavers. Progress and quality are examined multiple times per day. Our refugee weavers respond well to the challenge of learning this skill.
Finishing: when a rug is finally cut from the loom after months of weaving, we triple wash the rug using cold water, then press it to ensure it retains its intended shape.
Over one million knots in this rug have been individually inspected for quality prior to final shipment
Our Story
The Anka Cooperative has already had an extraordinary impact on women’s lives.
One of these women is Neriman from Damascus. Neriman is in her early 40s and has six children. Unlike many of her unfortunate relatives, she made it safely to the Adiyaman refugee camp in Southeastern Turkey. Neriman is college educated, and prior to the war she worked for many years as an accountant. But in the camps, of course, there are no accounting jobs, no freelancer websites to apply her trade. Idle time brings painful memories. She jumped at the chance to work at the carpet workshop. It’s a new skill, but she is learning––and just as important, she is earning.
Neriman is paid the same as her Turkish counterparts. She is saving to buy gold earrings for her daughters, and hopes to save for a home for when they return to Syria. Neriman represents the 250 Anka weavers who have chosen to make the best of their difficult circumstances, and are the reason Anka exists.
Where We Work
Our workshop in Sanliurfa empowers 25 women in a safe, clean environment
Sanliurfa: The Sanliurfa camp has a capacity 10,000 and a current population 14,000 living in containers. The camp has paved streets, lighting, water, sewer, A/C, and even a TV. It's a secure facility but residents can come and go as they please. The weaving workshop is in an activity center that also houses an art room, restrooms and laundry facilities. We employ 25-30 weavers in a well lit and ventilated hall with windows and A/C.
Neriman weaves with her daughter after school in one of our six workshop tents in Adiyaman refugee camp
Adiyaman: The Adiyaman camp has a capacity of 20,000 and a current population 29,000 living in tents. It has paved streets, lighting, water, sewer, A/C, and TV. It's also a secure facility but residents can come and go as they please. The weaving workshops are in six tents. We employ 225 weavers in a well lit and ventilated tents with windows and A/C.
Our future site in the Gaziantep Refugee camp in S/E Turkey
Coming in 2017, Gaziantep: This campaign will allow us to expand. We have been approached by camp management to expand our training and empowerment model the refugee camp in Gaziantep, Turkey. This expansion will cost the Anka Cooperative over $100,000 for looms, supplies, training, transportation, instruction, etc.
The Three Pillars of The Anka Cooperative
Empowerment Through Employment: The weavers love their work, not only for the income, but also because it provides companionship and a place to share laughs and to stay active. As a skilled weaver can weave up to 10 sq feet per month, an 9'x12' rug will employ one weaver for nearly one year. Weavers are paid the exact same as Turkish weavers.
These women proudly display this rug they crafted for an Embassy in Turkey
Cultural Integration: The Anka Cooperative helps refugees learn traditional Turkish language, culture and customs by learning the craft of weaving and by interacting daily with Turkish teachers. We partner with other charities to expand our reach beyond the refugee camps.
Many of our rugs will delight children of all ages
Education & Awareness: We use our proceeds to support charitable organizations that tell stories of refugees' lives and struggle for dignity. We further strive to share our fundamental belief that empowerment and dignity comes from work, not a handout. We teach women to fish, we don't give them fish.
Teaching Her How to Fish
  Rewards  
$25: Rug Coasters
Reflect on your impact with every sip when you back us at this level
  $50: Framed Rug Fragment
Show your support for Anka by hanging this handmade carpet fragment in your home or office
  $250: Carpet Christmas Stockings
Stunning and meaningful Christmas stockings are made from world class handwoven rug fragments.
––– 
We have a variety of already woven rugs we are offering as rewards. See them below, and click on each tier link to see more options. You will be able to pick your rug during the survey after the campaign.
–––
$500: Petite Rugs (up to 2x3 feet). Click HERE to see all available options. 
This Flower of Life contains over 50,000 knots and employed one weaver for over two weeks
–––
$1,000: Small “Teach her How to Fish”, Ushak  or other Rug (up to 3x5 feet). Click HERE to see all available options. 
Teach a Woman to Fish and Feed Her for a Lifetime
  This 3'X5' Ushak rug has over 80,000 knots and was handcrafted in Adiyaman refugee camp
–––
$2,500: Medium Firework, Runner or other rug (up to 3x12 feet). Click HERE to see all available options.
This stunning Runner was crafted in Adiyaman refugee camp and could be yours when you show your support
  Let your colors burst by selecting this joyful, modernist, Stream of Consciousness, creative outlet. This is one of the first rugs that our refugee weavers will learn
–––
$5,000: Large Folklife, Tribal, or other rug (up to 7x9 feet). Click HERE to see all available options.
  Functional, Flavforful and Fun - these Folklife rugs are designed by the weavers who draw upon inspiration in their surroundings from before the war
  Geometric and lively, these colorful Tribal rugs contain traditional designs that continue to inspire
 –––
$7500: Grand Ushak, Heriz, or other rug (up to 8x10 feet). Click HERE to see all available options.
  The twin of this rug is on permanent display in a famous NYC Museum
  ...And here are the women who made it
–––
$9,850: Extra grand Heriz, Khotan or other rug (up to 10x14 feet). Click HERE to see all available options.
Display this stunning Heriz in your home or office
–––
$15,000: Fouier Carpet (up to 11x15 feet). Click HERE to see all available options.
This inspiring Heriz is handcrafted of nearly 1,500,000 individual knots. Selecting this rug will employ and employ one refugee for over 18 months
–––
$25,000: Museum Carpet (up to 12x18 feet). Click HERE to see all available options.
Selecting rugs at this level will employ and empower one Syrian refugee for over two years. These rugs are handcrafted from over 2,000,000 knots
–––
$35,000: Palace Carpet (up to 15x20 feet). Click HERE to see all available options.
Worthy of a palace, these rugs are made of nearly 4,000,000 knots. Your selection of rugs at this reward level will employ and empower one refugee weaver for over three years
Why Kickstarter? 
We have been recently asked by the refugee camp management to expand our empowerment and employment model in Gaziantep, Turkey. While we're thrilled about the possibility of helping so many more refugees, the cost of establishing a new operation is challenging. Kickstarter provides us a unique platform to raise awareness about our approach to sustainably helping refugees.

Our Team 
Fatima, Hind and all the refugees we work with
Fatima and Hind both arrived in the Sanliurfa refugee camps almost in 2012.  After a struggle of several months, Hind came to the camp from her hometown of Hama––a city which dates back to Biblical times. Fatima arrived from Edlin––this town was one of the first to rebel against the Assad regime. Since they began weaving in 2013 they have become the very best of friends. Both in their mid 30s, the ladies enjoy their work as they laugh and socialize. They represent the 250 Anka weavers that have chosen to make the best of their difficult circumstances. It’s an honor to have them on our team, as they are our reason Anka exists.
Neslihan, CoFounder and Volunteer CEO
As the founder of Woven Legends, Neslihan has been producing high quality, hand-crafted carpets for over 35 years and has won numerous international awards for her carpets which are considered to be among the finest in the world. Neslihan has often been credited with birthing the rug renaissance in 1980’s by exclusive use of handspun wool and natural dyes.
In 2012, she approached local officials in Turkey in order to teach weaving skills to Syrian refugee women at the camps. As an American and a native Turk, Neslihan feels a personal and moral obligation to support the Syrian refugees in Turkey. Through Anka, she has pioneered the idea of sustaining their livelihoods by promoting the art of carpet weaving. Her personal rapport with the refugees convinced her that Anka can expand from serving 250 refugee women to empowering 20,000 refugees by 2020.
Neslihan has one son, Kent, and considers the tens of thousands of women she has empowered over the decades as her many daughters.
Josh, CoFounder and Volunteer Chief Strategy Officer 
Josh and friends in Sanliurfa camp - Oct, 2016
Having lived, worked and volunteered on four continents, Josh brings a global and practical approach to helping fulfill Anka’s mission––to provide dignity of work, transfer of skills and cultural integration through the creation of traditional crafts.
Deeply affected by the refugee crisis he saw while working in Turkey, Josh identified ways for US businesses to lend their expertise to help address this humanitarian dilemma. 
Josh is especially grateful of all those who work to support refugee issues. He would also like to thank The University of Notre Dame's Fellow Irish Social Hub and the incredibly supportive ND family!
Thank you for visiting our Kickstarter!  
Actual sketch by Syrian Refugee and the inspiration for our name: "Anka" - a mythical bird that which obtains new life by arising from its ashes.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our co-founder is Turkish-American and has been training women to weave rugs for 35+ years. We have excellent relations with the management of the refugee camps, and have been working there for 5 years. We currently have over 500 existing rugs that are awaiting a new home. 

The risk and challenge we may have is keeping up with demand. We're hopeful to take on this challenge as we will then be able to sustainably empower so many more refugees. We feel confident we will be able to follow through, and will keep you updated along the way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfilling Your Orders and Our Dreams
updates.update_content:
Friends, Colleagues and dear Backers, 
So sorry it's been a while since the last update. It's been an extraordinarily busy time. Please allow me to walk through the last few weeks, and let you know about next steps. 
Neslihan Went to Turkey...

I'm at a complete loss for words. We did it! YOU did it. Our initial goal was to raise $20,000 to help with our marketing efforts so we could eventually raise $100,000 to open a working in a third refugee camp. Amazingly, thanks you all the generous Kickstarter Backers, we have reached the $100k milestone faster than we dreamed. 
So, what's next?

updates.update_userinfo: Can we finish the race to 100? Only with your help!
updates.update_content:
It's been a wonderful journey these last three weeks - thanks to all of you who have supported and shared our cause.
In our final 7 days of the campaign, we are please to announce our final stretch goal: $100,000.
To support the race to $100k, we're now offering new incentives. These will automatically apply to anyone who has previously backed the campaign.

We're heading into our 3rd week of our campaign and have been so encouraged by the outpouring of support so far. 
We're thrilled to announce our campaign Stretch Goal of $50,000! 
Heading into the final two weeks of this campaign but we still have a lot of ground to cover. The startup costs for expanding into a 3rd refugee camp in Gaziantep will be over $100,000. Our KS campaign is helping us to make great strides towards this objective.

Backers, Supporters, Encouragers, Sharers
Thank you so very much for all your support. We reached over 115% of our goal in less than 25% of our campaign. This is really encouraging. 
More work remains however as the more we raise, the more we can help refugees. 
Please continue to share with your friends, family and contacts to support this worthy cause.

comments.content: But these coasters are made well, too good for me! hehe

Hello. Can you kindly let me know when would my reward be shipped? I haven't received any confirmation or tracking number for the shipment, nor have I received any packages. It's becoming a bit concerning for me as some backers have commented that they received the shipment last month.

Got my coasters today and they're even more beautiful then I expected! I'm afraid to use them because I don't want to mess them up! Lol Thanks again and I look forward to any future projects you start on Kickstarter!
Thank you very much. I've already hanged the piece of rug/carpet frame. It is a symbol of peace. Good luck with everything!

We are very happy that your project become a success and inspiring story for us, on behalf our team at safaroma ( http://kck.st/2pZhXRz ), Please accept our warmest congratulations - We are glad that your project represents the beautiful Syrian culture.
G

This is a wonderful project! I am a weaver myself, and I know how much satisfaction and peace can be created with this craft. I have in the past worked with children in California and will again volunteer at the Gaenslen School in Milwaukee in June. Very excited about the coasters!
Best wishes to all involved.

I am very touched and deeply impressed. I am not sure how to reach out to the founder, but in the future I have a vision for a joint project I have thought about for many years. I would like to do a write up for my blog as well.
Go AnkaCoop go!

campaign.story:
Littlefield performance and art space has been an avid supporter of comedy, live music, art, film, theater, dance, game shows, and everything eclectic since opening its doors in 2009. As one of the first commercial businesses to establish itself in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Gowanus, we're proud to be a part of this community.
By pledging to our project you have the opportunity to get some limited edition rewards including:
• free tickets, free drinks, reserved seating, cutting the line privileges, cocktail classes, yoga and drinks, private party options, DJing classes, rehearsal space, and more!
• prizes from Van Brunt Stillhouse Distillery, Cannonball Press, and animators Bryan Brinkman and Dan Pinto (from Picture This! comedy show)
• signed merchandise from Kristen Schaal, Mike Birbiglia, Hari Kondabolu and Ashok Kondabolu, Jon Glaser, Roy Wood Jr., Giulia Rozzi, Ophira Eisenberg, Josh Gondelman, Myq Kaplan, Jim Tews, & Doogie Horner
• VIP Packs including free tickets and reserved seating to Tinder Live! with Lane Moore and Punderdome 3000 (with Jo and Fred meet and greet!)
• One of a kind prizes from Chris Duffy, Jo Firestone, Donwill, Danny Tamberelli, and Matteo Lane 
Got questions about the rewards or campaign? Email juki@littlefieldnyc.com or FB message us here
Jo Firestone making love happen at Friends of Single People
  Cibo Matto live at littlefield
Before we could realize our original dream of building a gorgeous green roof above littlefield, a year and a half ago we got the all-too-familiar news that our landlord would not renew our lease. We were determined to stay in the neighborhood we've called home for the past eight years, and have been incredibly fortunate to find an old printing warehouse around the corner, which comes with a 4,000 square foot outdoor lot! After a year of planning and slow-but-steady construction, littlefield is very excited to announce: littlefield. That’s right, we’re re-opening littlefield, now with a new outdoor sister bar and restaurant called Parklife.
View of new bar and stage
  Interior of Parklife
We’re very close to completion on both spaces, but we need your help to get us to the finish line! Your generous pledges will assist with littlefield’s moving costs and convert the exterior space from an empty dirt lot into Parklife.
The beginning of construction of the new littlefield
  Vacant lot that will become a landscaped Parklife
Littlefield will continue to offer quality and diverse programming with up-and-coming and established artists that you've come to expect from us, with the addition of a brand new state-of-the-art sound and lighting system to complement our unique events.
Building our new stage
As littlefield’s sister bar and restaurant, you will feel right at home at Parklife with its familiar vibe. Expect friendly staff, signature cocktails, and recycled materials that make up the physical space. Plus Parklife will be open all year-round for the community to enjoy.
Salvaged shipping container for food and drink service
  We thank you for your continued patronage and support. We look forward to seeing you at our new, exciting spaces!
More good times to come at littlefield!
 * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It's tough to navigate through New York City’s myriad rules and regulations when it comes to designing, building and permitting a new space. It’s an unpredictable, complicated and expensive process fraught with challenges, but fortunately we gained valuable first-hand experience from building, maintaining, and renovating the first littlefield over the years. We also work with an amazing team of engineers, architects, designers and contractors who understand what littlefield means us, our patrons and our community.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello friends,
As we approach the three week mark, we wanted to thank everyone again for making littlefield and Parklife come to life! We couldn't have done it without your support. 
Please direct any questions about your prizes or ticket requests to Caitlin@littlefieldnyc.com

Hello friends,
Now that the new littlefield and Parklife are open we'd like to celebrate with you all! 
Join us for a celebration this Friday, June 30 at littlefield 8pm to 12am, followed by an after party at Parklife from 12am to 2am (the kitchen at Parklife will be open from 5pm to  12am incase you need a taco break).

Hello friends,
Tonight at 5:00pm marks the official launch of our sister bar/restaurant Parklife! Swing by for some refreshing drinks and tasty food from Taqueria El Atoradero - located at 636 Degraw Street (between 3rd and 4th Avenues). 
Check out the Grub Street post about Parklife here.

IT'S GO TIME! We are excited to officially announce that Friday 6/16 marks our first event in the new littlefield, located at 635 Sackett Street. Swing by to say hey, and check out What Cheer Album Release Show with Raya Brass Band and DJ Joro Boro.
Stay tuned for more news including a special party for our Kickstarter backers and the grand opening of Parklife!

Check out Ashley's completed mural that will reside in the new littlefield's gallery area!
Stay tuned for some more exciting news in the next couple of days!
