campaign.story:
We want SHRIMPNALDO to be a misanthropic masterpiece. Marshall McLuhan said "The medium is the message". In this case the medium is a gigantic statue made of shrimp and the message is: if we don't change our anthropocentric ways and stop putting our personal pleasure and purposes above the ecosystem, other animal species and other peoples' belief systems, we will only end up speeding our own extinction. Which we find would be a bit of a shame.
Cristiano Ronaldo's commemorative bust in the Madeira Airport, took the sculptor 15 whole days to make it, amazing innit?
  Cash Ronaldo makes by minute, hour, day, month and year
 More silly fun here: http://www.theverge.com/tldr/2017/3/30/15119858/cristiano-ronaldos-mangled-statue-photoshop-airport
https://www.facebook.com/fcfootbole/videos/959433394198984/
It's not because we dislike the football player Cristiano Ronaldo, not at all. He's a human being that makes 160£ a minute and a total of 87 million pounds a year. We would happily cover a replica of Kim Kardashian, Donald Trump or even Elon Musk, for all I care, with sea food. They represent a brand new hyper connected existence where economical oligarchies run the world blinded by the adrenaline surge of More is More. Multitasking became the standard and to stop or even pause production of more useless things ironically is considered to be... radical! And I apologise for sounding like a child but they know best: but to put the profit of few on a pedestal above all human morals and emotional ethics (while the 99% and every other living creature in the planet pays the bill) is simply not fair. 
It's quite an old story I know (class war, elitism, politics...) and trust me I'm old enough to rather not be repeating this once again but, since change doesn't come to party by its own will, we have to go and drag it out of the house ourselves through the way we know best. Through art, fun and controversy by shock-value :) So spread the message. If climate talks and demonstrations make little difference whatsoever... maybe a gigantic rotting statue made out of shrimp will? This is a manifestation of our contempt and despair regarding the growing xenophobia, bigotry and hate seen in the world today. Down with the hate! Down with the fear! Love all the way...
That's where our project comes from and we truly want to make it happen, this is NOT a joke or a prank! The amount of money we are asking for is the minimum to make it happen legally and to make it look like nothing you've ever seen before. It's an all-or-nothing project meaning we won't see any of the funds in case it doesn't reach it's goal (so you know we truly mean it and are not just trying to get some pocket change).
“I do not understand why, when I ask for grilled lobster in a restaurant, I'm never served a cooked telephone.” Salvador Dalí
Me and César Sousa have been creative partners for around ten years. We think alike when it comes to interacting with institutions through comedy, obscenity, surrealism and cynicism. As an example of prior madnesses we have done together: here's a performative act done in 2012 where we spent a sunny afternoon in Lisbon glueing food found in the trash to a human-size map of Portugal. Just to watch it rot later on (the timelapse itself was a fail, the pigeons beat us to the punch). Accompanied by a truly pessimist poem by Alexandre O'Neil. Maybe this time we can upgrade the idea?
It was called Portugal Podre (or Rotting Portugal)
https://www.behance.net/gallery/6362019/Portugal-Podre
Similar concept, same drive, different medium:
 And a thought:
Now, for some facts about prawns besides being small and tasty:
https://www.theguardian.com/globaldevelopment/2014/jun/10/supermarket-prawns-thailand-produced-slave-labour (at the bottom of this article there's some easy infographics showing a bit about the slave trade in Asia);
Now about the horrendous impact of prawn farming on land and therefore communities there's something here: https://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/feb/17/the-bangladesh-shrimp-farmers-facing-life-on-the-edge
So we now Bangladesh is one country where land grabbing by big multinationals has been the worse. Pretty much forcing people to flood their land to farm prawns and killing opposition, which means these guys can't farm anything else anymore and no longer have freshwater, because salt destroys everything and poisons the soil so they are and will forever be slaves to that industry. 
And have given everything it takes to fish them out of the sea, prawns and shrimps should be pretty expensive. And they used to be, I remember as a kid, in Portugal, eating prawns was a delicacy. But the West has grown fond of these sea invertebrates and now they're so cheap, too cheap.
One last thing, to make shrimps spawn more one of their eyes is removed, which puts them in a situation of stress/life death, so they spawn like crazy which isn't exactly a nice to do to them it's called ablation here's a brief article about it: http://seatglobal.eu/2013/02/shrimp_farming_and_ablation/ 
(please notice point 9).
So yeah... from a social environmental and animal welfare point of view it's pretty grim. I often wonder what the real cost of fish and shellfish etc. should be if we were to truly account for the state of the ocean and the damage the fishing industry does. No one would be able to afford it but hey oh, capitalism doesn't think so.
We are Not trying to excuse ourselves for the waste of food we Will originate with this artistic one-night-stand-action. Not at all. we are perfectly aware it's not an ethical thing to do. BUT, thankfully, nowadays we have a lot of information about where stuff comes from and how the privilege of the rich cripples the possibilities of emancipation of the poor. From cheap cell-phones, to cheap clothes, to palm oil, to milk, if one gathers too much knowledge about these things they will end up crippling you as well. And that's also a shame because: All is full of blood. And to know about it all becomes a burden, and a responsibility. Because to witness a population of young Westerners from a stable background struggling with depression and addiction is almost counter-intuitive, don't you think? Individualism grows and an odd sense of lack of meaning and pointlessness grows along with it. Some people feel impotent against impunity and scared off by the over-arching influence of mainstream media manipulation. Welcome to now! We plan to: Fight an unreal unjust world with surrealist art is our motto!
Lets try and keep the goodies humanity has reached so far and think beyond our pre-made ideas, social stereotypes and structural ethnocentrism. And why not start with building together a gigantic statue made of shrimp of a football player who's over-importance is as ludicrous as the game itself and all the corruption and madness that supports it behind the curtain... WHY NOT? Why not watch it rot together, and be eaten by pigeons live, holding our online hands in a tight grip of solidarity and laughter at the sheer lunacy of it all? It will be a celebration sigh for shore eyes ;)

support.title: Love
support.descp: LOVE IS UNITY

support.title: Your Name
support.descp:
Because we are so unique, each other of us, star dust, one in 7 billion and counting... we want to celebrate YOUR EXISTENCE. You, matter! So we will write your name in a very unexpected place and/or an awkward surface and send you a picture of it. You'll be immortalised through PHOTOGRAPHY by complete random strangers for a couple of quid, c'mon... *bargain alert*
+ Love included

support.title: Sea Food inspired dadaist Haikus
support.descp:
Oh yeah, we are also talented Haiku aficionados of DADA. We will write about the Sea, Food (or Football) and send you personalised Haiku's for your salty delights and domestic use + expect your name or variations to be referenced on the final product.
+ Love included

support.title: DVD's (an ode to nonsense obsolescence)
support.descp:
We'll send a box of blank DVD's directly to your home BY POST where you can burn all your memories, how I met yours mothers', discographies, torrents, porn... so you can safely keep them on a shelf in case solar flares melt the internet and end our outrageously self-indulgent lifestyles, Cheers!
+ Love included

support.title: Watch live Shrimpnaldo rotting
support.descp:
Since you've been so kind to us we'll repay you by sending a private live streaming link to watch while our magnanimous statue of Ronaldo made of Shrimp rots away due to the contingencies of Nature and Pigeons.
Spoiler alert: it will get Messy ;)
+ Love included

support.title: THE HANDS ON BACALHAU EXPERIENCE
support.descp:
Enough with fish and chips? Real fish have eyes and its on its way! As an homage to surrealism we want to send you a Portuguese codfish to your home by POST.
You are invited to look at it, you can also cook it or just smell it, although our personal favourite is that you nail it to a wall in your home and take a picture of it. If you send us the picture we will send you another codfish and the process can go on forever until we run out of money or you get kicked out of your house.
+ Love included

support.title: A Snapshot of your soul on Instagram
support.descp:
For us, Random is God and God is Random.
The matrix is breaching, consciousness is a enticing mix of whatever you and evolution want it to be - an instant mapped synaptic reduction of our surrounding uncertainty - and being aware of that fact, usually, doesn't add much to the physical elements of each personal perspective, right? Sure... there's a rent to pay and an ego to feed... oh sorry, I forgot I was adding a description to a reward at a crowdfunding campaign to make A GIGANTIC STATUE OF CRISTIANO RONALDO MADE OUT OF SHRIMP!!!
This is for those that really love us and believe wasting money like crazy for the sake of making a statement is worth it... help us and we will surprise you!!! On INSTAGRAM!!!

+ A lot of Love included

support.title: Who's Behind the Shrimps ?
support.descp:
The whole work dialogues and neural-storming between João, the visual anthropologist, and César, the conceptual artist, will be documented and shared with you through private links along the way. You'll be on the loop from beginning to end and your input is more welcomed to add to the completion of the project.
You'll also be the first to know about the release of the full documentary and get a chance to view it and comment on it, free of charge.
Skype meeting available on request.
+ Love

support.title: Prawn sauce bathtub performance
support.descp:
Fill a bathtub of prawn cocktail sauce and then jump in it naked and pretend to be a happy shrimp while poetically naming everyone that bought this specific reward (with a 'shrimpy' voice).
There will be people dressed as starfish dancing around me and singing Lou Reed's "A Perfect Day"
And we'll send you a private link of the video but you can upload it online afterwards if you want...
- Love like you live in a pink alcove

support.title: Join us for the rot of Shrimpnaldo
support.descp:
You're part of the team! Come meet us at the day of the preparation, we'll host you! Stay for as long as you like (after a month we probably will need to have a chat). Lets set this statue on rotting mode. You can help us out with the setting up, shrimp by shrimp and then watch it rot in all it's melancholic grandiosity.
+ tiny commemorative Shrimpnaldo statue to attach to your car, furniture or ceiling
+ a whole lotta Love

support.title: Wear a full Shrimpnaldo suit with pride
support.descp:
Comfy PANTS with Shrimpnaldo stamped all over them; Shrimpnaldo UNDERGARMENTS; Shrimpnaldo's face in a close-up T-SHIRT and an amazing a Shrimpnaldo HAT. A bargain for the whole family!
+ no shoes are included but a bunch of shrimp Love instead is :D

support.title: Scavenger Crawl Hunt comes to your town
support.descp:
Lets get drunk! And make art from what we find along our way during a whole weekend of white privileged excess self-indulgence! We'll come meet you wherever you are and get to know each other over the weekend :D
"Nothing is true, Everything Permitted"
+ William Burroughs is included

support.title: Biological Guerrilla: The Bust
support.descp:
We'll create a real size bust of Cristiano Ronaldo's face using different kinds of sea food and we'll leave it attached in public spaces around Europe and film its decomposing process using timelapse photography.
You'll be part of the decision process of where it should be placed and which kind of sea food should be used for the design of this unique piece of ephemeral art.
+ a LOVELY shrimp souvenir sent to your address with your name on it. Creepy but true

support.title: 7 years a slave
support.descp:
Ask me anything. I'll listen to all your problems and successes for seven years (yes 7) and share mine if you care to hear me out as well. Any time you need me I'll be there for you, no questions asked, up to 1 hour per day. For advice, for company, to make you laugh, to cry together, share some links and life experience and... believe me or not, I'm serious!
I won't lose my personality tho, I will still be me and will always react as such. I'm blunt, I have a lot of stories to tell and also insecurities and I adore understanding the human psyche through interaction with strangers. That's what you're paying for: I'll be a rebellious slave with a strong personality, nevertheless, ultimately still a slave. Available 4 U <3
Please be a good master.
+ Love not included

support.title: Be careful for what you wish for
support.descp:
Because we ain't necessarily That deprived of morals and integrity... we will inevitably waste a LOT of shrimps to make Shrimpnaldo come to life. Thus, for every time someone buys this reward, I vouch to dedicate a year of my life as a marine conservationist or in any project that relates to the well-being and conservation of our dying oceans and the species that survive on it.
To compensate for my sins. Mea culpa! Modern art made me do it.
+ I love you all <3

support.title: Dinner for two (or twenty)
support.descp:
Modesty aside, this is our coolest reward yet!
Remember "The Game"? A movie by David Fincher that really struck an impression on me!
How are your social skills doing? Like to meet up with new people? Bored of life, feel like you need a change, ready for an adventure? Well... with this reward we'll make up a big surprise for you to experience in real time.
Beforehand, we will ask you to complete a survey about yourself, your background, wishes, fears and desires... and one sunny day, you will receive an open invitation for dinner you won't be able to refuse.
The only thing you can decide is: will you prefer to have dinner with 1 person or 20?
+ real Love is usually tough

support.title: Shrimpnaldo meets the Pope
support.descp:
On the 12th of May 2017 Portugal is blessed by the visit of his Holiness Pope Francisco. The Shrimpnaldo team plans to visit his Holiness in Fátima and go on all-day subversive shrimp performance extravaganza with the objective of reaching his Holiness in full shrimp suits (armed with hidden cameras) and inviting him for a pint and some fish snacks!
Something like The Yes Men meets Borat.
Expect us ;) Better again, be the producer of this action and support us !!!!
+ Love is the proof of God

support.title: All of the above and beyond
support.descp:
Literally, all we've offered so far is included in a personalised bundle and your name on IMDB and all our social networks as Executive Producer of the full documentary of this one-of-a-kind surrealistic art experience.
+ shrimp tones of Lovey love love LOVE

support.title: Engraved in stone
support.descp:
After Shrimpnaldo's inevitable decomposition only one thing will remain: a commemorative stone plaque with your name and the message you choose to write on it for future generations to come and acknowledge that magic exists and grand strange things can be accomplished with the help of each other.
+ love is an ambiguous feeling until you feel it sometimes and clouds clear towards blissful gratitude to be alive. Thank you

campaign.story:
Hi everyone! We are Ashley and Jin, interaction and furniture designers based in NYC. We would like to introduce you to our first collaborative project called Doobi Cheeseboard.
The reason behind doing this project is because we LOVEEEEEE dogs and wanted to create something for dog lovers like us. We wanted to create something that could be incorporated into the daily lives and social gatherings of fellow dog lovers.
The Doobi Cheeseboard is a handmade wooden serving board that can be used at social events as a great conversation starter. It is a great product for animals lovers to enjoy in their home as a reminder to the joys that dogs bring to our lives.
Doobi is a fur-ever friend, family member, and Ashley's paw-some pet. A smart and adorable being, she is our inspiration for this project. Hoping to spread her cheer like you spread your cheese – we decided to create a serving board.
Green, Renewable and Earth Friendly Material
Hard and Durable
Knife Friendly Cutting Surface
Bacterial Resistance
Low Maintenance
Beautiful Appearance
The first phase of our new venture is to fund the Doobi Cheeseboard and make it a part of your social gatherings. If this is successful, we would love to expand this idea to create more products for animal lovers.
This is our first step jumping into the field of handmade products. Your support will allow us to create more prototypes and spread the love of dogs.
Follow us on instagram @doobicheeseboard for more updates.

campaign.story:
Death is a part of our shared human experience. 
Thinking about our mortality is unsettling and talking about it is even more unpleasant. I'm curious to explore how we might reframe the way we face life and loss and one of the most difficult conversations to be had.  
Recuerdos is a collection of anonymous, personal stories around the topic of life and loss. Its designed to create a space that invites readers to share a part of themselves that can foster empowerment, compassion, connection with others and inspire us to live fuller lives. 
Join me in undertaking this campaign and reframing how we face life and loss through sharing and listening. 
A New Orleans native and first-generation Guatemalan American, I spent my childhood between two rich cultures. Each one had its own funerary traditions, both heavily steeped positivity surrounding loss. 
In New Orleans locals hold "jazz funerals." An African-American tradition, these funeral processions feature brass bands that march with the family from the funeral home or church playing somber music en route to the cemetery. After the family says their goodbyes the music takes an upbeat turn and "second lining," a form of cathartic dancing, that celebrates the life of the deceased begins.
In Guatemala, we celebrate Día de Muertos, an annual day dedicated to remembrance where families visit their loved ones for a celebration in the cemetery. Handmade giant kites extend into the skies above grave yards to honor the dead, then once the kites have been wind-torn they are burned allowing the smoke to guide the dead back up to heaven.
Inspired by these cultures, I’m committed to exploring cultural norms, rituals, and perspectives surrounding death. 
Anyone from across the world can participate in Recuerdos.
As a participant you will be mailed a prompt to share your inner thoughts and feelings around life and loss. This could be what you miss most about someone you've lost, a fear about dying, something you may regret not doing before you pass, a wish for your future funeral service, a personal or cultural funeral ritual you'd like to share, or anything else. It will be fully open for you to make that decision. Once received these will be shared anonymously online in a repository of collected stories for all to read.
By pledging your support to this campaign, you will join people around the world who believe that:
Emotions like grief are normal and a part of human nature. 
Sharing personal stories can be liberating. 
We can learn from and find meaning through loss. 
Acknowledge the importance of talking about and planning for death on a more open and frequent basis.
Well, some of them. There are a number of rewards for backers that are detailed in the pledge column, but here are a few of the possible perks for getting involved in this project. 
A faux obituary written for you, by me.
Funeral Planning Toolkit.
Custom designed "Parting Favors" for your future funeral.
Memento mori enamel pin showing your support of this campaign.
Memento mori are symbolic reminders of death. Backers pledging $25 or more to this project will also receive a token of remembrance in the form of a hard enamel pin.
An enamel pin-loving child of the 80's that found inspiration in 16th century mourning jewelry, I've designed an enamel pin that uses clothing as a canvas in the hopes that they can serve as conversation starters in our everyday lives. 
"Parted to meet again" 1" hard enamel pin, black and silver
    To make Recuerdos a reality I will need your support. If funded, this campaign will result in an online compilation of shared stories around death. It will also fund creating a line of enamel pins that can serve as symbols to spark conversations on loss in person.
Backing this campaign will cover the costs to design and manufacture this Memento Mori enamel pin, printing postcards, postage, labor facilitating the project, toolkits, and designing all of its components. 
What happens if this campaign exceeds its goal amount of $1,000? 
This would be wonderful as my long-term stretch goals would allow me to keep this exchange of stories on-going, to create a full line of Memento mori enamel pins, and to create widely and freely accessible tools such as the end-of-life planning toolkit and projects that continue to facilitate conversations about life and loss among younger demographics.
  Hello Kickstarter! My name is Azu. I’m a New Orleans-bred, New York based Interaction Design graduate student at the School of Visual Arts. 
I would like to see discussions around end-of-life planning and death become a more frequent, open, and more comfortable thing that we participate in. We design other experiences in our lives, but how can we design our deaths?
Recuerdos is my attempt at starting this conversation and I need your funding and support to make this campaign a reality. 
Special thanks to my advisors Christina Xu and Gary Chou as well as those who took part in deep conversations and assisted in helping me develop the Recuerdos campaign including Alex Singh, Edlyn Yuen, Guri Venstead, Hanna Yoon, Nikki Sylianteng, Ruth Tupe, Sarah Adams, Sally Chan, Kickstarter, and my SVA classmates!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My work experience as a designer means that I have the skills to meet my objectives. The participant pin is designed and other pins are in the design phase. I already have a manufacturer lined up so those are good to go!

I’ll also be relying on you, yes you incredible community of backers, to help move the project forward by sharing your stories.

While I do not see any major risks associated with this project, the amount of time it takes to fulfill the rewards may take longer than expected. I will keep you posted in case any unexpected delays arise and as things move forward!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you all so much! The Recuerdos campaign is at the halfway point in its lifespan, with 7 days left to go, and thanks to your overwhelming support it is only dollars away from being fully funded.
This means that Recuerdos will be able to launch its first phase! But I don't want to stop there.
If I can raise additional funds then I will be able to focus on my "stretch goals." These include extending Recuerdos into a long-term online exchange and creating additional enamel pin designs that can become a line of conversational symbols around the topic of loss. I would also be able to implement a larger vision I have for Recuerdos, which would include designing toolkits and resources to make having in real life conversations around death less and dying less difficult and encourage end-of-life planning.

campaign.story:
Why NetViews:
I've been obsessed with Vaporwave for the past four years. The unique sounds and self contained, fully realized aesthetic world of it turned into an obsession for me and rekindled my interest in music. Over these years it has been extremely uncommon for me to meet people IRL that are into Vaporwave (or even know what it is) and it's even rarer for me to hear of a Vaporwave concert or event. With NetViews, I wanted to make a Vaporwave focused online event centered around community building and interviews/discussions with musicians and artists working in the genre. 
To help me realize this, I have teamed up with Leo Linden to stream the episodes and build our website, WosX and R23X to perform, Simon Chandler to help with interviewing and Dynamic Media Triad to highlight their Broken Reality game currently in development. Big thanks to all of them for coming together to make some really exciting programming for Episodes 1 and 2 of NetViews.
New to Vaporwave, check this out!
What it is:
NetViews will be a series of streaming concerts and live AMAs with Vaporwave artists. They are meant to highlight and celebrate the diversity of artists working in the genre.
Episodes of NetViews will be a platform for fans to chat, learn about the artists working in their beloved genre, hear an interview of them and have the opportunity to ask their own questions, all while simultaneously being connected with the larger Vaporwave community around the world.
In keeping with the ethos of Vaporwave NetViews will be free and accessible to all. Please help fund the first two episodes to support the musicians, artists and writers working in Vaporwave and to get this series created for all to enjoy.  
In addition to a headliner performance, NetViews programing will include a Vaporwave "open-mic" section to allow up and coming artists and musicians to get more visibility. Hit me up if you are interested in taking part in this section of NetViews.
Vaporwave Forever:
Vaporwave is still going strong many years after we were told it was going to die the death of yetanother disposable internet microgenre. It is my hope through NetViews we can strengthen the connections between the community and increase discussion around the aesthetic and creators of Vaporwave.
Scheduled programming for your nighttime aesthetic broadcasting. For episode 2 we will have special guest Simon Chandler interviewing R23X live.
  Tight Budget performing on a beta version of NetViews as we test streaming tech to use.
   In order for the community to be involved, connect with each other and the artists, NetViews will stream live. Episodes will also be recorded and archived. 
Check Out WosX: 
Bandcamp
Soundcloud
@wolfensteinosx
WosX Program Notes
  Check Out R23X:
Bandcamp
Soundcloud
@R23X 
R23X Program Notes
Simon Chandler:  
Episode 2 will feature a live stream interview of R23X by special guest Bandcamp Vaporwave columnist Simon Chandler. Simon Chandler is a writer and journalist. He covers Vaporwave for Bandcamp Daily and has written about pretty much every kind of music for Tiny Mix Tapes. He also occasionally contributes the odd book review here and there, as well as articles on technology and politics.
Broken Reality:
We are super excited to announce that Dynamic Media Triad will be joining us from Mexico City. They will live stream a preview walkthrough of their Vaporwave game Broken Reality currently in development. Check out the gifs and video below. It looks amazing and we're all really excited to see more of it and ask them about it.
"Broken Reality is a first person adventure game set on a 3D re-imagining of the Internet. Inspired by 80s and 90s aesthetics, the game is all about exploring an interconnected network of levels where the player can collect different items, meet NPCs and interact with various objects. In it you play as a mute, unspecified character surfing the web for suggested -but mostly optional- purposes such as collecting Likes, finding the Illuminati, reaching spiritual transcendence or just breathing in the scenery. 
 The game will have a variety of levels ranging from crowded neon cities littered with advertisements and their backstreets, to a dive on a mixture between Atlantis and old-school Angelfire websites, all the way to the soothing echoes of an online mall cathedral and many more. 
It will handle its progression system in an almost open-ended way where players will be able to explore most of the world since the beginning, and may even find endings to the game early on. However, some areas may be harder to explore without the proper conditions, and some endings will require more elaborate conditions to be met. That’s where exploring and digging deeper into the game come in, and why not enjoy doing so while listening to an ethereal soundtrack, taking in the a e s t h e t I c s and laughing at our own misery?" 
        Where money goes: 
90% - Artists 
           We believe the artists, musicians and writers creating Vaporwave deserve to be compensated. That is why we will be giving the majority of funds from this Kickstarter directly to them. 
10% - Tech/Admin
           A small retainer will be held in case we encounter any tech or admin costs. If there is remaining funds from this after putting on the episodes we will donate these funds to the musicians and creators that collaborated with us to put NetViews on.
Money breakdown
    Help us make aesthetic programming for the Vaporwave community.
Special Thanks!
Simon Chandler, HKE & Dream Catalogue, Ben Sisto, Leo Linden
<3

campaign.story:
We're raising funds to manufacture items for our new kids clothing line. We have traditionally designed iconic apparel for men and women. Since 1985, we have been at the forefront of innovative streetwear fashion that connects to skaters, punks, ravers, and the hardcore counterculture. Our most legendary items are wide-leg jeans - insane denim with leg openings up to 50 inches. For people in the know, items like Kangaroos, Crime Scenes, and Skunks are household names.
Now, we are ready to offer our most iconic items to a whole new generation with our kids line. Initially we aim to cater to the pre-teen market (ages 5-12). These will be kid-sized versions of our most famous jeans, tees, and hoodies. 
  We’ll kick it off with kid-sized versions of our most famous jeans, tees, and hoodies with many of the prints you love most but also add some epic new artwork to the mix. If the campaign is a success, we expect the full product line to be available perfectly in time for summer!
The idea of doing a crowdfunding campaign really came from our community pushing for a JNCO line that lets them share the 90s spirit we grew up in with their kids today. Even if you’ve moved onto a different style, you want your kids to enjoy the same freeing sense of comfort that only JNCO can provide.  
JNCO is still that down to earth brand that evolved out of California skate and surf subculture. Keeping the conversation with our customers going is what matters to us most. That’s why we want to work closely with you on this idea and want your input on where to take the kids line, what you want to see and would be excited about. This is an adventure that we want to share with you. 
So, big thanks to everyone who’s supporting us in this adventure back to 90’s surf and skater style! We’re feeling the love already and are sending it right back at ya'!
    JNCO has always been proud that our products are made of high-quality materials with printing and embellishments done right here in the US. We won’t lower our standards for the JNCO Kids Line. Which is why most of the crowdfunding funds will be used to pay for the manufacture of our kids apparel line, the rest of it for shipping, packing, and brand new artwork.  
We aren't kidding around - it's time to make bite-sized JNCOs!
                                  JNCO Kickstarter Rewards
Ensuring we meet the target timeline was a potential obstacle we identified early in the process. This is why we are launching this campaign very early to ensure plenty of wiggle room.
We do not have any overdue past projects nor does this project require any outside approval or review. Once the project is successfully completed, we can proceed unimpeded with the production of the kids clothing line.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Designing, manufacturing, marketing, and shipping apparel is a demanding endeavor and not one to be taken lightly. With a complex supply chain, there are many potential obstacles that must be considered. 

Fortunately, we have decades of experience in this regard. We already have an effective business model in place and our kids line will follow our existing process to ensure a successful launch.

We have everything in place, from the design to the manufacturing equipment to the shipping contractors to ensure that things will go smoothly once the project is successfully funded.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Remember your childhood days and reminisce about the joy and happiness you felt playing outside with friends. Remember the excitement of discovering a new game — uncovering its strategies and competing against your companions.
Playing outdoors is an important part of childhood. Usually, kids play the games that are popular in their own country. But what if they could learn new games from other countries?
Pick Me! celebrates the diversity of folk games from around the world.
It's a deck of foldable cards that showcases 15 popular folk games from various countries for kids aged 8-12.
The foldable prototype is just a little bigger than a credit card. So it fits into the pocket and is easy to carry.
  Sample pages: the title page, the page introducing the characters and explaining the setup, and the "What if" page to encourage kids to make their own variants of the game.
  Gameplay is explained through an easy-to-understand narrative.
How does Pick Me! work?
Each game is explained using a simple narrative and beautiful illustrations, which makes it easy for kids to understand. The illustrations are done by artist and my friend, Shreya Sen.
Unfolding a game introduces the main characters of the story, who take the kids through a journey of learning the game. They explain what items will be required, how to set up the playing area, how teams will be formed, and finally how the game is played.
What's so special?
The size of the folded card is just a little bigger than a credit card. So kids can carry it easily in their pockets.
As each game has its separate card, kids can share and lend the individual game cards among their friends.
When the card folds out like a map, it allows all the kids playing the game to look at it and understand the game as a group, making everyone feel inclusive.
Each game includes prompts to encourage kids to make their own variants of the games. After all, it's always more fun to play a game that YOU have created!!!
The games don't need any additional gear to play. Common household items like balls, ropes, or sticks are all you need.
How did I select the games?
My goal in selecting the games was to keep them interesting and challenging for kids with different needs. The deck includes solo and multiplayer games, even games for large groups, and both indoor and outdoor games.
Here are the games I am currently planning to add:
Daria Bandha........Bangladesh
Escargot................France
Hummam Kubbe....Turkey
Jiànzi.....................China
Kho-kho.................India
Mundo...................Mozambique
O an quan.............Vietnam
Okwe.....................Nigeria
Oonch Neech........Pakistan
Queimada..............Brazil
Scotland Yard........England
Skully.....................USA
Stone Toss............Lebanon
Handkerchief.........Egypt
Three Tins.............South Africa
Character development
Who are we?
Hi, I'm Kinjal. I'm an Interaction Design grad student at School of Visual Arts, NYC. I am obsessed with games and comic books, and I love children.
Shreya is an illustrator based in India, who specializes in children's books illustration, hand drawn animation, comic book strips, and doodling.
Why am I doing this?
As a kid, I was obsessed with games, and was constantly seeking new games to play. I often wondered, what games do kids in other countries play? The older I grew, the more I learned about super-fun games from a lot of countries. And now I want to share them with all the kids.
There are also less direct goals that I aim to achieve. Introducing kids to games from around the world, through characters from those places, can teach them compassion. I believe this is becoming increasingly relevant in the divided society that we see today. Furthermore, we are entering an era where digital games are easy to find by the thousands, but it is much harder to find novel physical games. Through this kickstarter, I also aim to promote physical games in this digital era.
I need your help!
I am running this campaign to get enough funding to take this idea from prototype to production. Your pledges will mainly fund the production costs: the cost of new illustrations, fonts, printing, and packaging. If you remember how much fun it was to play your favorite games as a kid, and you want to share those special moments with your kids or others, help fund my campaign. If you know people that feel the same way, share it with them!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have spent the last few months outlining the details of material, printing, packaging, and the involved costs. But in the real world, unforeseen manufacturing problems may still come up. This may delay the timeline for delivery, but there is probably enough cushion in the current estimate to account for that. 

As I go through the process of receiving additional feedback and incorporating it to make the product better, a couple of things may change: the collection of games may change a bit to make the combination more interesting, and the design of the cards (size, shape, graphic) may also be refined. Rest assured, this will only be to make the final product more interesting and fun!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We’re The Bruce High Quality Foundation, an anonymous art collective based in Brooklyn, NY. For over a decade, we’ve been producing works of art, musicals, films, public interventions, and massive group exhibitions.
The Bruce High Quality Foundation, "Thank You, New York!" 2009
In 2009, we started a tuition-free, artist-run school called the Bruce High Quality Foundation University (BHQFU). With student debt on the rise and art education consistently being defunded, creating accessible and sustainable spaces where artists can learn from one another and grow in their work is at the core of our mission.
We believe that free arts education should be a right, not a privilege.
Over 7,000 miles away, in Zambia, there’s another school that shares this mission. Completed in January 2015 by the 14+ Foundation, the Chipakata Children’s Academy provides tuition-free, arts-based learning to over 200 students, ranging in age from preschool to the 7th grade.
Students in class at the Chipakata Children's Academy
  (L) The printing press and (R) a printmaking lesson for the Brooklyn Free School's kindergartners
For this project, our schools are teaming up! Over the next six months, hundreds of artists in our community will use this portable etching press to create original copper plate prints.
Then, with your help, we’ll take the press on an incredible journey from our home in New York to its new, permanent home at the Chipakata School in Zambia. The press will anchor a new printmaking studio program, which will provide the students with the skills, tools, and equipment to create original works of art for years to come.
Prints created by the participating artists and the Chipakata students will be exhibited together in both New York and Zambia next year, showcasing the enormous community this project has fostered.
When we travel with the press to Zambia, we’ll bring along the engraved copper plates used to create the prints. The plates will be installed at the Chipakata school, on an exterior wall facing the mountains, forming a unique, collaborative mural that will develop a natural patina over time.
This is the just the first step in forging a meaningful and lasting connection between our two schools. Our long-term goal is to establish a teaching exchange program where US-based artists can live in Zambia as artists-in-residence, leading courses and workshops at the Chipakata school, and further cementing a meaningful collaboration between artists on different sides of the Atlantic.
  College-aged students should not need to accrue massive debt to experience arts-based learning, and primary students should enjoy the benefit of exploring creativity throughout their entire education. Both BHQFU and the Chipakata school have seen firsthand the impact of arts education in our communities and we are invested in continuing to provide this invaluable resource.
Recess at the Chipakata Children's Academy
  BHQFU residency alumnus Orlando Estrada guest teaching a free class for high school students at MoMA Teens
  BHQFU is a learning experiment where artists work together to manifest creative, productive, resistant, useless, and demanding interactions between art and the world. A 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, BHQFU was founded in 2009 by Brooklyn-based, anonymous art collective The Bruce High Quality Foundation. It has grown from a small office space in TriBeCa to a year-round free education program and public exhibitions series with hundreds of students annually at our headquarters in Sunset Park, Brooklyn. We also offer cost-free studio residencies to artists, giving them the time, space, and support to realize their work without going into debt.
The Bruce High Quality Foundation have been recognized for their work by the New York Times, Art in America, the Wall Street Journal, Artforum, Purple, VICE, and have exhibited their work nationally and internationally for over a decade. In 2013, the Brooklyn Museum held a massive retrospective of the collective’s projects.
The Bruce High Quality Foundation, "Pizzatopia," 2016
  The Bruce High Quality Foundation, Billboard Advertisement at 6817 Melrose, Los Angeles, 2016
  Over the next year, we’re producing editions of prints created by US-based artists as a future sustainable fundraising model to keep generating support for both the Chipakata school and BHQFU long after this Kickstarter completes. These prints will be part of the New York and Zambia exhibitions next year! For the future of the project, we've got some amazing people confirmed, including: 
   We’re reaching out to the Kickstarter community because we know, firsthand, the incredible things that can be done when working collectively toward a common goal. We know that Kickstarter provides a one-of-a-kind platform to spread the word about this initiative and get supportive people involved right from the start. BHQFU's success has always been the direct result of a community of students, teachers, and visiting artists who come together to change the world, one class at a time. With an audience as large as Kickstarter's, this is an incredible opportunity for us to get the word out about both BHQFU and the Chipakata Academy far and wide. We invite you to join us in this journey towards reshaping how art is taught and learned, and who gets to participate! 
With your support, we’ll take the press to Zambia and build a new studio program for the students. Over the course of two weeks, BHQFU will train students and faculty at the Chipakata school in various printmaking methods. Any additional funds raised beyond our initial goal will go directly to furthering the partnership and building out a teaching exchange program at the Chipakata school.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our most significant challenge is ensuring that we have the time and resources to truly engage with the students at Chipakata, to construct a solid printmaking studio program, and to get to know the local community. 

To do this, we require strong seed funding that will enable us to make this first step something monumental in the service of our ongoing collaboration. That’s why we’re asking you to get involved! We’ve generated a significant amount of energy between BHQFU and the Chipakata students already, and are eager to move to action. 

Both organizations are brimming with excitement about this collaboration, and we know that enacting the program soon will bring the best possible results! But we also recognize the logistical challenges involved in real community engagement and the building of relationships, so we are making sure to keep a realistic perspective that allows the project’s full timeline to remain somewhat flexible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, Mountain Movers! 
As you all know, we did it! Thanks to each and every one of you who helped Chipakata Children's Academy, 14+ Foundation, and BHQFU move a mountain! We will be sure to keep you posted on the project going forward as we organize the trip to Zambia and continue to work with artists in the United States to produce prints for the future exhibitions. There were nearly 300 people who directly pledged to this campaign, and every one of you helped write this awesome story.

updates.update_userinfo: OMG. How High Can We Climb? And THANK YOU ALL!!!
Live Stream Tonight at 8pm! We've Raised Over 75% of Our Goal!
updates.update_content:
Hello, Backers! 
We're in the home stretch -- there is just one week left in the How to Move a Mountain Kickstarter campaign and we are thrilled to be at over 75% of our goal. Let's keep this wonderful momentum going so that we reach (and surpass) our $50K goal to bring a printmaking studio program to the Chipakata Children's Academy in Zambia! 
Tonight at 8pm, we're doing a Kickstarter Live Stream and we invite you to tune in. It's an intimate event where you'll hear from some of the team members at 14+ Foundation and BHQFU about this unique collaboration, and we'll be doing a live copper plate printmaking demonstration for a few friends. It's a great chance to learn about this artistic process and to "meet the press."

Wow! What an amazing 24 hours it's been, Kickstarter! We've reached nearly 30% of our project goal and we can't send enough thanks to all of our awesome supporters! 
One of the most popular items in our rewards was the Bar Napkin Shadow Box, and as of right now we're all out of the 25 that we created for the project. However, to celebrate the campaign's success, we're releasing a brand new, larger Copper Plate Bruce Shadow Box!

Hello, Dear Supporters! 
Thank you all so very much for helping BHQFU and the Chipakata Children's Academy to move a mountain! We've had a great first week on the campaign and really valued the opportunity to meet so many of you in-person at our booth during NADA New York. We've reached nearly 20% of our project goal, and each of you who has pledged has been absolutely instrumental in generating excitement and the necessary momentum around the initiative.

campaign.story:
Origins of the Chinese dumpling is a lunch event in New York City for all dumpling lovers and anyone who wants to learn more about Chinese culture. Held at Shanghai Cafe Deluxe in Manhattan’s Chinatown on Friday May 5th and Saturday May 20th, we will serve six courses of dumplings while telling stories about things like:
Which was the first Chinese dumpling? 
Where do different Chinese dumplings originate? 
What are traditional dumpling fillings and what do they mean? 
What are the right sauces to accompany each dumpling? 
Where can you eat the best dumplings in New York City and beyond? 
The meal will have many types of classic Chinese dumplings, including Huntun that is served in a flavorful soup. Jiaozi, which are delicious mouthfuls and almost a complete meal in every bite. Tangyuan with a sticky taste and sweet flavor. Har Gow that are tasty shrimp dumplings with translucent wrappers. Guotie with a tender-topped crisp-bottomed flavor, and Xiaolongbao that has juicy pork-and-crab meatball. 
Xiaolongbao
  Tangyuan
  Har Gow
  Jiaozi
  Guotie
  Huntun
Rewards 
To thank you for your support of this project, I designed a series of six different 1.8”x7” bookmarks that each feature a different dumpling and includes information about traditional fillings and sauces.
1.8x7 black bookmark
  1.8x7 colorful bookmark
For those of you who want to introduce dumplings to more friends, there are also postcards. Besides correct sauce pairings and traditional fillings, you will also learn which restaurant has the best version of that specific dumpling in NYC, and which one is the best in the world.
4.25x6 Postcard
Curious? Hungry? Get yourself to the Origins of the Chinese Dumpling.
Who am I?
My name is Yue and I come from China. I'm currently an Interaction Design graduate student at the School of Visual Arts in New York. I like eating Chinese dumplings, especially Jiaozi, which family members traditionally got together to make for New Year’s Eve.

When I was a child, one of the things I enjoyed most during the Chinese New Year was finding a coin hidden in one of the Jiaozis, which promises the person who finds the coin good fortune in the New Year.

After I moved to New York City, I found out that a lot of people from all over the world like Chinese dumplings, yet few knew the stories behind each dumpling. So I created this event to introduce Chinese culture to more people in an engaging and meaningful way.

Special thanks to Christina, Edlyn, Gary, Katherine, Nikki, Jason, Wolfgang, our classmates and alumni at SVA.

campaign.story:
This cookbook will be the first of its kind—written by refugees telling their own story and sharing their recipes. 
It will feature 80 recipes and stories representing at least 20 chefs hailing from 15 different countries.  
10% of proceeds will go to the International Rescue Committee, and all remaining profits from this campaign will be invested in hiring and training more refugees.
  A little over a year ago, we were craving our grandmother's Hummus so we launched Eat Offbeat. 
We had three goals in mind. Introduce New Yorkers to new and off-the-beaten-path cuisines, create opportunities for talented home cooks who happened to be refugees by status, and, most importantly, showcase the value refugees bring this country.  
Since then, we’ve trained and hired 16 chefs from 11 different countries. We’ve fed 15,000 New Yorkers and introduced them to over 30 of our chefs' unique family dishes. Our story was featured in 50+ articles and video pieces in at least 10 languages, and viewed by millions worldwide. We’ve even been dubbed "New York’s most groundbreaking catering,” wow! 
Our dream is to hire more chefs, feature more cuisines, and bring all their amazing stories to you. We have plans to expand our kitchen to many cities beyond New York, but in the meantime, we are creating a cookbook! 
   We want to bring our chefs' food into your kitchens, wherever you are. 
We want you to learn directly from our chefs how to cook their dishes: to learn to cook Chef Rachana’s Nepali Momos or Chef Dhuha’s Iraqi Biryani.
We want you to learn about our chefs who are sharing the treasured recipes of their very own families with their personal creative touch; and about the culture that bore their cuisine. 
We want you to sit to dinner with family and friends with built-in conversation about appreciating other cultures through food. 
Our chefs are eager to share their most treasured recipes and stories with you… and they're counting on your help to make it happen!
This will be more than just a cookbook, it will be your travel guide to an amazing offbeat culinary tour around the world. It will be a guide to discovering hidden gems of authentic world cuisines, ranging from East Asia (Nepal, Tibet, China...) to the Middle East (Syria, Iraq, Afghanistan...); East, West and North Africa (Eritrea, Ivory Coast, Algeria…) and Latin America (Venezuela…).  
 They'll share their insider tips on how to best use an ingredient, and ancient tricks and wisdom passed on to them from generations of home cooks before them.
Eat Offbeat’s own Head Chef, Juan (who has worked for Michelin star restaurants amassing 13 stars in total) will work with our chefs to get their recipes out of their minds and into our cookbook!
  New York is a melting pot where so many innovations are born. Our New York success story is no exception. Creativity is born out of diversity, and we have seen it in action in our micro melting pot —our kitchen.  
Our chefs, who in many instances didn’t even speak the same language, formed lasting friendships as they cooked together. They learned each others’ techniques and borrowed each others’ spices. And when you combine diverse talent, friendship and curiosity, magic happens : Our chefs created new fusion recipes from their collaboration! Our cookbook will share not only these recipes, but the stories of how they came to be.
And that’s what makes our cookbook unprecedented and truly unique!
 Our cookbook will be a feast for the eyes as much as they are a pleasure for the palate. To bring this to life we are partnering with the incredible photographer, Signe Birck! She is extraordinarily talented and with her help we will do our chef’s masterpieces justice. We're sure you know her, but if you don't, check out her Instagram here. (warning: not for the hungry!). 
We are also thrilled to work with the award-winning designer and illustrator, Hanane Kai, who will add her magic touch to every page.
  Our recipes have already been tested (and loved!) by some of the most rigorous eaters on the planet: New Yorkers. But we want to take it to the next level: our recipe testing program will be lead by our Event Director Courtney, a chef herself whose own recipes have been published in several cookbooks. Courtney, who works closely with our chefs every day, will tease out all their insider tips and tricks to ensure your cooking is truly authentic.

With such top-notch talents on board to match our chefs’ passion and gifts, we already have half the ingredients for success … the other half is in your hands. Your contribution is so important but we also need your help spreading our story to your friends so they can support us too.  
It's simple: the more money we raise, the more chefs we hire, the more countries we cover, and the more recipes we feature! Our chefs are eager to share their most treasured recipes and stories with you… and they're counting on your help to make it happen! 
 10% of proceeds will go to the International Rescue Committee, and all remaining profits will be invested in hiring and training more chefs.  
Make this a year of growth for a business driven by the values refugees bring to our country.
    Video Credits: 
- Writer/Director/Producer/VO: Lena Rudnick
- Cinematographer: Dan Witrock (danwitrock.com)
- Editor: Orlando Torres
- Music Composer: Izzy Gliksberg (lateseamusic.com)
- Additional footage courtesy of the Thomson Reuters Foundation; original video available here (and more videos here: http://news.trust.org/videos/)
Special thanks to Raj Maheshwari and Sarita Singh for opening up their home to our team for the shoot!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are very fortunate with the team that we build around this project. 
All our recipes have been tested by generations of home-cooks, and perfected by Chef Juan, Eat Offbeat's own Chief Culinary Officer, who has worked in restaurants with over 13 Michelin stars combined. The recipes have also been approved by thousands of New Yorkers (15,000, to be precise), who now rave about them.
We have not finalized the number of recipes and stories included: The more we raise in the campaign, the more chefs we will be able to hire and feature in the cookbook.

While this will be our first book at Eat Offbeat, everyone working on delivering has a ton of experience and we have surrounded ourselves with talented professionals such as Leanne Brown, Signe Birck, and Hanane Kahi.
That being said, there is a possibility of delays with printing and distribution of the cookbook but we will do our best to deliver all books on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Our chefs will take you on a half-day tour in NYC to discover their favorite shops for stocking their pantry and finding off-the-beaten path spices. The tour includes lunch at one of the chef’s favorite restaurants in the city. (Tours will be done in groups of 6 or less. This tour is for locals or anyone visiting NYC.)

Take a hands-on cooking class with the chefs at the Eat Offbeat kitchen in NYC. The chefs will teach you to cook a 3-course meal from 3 different countries, Your dinner parties will never be the same! (Classes will be held in groups of 6 or less. This class is for locals or anyone visiting NYC.)

updates.update_userinfo: 2020 has been hard. Let us end it on a sweeter note!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers,
*please scroll down for updates on shipping if you haven't received your book yet*
Let us start with some great news: our cookbook made it to the list of 30+ best cookbooks of 2020 according to delish!! This is a great testament to you, our backers, who saw the potential in us when this was just an idea.
We also have another piece of good news: we finally have our first product that ships nationwide and that you can order for yourself or for your loved ones anywhere in the US! Our recently-launched are a collection of our Chefs’ favorite holiday eats & treats, all hand-crafted with love and care, and beautifully packaged too. It’s the perfect gift for anyone looking to “travel” in the comfort of their own home

updates.update_userinfo: FIRST BATCH OF COOKBOOKS SHIPPED, SECOND BATCH SHIPPING OUT SOON!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!!!
How is everyone holding up? After three years of hard work, we are SO excited to announce that the first batch of cookbooks shipped out last week! If you haven't received your copy yet, scroll down for an estimated delivery time.
SHARE SHARE SHARE

updates.update_userinfo: BOOKS ARE HERE & READY TO SHIP!!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
We want to preface this by saying that the cookbooks are set to arrive at the warehouse next week and that backers will still get their books on schedule as per our last update. Books will be received throughout May and June, depending on where you live, and assuming no further “force majeure” situations unfold (i.e. COVID19-related closures at the warehouse, the postal service shutting down, etc.). You should have already received a separate survey from Kickstarter to fill out your most recent address (or preferred mailing address if you are quarantining somewhere other than your residence). Please fill out the survey as you can so we can make sure to start shipping shortly!

updates.update_userinfo: THANK YOU FOR PATIENCE - Books arriving at warehouse next week + we need your addresses!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers - 
Thanks so much for your patience since our last update. If you follow us on social media, you know these past three months have been the busiest in Eat Offbeat’s history--each month we've been thrilled to share our food with more New Yorkers than the one before! Now for some Cookbook updates:
GREAT NEWS! We are so so happy to finally reveal the cover and title of our book, The Kitchen Without Borders. We hope you love it as much as we do.

Hi Backers!
Hope everyone is having a wonderful start to the summer :) Sharing some updates with you below. 
Print: The first pass of the cookbook is in! We've spent the past few weeks at the kitchen carefully going through each recipe and each story with each chef to ensure the utmost authenticity and to make sure nothing was lost in translation. It has been such a proud and exciting experience for our team to see their pictures, dishes, recipes and stories come to life in this way! The book looks amazing and we can't wait for all of you to see it this winter.

updates.update_userinfo: FIRST PASS OF THE COOKBOOK IS IN!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers! 
Happy February. Coming to you with a recap on where we are so far + some exciting new updates! Make sure to scroll all the way to the bottom so you don't miss anything :) 
RECIPES: The cookbook will have between 60 and 80 recipes. 60 recipes are ready for print. There are an additional 20 recipes from our newest chefs that may be added as well, based on space availability once all the chef stories, chef portraits and photo-series, food photos and designs are put together. All recipes have been written down and tested. Workman’s design team has started working on their layout and design.

Hi Backers, 
Hope you all are staying warm this winter! Here at Eat Offbeat we've been busy recipe testing and are so excited to share that all recipes are now cookbook-ready. We're now in the process of wrapping up a photoshoot with award-winning photographer Penny De Los Santos and food stylist Nora Singley. We couldn't be prouder to work with them!!
Penny and Nora have been working with a large team from 8am to 6pm every day this week to cook, style and shoot 40 different dishes, plus a few different options for the cover. We can't wait to show you the finished product - the food looks as good as it tastes, if not better :) Next up - a photo shoot with the chefs!

campaign.story:
What is it about?
"And the Moon" is a musical short about a woman’s journey to allow herself to be vulnerable, to fall in love, and to openly embrace her desire for another woman. Late at night, at the end of a promising date, a young woman is caught off guard by her date’s open, direct desire for her. During their dance of seduction, time suddenly stands still as she considers her own feelings of love and the erotic attraction that she feels towards this other woman. Wordlessly, through dance, she grapples with her fear about publicly owning her queerness, as well as the universal fear of being vulnerable enough to fall in love with another person.
Why does it matter?
The film is an intimate portrait of love and attraction between two women that recognizes the fear that can accompany the pursuit of love that is framed as “other” by the culture at large, while also depicting the liberation and joy that’s possible after overcoming that fear and embracing one’s desires. In a medium that still suffers from intense gender inequality, this film features a female writer-director and choreographer, as well as an entirely female cast.
Visual Influences
    The film will be shot in high-contrast black and white, inspired by the lush romanticism of mid-20th century European art film, particularly Luchino Visconti’s Le notti bianche.
CAST
A California native, Adrianna Aguilar moved to New York in 2009 to attend Barnard College where she received her Bachelor of Arts in a Dance and in English. She has worked with renowned choreographers such as Jodi Melnick, Ori Flomin, Reggie Wilson and Brian Brooks before starting her own company, TREES, in 2014. TREES, The Rhythm Encompassing Every Sound, brings musicians, dancer and actors together to create collaborations that are performed in intimate spaces throughout New York City. Spike Hill, The Bowery Electric and Casa Mezcal are among the music venues where they have performed. 
Adrianna Aguilar
Gabby Beans is an actor and writer based in New York City. She recently completed her BA at Columbia in Theatre and Neuroscience, and MA in Acting from the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art. Recent Theatre credits include: After the Dark (La MaMa), The Rape of Lucrece (New York Shakespeare Exchange), /VANITAS/ (Dixon Place), Watch Me Burn (The Wild Project), Balm in Gilead (Shapiro Theater), Woe from Wit (Union Theological Seminary). Recent TV credits include I Love You, But I Lied (LMN).
Gabby Beans
 Maria Diez is a Mexican-American actress and singer who graduated from Columbia University. She is currently residing in NYC and occasionally Atlanta and Minneapolis. She recently wrote and performed pieces in Girl Be Heard's show Blurred Lines. Other highlights include: Desdemona in Othello (The Davenport), Callie in Stop Kiss (GMT Festival), Nina in The Seagull, and working with the Woodshed Collective. The interactive short film she's in,  "The Mystery At the Art Gallery", won runner up at The Tribeca Film Festival this past year. Maria has apprenticed with One Year Lease and the Williamstown Theatre Festival. Along with performing (and designing sets), Maria likes to dance, teach, and travel.             
Maria Diez
Raquel Chavez is a theater artist based in NYC by way of the Bay Area. As an actor, her recent credits have included Miranda in The Tempest with Smith Street Stage in Carroll Park & Emilia in Othello with The Brewing Department. Infused by her training in jazz and modern dance, her work strives to explore the subtle, yet meaningful junction of physical theater and choreographic storytelling, while keeping a watchful eye on the socio-political tides that shape our emotional landscapes. She studies Feldenkrais with Sita Mani and currently sings with the indie-rock band Rockaway based in Williamsburg. www.raquelmariechavez.com      
Raquel Chavez
CREW
WRITER/DIRECTOR
Shelley Farmer is a multi-disciplinary artist and writer based, like most multi-disciplinary artists and writers, in Brooklyn. She has performed at Jack (with Dave Malloy), Dixon Place, Here Arts Center, Union Theological Seminary, The Metropolitan Room, and some disheartening regional theaters. Her directing credits include productions of Carousel, Candide, Cabaret, and opera showcases. She is a former weekend editor for Paper Magazine, and her writing has appeared in Indiewire, The Museum of the Moving Image's Reverse Shot, FilmLinc Daily, and Film.com. She is also the repertory publicist at Film Forum. www.shelleyfarmer.com
Shelley Farmer
PRODUCER
Dan Bindschedler was born and raised in Ridgefield, CT and has lived in New York for the last 9 years. In addition to producing films, he is a professional cellist and a freelance copywriter. Bindschedler wrote and directed his debut short film, Anxiety, produced by Joe Cecchini and shot by Chris Tharp in 2017. He is currently writing a mock children’s book titled “Cello, My Name is Dan”
Daniel Bindschedler
DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY
Born in Haifa, Israel, Oren Soffer grew up in the United States watching Steven Spielberg movies and building LEGO sets. These activities laid the groundwork for what would eventually become his lifeblood - a burning love of all things film. Oren shot two features that were distributed theatrically and on VOD in 2016: ‘No Letting Go' starring Alysia Reiner, Kathy Najimy, Richard Burgi and others; and 'Little Miss Perfect' starring Karlee Roberts, Isabella Palmieri and Lilla Crawford. During his studies at NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts, Oren was nominated for the ASC Gordon Willis Student Heritage Award, and was a finalist for the Arri Volker Bahnemann Award for Cinematography. Oren has also shot dozens of short films, commercials and music videos, worked for a variety of clients including Discovery Channel, Bloomberg News, Time Inc, Refinery 29, Target, MTV, Nickelodeon, L’Oreal and Skype, and has worked on multiple feature films studying under acclaimed Director of Photography Reed Morano, ASC.
Oren Soffer
ARRANGER/COMPOSER (BALLET MUSIC)/PIANIST
Michael Gildin is a music director, pianist, and composer. A graduate of Columbia University, he has recently worked as a researcher and music assistant for several productions in New York City Center’s Encores! Series, contributing to the authentic reconstruction of musicals such as Cabin in the Sky and the Gershwins’ Lady, Be Good!. Michael regularly works with Broadway music director Rob Fisher as an assistant.
Michael Gildin
Promo photos by Todd Schmiedlin
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every short film comes with hurtles both expected and unexpected, but with our team of experienced producers and department heads (and your help!) we'll have all of the tools necessary to overcome them.

We hope to be submitting the film to festivals for 2018, with LGBT festivals Outfest in LA and Newfest in NY being intended outlets. With a festival submission plan and a schedule online release, we can ensure that this film won't fall off the face of the earth -- every donor and team member will have the opportunity to see it and celebrate your generosity!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
This weekend, we recorded the soundtrack for "And the Moon" and it turned out beautifully! Check out a picture of a candid moment from the studio below. 
StageBuddy has also published an interview with writer/director Shelley Farmer. You can learn more about the inspiration behind the film by reading the full interview here!
Amazing news - we've hit our first week goal of achieving 30% of our budget! Thank you so much to everyone who has donated. And please share!

The "And the Moon" team is thrilled to have been chosen by Women & Hollywood as one of this week's crowdfunding picks! 
In less than a week, we've hit almost 30% of our funding goal - thank you so much to everyone who has donated so far. 
Learn more about our project and other cool projects by female filmmakers at Women & Hollywood.

campaign.story:
Dear Friend, 
(if you love Quentin Blake and good storytelling you are definitely a friend of ours!) 
The little clown we want to bring to your attention today is the lovely, brave, tenacious, irrepressible, and generous protagonist of the wordless illustrated adventure, CLOWN, who came into being in 1995 thanks to Quentin Blake’s imaginative genius. 
After the great experience of designing exhibitions and books with Quentin Blake, we came up with the idea of bringing the unique story of CLOWN to life through animation.
Quentin thinks, “It’s a terrific idea!”
So we believe it is worth doing whatever we can to make it happen. 
Making a short film of such a wonderful book is an incredible challenge, but we are highly motivated and very enthusiastic about it. 
It’s such an inspiring story, and thanks to the universal language of animation and music, we have the unique chance to reach out to children from ages 0 to 99 all around the world. And we are even more excited to have a mentor as generous, wise, and friendly as Quentin Blake.

Over the past few years we have been working really hard to put this unique project into motion, and now we are finally doing it.
As a small independent Italian design studio, we believed that financing it through a crowdfunding campaign would have been the best way to guarantee complete creative freedom and faithfulness to Quentin Blake’s original work.
Unfortunately, word did not spread as far as we would have liked and so we have not managed to get enough backers to reach our ultimate goal. We did receive, however, enthusiastic support and feedback from all around the world, and so we believe the project should go on with the same energy and commitment, regardless.
You can find up-to-date information and follow our progress on the dedicated page www.quentinblake-clown.co.uk  
Subscribe to our special newsletter and follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram!  
Quentin Blake is with us all the way, and we are counting on your participation and enthusiasm too!
Luigi, Paolo, Stefano and all the passionate young team at Arteprima
CLOWN is a very special and unusual book because it has no text at all, thus allowing children to use their imagination by telling the story their own way and with their own words. Each retelling of the story is unique. We were really amazed by this, because not many children today are encouraged to tell stories spontaneously using their own creativity and imagination.
CLOWN tells a story of genuine generosity, friendship and tenacity.The values of sharing, loyalty and family (of any sort) are the key elements for our little protagonists to transform a moment of rejection and abandon into an opportunity: new friends, a new family and a new home are just around the corner.
Children are encouraged to empathise with the thrown away Clown and his toy friends and to learn from their experiences. Their story reminds us to appreciate the little things that can make us happy and to never give up.
Someone's rubbish could be someone else's treasure.
  CLOWN Thrown Away will be an animated short film in Arteprima's captivating storytelling style.
In an uncommon mix of cut-out and frame by frame animation, we will recreate Quentin's unique lively watercolours and his signature page-turning elements.
Like a silent film, it will be accompanied by just a soundtrack, therefore speaking the universal language understood by all children: music. 
    Having been thrown unceremoniously into a bin with other unwanted old toys, a little CLOWN decides to take their future into his own hands. 
Bravely and with irrepressible optimism he goes off in search of help. And a new home.
