campaign.story:
Shea is one of the last institutions of an entire generation of DIY music venues in New York City. Now, it's existence is under threat from a variety of governmental & political factors. We want to make Shea a completely legal, 100% permitted venue to protect its future. If you believe in the value of DIY music spaces in NYC, join us to make this a reality.
Just another night at Shea, photo by Richard Gin
What Is Shea Stadium?
Shea Stadium is an all ages music venue in NYC dedicated to recording & documenting the ever evolving artistic landscape of the city. The idea is simple - we invite artists to come play, record them, and pay them for the service.  
When we first opened Shea Stadium in 2009 we never expected the space would become a full-time venue. In fact, Shea was originally intended to act mainly as a recording studio but to keep the lights on, we began throwing more shows to subsidize our rent. Over the years our calendar grew, but we never stopped recording.
Over the years Shea's amassed an archive of live music of over 10,000 tracks from nearly 1,000 bands, documenting an entire era in New York City's independent music scene. Since 2011, we've been streaming highlights and full performances ad-free on our website and have always given artists free access and full rights to their recordings to release and profit from them as they see fit.
But it's never just been about the people on the stage -- Shea's run by an ever-growing network of volunteers, interns and band members. When we started nearly a decade ago, we had no real or previous experience in running a venue or booking shows. We were armed only with a few brooms, a PA system, and an intense passion for the music being made in our city and other DIY networks around the world. We try to pass the empowerment we found in learning through doing down through our interns, who have been vital in shaping the identity of our space, and who have put the knowledge they've gained to work towards accomplishing their goals in NYC and beyond.
For more info on Shea's history & the archives:
The New Yorker - "Long Live Shea Stadium"
New York Times - "Playing at Shea, Not The Mets" 
Village Voice - "One Night At Shea Stadium"
NPR - "10 Recordings You Should Hear from Shea Stadium's Vault"
Reopening a More Sustainable Shea
We want to make Shea a completely legal, 100% permitted venue to protect its future.  
Starting in January 2017 Shea began receiving a series of violations related to the legal use, zoning and licensing of our building. Some shows were interrupted, some were shut down and as a result, many were moved to other venues. There were no vacate orders given and our building was not condemned or deemed unsafe; we chose to shut down preemptively to prevent racking up more expensive fines and risking more serious repercussions.
A variety of governmental & political factors threaten the existence of spaces like Shea. We had always treated the possibility of a shutdown as inevitable but as we stare down the insanely powerful forces that stand between us and full legalization, we now know we owe it to the community to continue despite a long road ahead.  
Shea Stadium: lifting people up since 2009, photo by Seth Applebaum
Shea is one of the last institutions of an entire generation of DIY music venues in New York City. Over the years we've been saddened to see our peers in all ages artist-run spaces like Death By Audio, Market Hotel, 285 Kent & Monster Island Basement have to shutter their doors due to a wide range of circumstances beyond their control.  
When a space shuts down, musicians don't just lose a place to play. Every space is the focal point of an entire ecosystem of artists that provide support & fosters creative action in the world. 
And it's not only the artistic community that loses out - the repercussions are felt on a much larger scale.  A recent study done by the city of New York showed that small music venues generated $21 billion of revenue in 2015 alone. Yet since the year 2000 more small venues have closed than ever before, as the city's increased regulation and inflated rents have made running these types of spaces an uphill climb.  
Over the past eight years Shea's become a space where people of all ages can go and know that they will be able to see their favorite artists not on a pedestal or behind barriers, but face to face where real connections are made. These connections change lives and open up doors of possibility to young people and aspiring artists in this city.
Told Slant performing at Shea, photo by Richard Gin
What's the Plan?
So you may be asking yourself "if it was going so well, why does Shea need my help?" 
It's because since day one we've put the artists first. For years, we've operated at the lowest possible overhead in order to maximize profits, not for ourselves but for the struggling musicians, artists, and comedians who come through our doors.  
Your generosity will bring back Shea better than ever. We've always sought to reflect what this community expects and needs from a space, and operating above board means we can have higher visibility and open up to new types of programming, including free daytime events & workshops to serve you better.  Once we meet our goal we can begin work to open the space to the public later this year.
Raising these funds will help us make the necessary renovations and acquire all the necessary permits to make Shea more sustainable.  
You'd help Shea pay for:
renovations to pass inspection by the Dept of Buildings, FDNY & Dept of Health ($20,000)
architect fees for drafting plans & filing permits ($13,000)
fire safety training ($1,000)
health & bar permits ($7,000)
legal fees ($14,000)
Shea needs your help and we have no doubt the community will do what it does best: when one of us falls, we pick each other up. The show must go on, and it will with your help. Donate now and do your part in preserving all ages community spaces in NYC.
Sincerely,
Adam, Nora, Luke & the Shea Stadium Family
Guerilla Toss performing at Shea, photo by Walter Wlodarczyk
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
++ After consulting with several architects and attorneys over the past few weeks, we're optimistic about our ability to bring our space up to full legal code. Ultimately, however, how long and expensive of a process this will be is largely up to the experienced professionals we'll hire to help, our community board, and the inspectors of various city organizations.

++ When you don't own your building there are no 100% guarantees. As renters there are factors that are beyond our control. This fundraising effort will put us in the best position to continue Shea for as long as possible
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: A brief update from the Shea crew as things begin to open up again in NYC !

updates.update_userinfo: Where We've Been, What We're Working On & The Future of Shea
updates.update_content:
Friends & Donors,
We appreciate your patience and support as we continue to search for Shea's next location!  It's been a little while since you've heard from us so we'd like to take an opportunity to update you all.
First, we do admit to being on the quieter side as we navigate the less glamorous aspects of NYC real estate.  Since leaving Meadow St we've toured 30+ spaces, called hundreds of numbers and looked through thousands & thousands of real estate listings.  We've entered negotiations a handful of times, and made offers on five spaces we found during our search.

With the summer behind us we're coming down the home stretch of our search for a new space!
Although finding the right place to pick up where we left off has been challenging, our search hasn't been fruitless. We've combed hundreds of listings, seen dozens of spaces big and small all over the city and have had serious considerations with a handful of spaces, the most recent of which we're still in negotiations with.

In a previous update, we set an October 1st deadline for finding a new space for Shea to continue but with that due date fast approaching we're feeling far from ready to give up. We want to notify you, in advance of the date, that we're extending our efforts through the end of 2018. During this time we will be all in-- kicking our efforts into their highest gear yet and exploring all options that have the best chance of giving this story a happy ending. Our time spent away has only strengthened the belief that what we've built together is needed in NYC now more than ever.

We hope that you're still on board with being a vital part of Shea's return but if you feel that this new window of time isn't acceptable, we'll issue you a refund on 10/1 no questions asked. We'll continue to use this space to update you on our progress, and if you have any information, ideas, or real estate tips to share with us, don't hesitate to reach out while we try to win this thing in overtime.

Thank you for sticking with us through the ups and downs of the past year-- without you this opportunity for a second chance would have never been possible. We miss you all terribly and can't wait to step out of this phase and into the future at *new* Shea in 2019.

<3
A N L & The Shea Family

It's hard to believe it's already been one year since our campaign ended!  So what's the news since you've last heard from us? 

The crew is still hard at work to bring Shea back. Earlier this year we were in serious consideration of an exciting and relatively affordable space a few times bigger than 20 Meadow.  Having that much room seemed to give lots of opportunities to grow.  We came close to settling into the building as our new home, but after more intense examination of the logistics involved in running a large space we came to the decision that's not what would make for a great Shea Stadium.  We want to keep doing what we do well and focusing on bringing you live shows in an intimate environment, and in a space that has a better shot at sustainability.

Though that space is behind us we're refined in our purpose.  We're still very optimistic about bringing Shea back and we've seen particularly promising spaces in the past few weeks. We'll continue to consider our options and update you all on our progress as we can.

As we continue our search we also want to honor the faith you've put in us one year ago.  We're announcing today a deadline of to sign a lease on a new space.  If we're not able to find a suitable location for a new Shea by then, we'll be refunding all donations made to the campaign.

We're just as blown away by you all as we were 12 months ago, thank you again for your patience and generosity and we look forward to seeing you at a new stadium in the future!

<3 Always
A N L & The Shea Fam
We've been out of 20 Meadow St for three months - here's what's been going on!

campaign.story:
Nicolas Jaar in Conversation with Lydia Lunch
Lydia Lunch has defined the underground music and art scene for over thirty years. Predictable only in her unpredictability, she has exploited every creative outlet at her disposal, from film to books, photography to poetry. —San Francisco Weekly
Lydia Lunch traffics in the reality behind the reality. Think of the Situationists, or Henry Miller, or Duchamp’s final masterpiece, Etant Donné….Like Duchamp, Lunch has created that secret, eroto-violent universe spied through the keyhole to which she alone holds the key. — Jerry Stahl
HOW IT BEGAN
I've known and worked with Lydia Lunch since she was 19 and I was 23.  We grew up in the late '70s New York music/film/art scene and brought our radical visions to the underground where we broke boundaries, both shocking and enticing our audiences with our uncensored music and films.  Fast forward to several months ago, as I watched the ever brash and luminous Lydia Lunch performing with her extraordinary band, RETROVIRUS, I realized that I needed to make the definitive documentary, LYDIA LUNCH The War is Never Over.
Lydia Lunch performing at HOWL! Happening (Photo: Bob Krasner)
No Wave legend, and confrontationist, Lydia has changed and influenced the world around her and continues to be at the forefront of psycho-sexual transgressive music and spoken word performance.  I hope you will join me on this journey that will take us into the conscious and unconscious depths of her wide ranging issues from patriarchy to sexuality and the brutality of war with rare emotional honesty and intimacy.
                        Lydia Lunch (1978) 
ABOUT THE FILM
The feature documentary, LYDIA LUNCH The War is Never Over, will voice and visualize the extraordinary, outrageous work and life of spoken word artist and singer, Lydia Lunch. We will follow her on the road back to her hometown of Rochester, on tour, backstage, and in interviews revealing the radical mind, the visceral music, and the edgy, philosophical, and humorous personality of Lunch.
Interview at the Roxy Hotel (Photo: Aom Pinyopusarerk)
We have already filmed a major interview with Lydia at the Roxy Hotel as well as with 26-year-old Nicolas Jaar, music producer and DJ. Influenced by Lydia's music at age 10, Nico went on to collaborate with her on a new mix of Lunch's seminal spoken word piece, Conspiracy of Women. We also interviewed Bibbe Hansen of Warhol fame who, with the encouragement of Lydia, has now written hundreds of pages of her memoirs from her wild child times. Not only is this film about Lydia Lunch, but the scene that she continues to grow and influence; creative people throughout the world who join Lydia to break the rules with purpose and vision.
ABOUT LYDIA
A little background for the uninitiated! In 1976 at age sixteen, teenage runaway and autodidact Lydia Lunch arrived in New York inspired by the ravings of Lester Bangs in Creem Magazine, the Velvet Underground’s sarcastic wit, the glamour of the New York Dolls, and the poetic scat of Patti Smith’s Piss Factory.  In 1977, she founded the hugely influential No Wave band, Teenage Jesus and the Jerks. 
Photo & Design by Julia Gorton
This is when I first witnessed Lydia onstage and she has been an inspiration to me ever since. She was singing/screaming poetry in the most menacing and brutal style, inhabiting a new way of envisioning "woman."  She awakened the angst and alienation of that time. I got up my nerve and asked her to act in the cult classic, Black Box. Clad in black leather mini-skirt, spiked heels, and screaming, "Shut up and Suffer," Lydia made cinematic history.
Teenage Jesus and the Jerks (1978)
In early 1978, artist and producer Brian Eno attended a series of shows at Artist's Space and produced No New York, an anthology LP featuring the four strongest bands—Teenage Jesus and the Jerks, The Contortions, Mars and DNA.  The recording remains as one of the most influential—and extraordinarily bold—debuts of the time.
No New York Album
Lunch has released more than 30 albums and played with countless influential bands.
Teenage Jesus and the Jerks
13.13
8-Eyed Spy
Shotgun Wedding
RETROVIRUS
Big Sexy Noise
Cypress Grove
Medusa’s Bed 
 Throughout her career Lunch has defied categorization and actively conquered new territories—gaining international recognition for the innovative quality of her work.
8 Eyed Spy LIVE (1981)
  Queen of Siam
HOW WE WILL USE YOUR MONEY 
LYDIA LUNCH The War is Never Over has begun production.  We have shot in-depth interviews with Lydia Lunch, musician Nicolas Jaar, and writer Bibbe Hansen.  We have filmed some live performances.  A truly extraordinary one was just this past weekend, March 4, 2017, at HOWL! Happening.  Lydia was on fire and she lit up the audience with the fierce and insightful words that emanated from her entire being.  Very inspiring!
Photo: Jasmine Hirst
Right now, we need to raise at least $50,000 to film Lydia on tour with her band, RETROVIRUS, performing her spoken word as well as interviewing pivotal people in Lydia’s life.
Weasel Walter
Thurston Moore
Ron Athey
Jim Sclavunos 
Donita Sparks 
JG Thirlwell
Jerry Stahl
These interviews will provide an audio bed of stories in a fast-cutting After Effects timeline of Lydia’s life with the architectural landscape of New York City circa 1977 to the present.  This will not only be wildly entertaining, but for the first time, give viewers an insider's look at the scene Lydia hails from.
Ultimately, the film will frame Lunch’s music and performance through the lens of the various philosophical themes that have obsessed her for years: sex, violence, drugs, deviance, porn, feminism, misogyny, lust and love...a rule breaker not easily defined and never constrained! 
Give what you can and be part of the reemergence of underground filmmaking!
A SENSE OF URGENCY
We need every one of you to help make this a reality. No contribution is too small. And the rewards are great!  But, the biggest reward is the impact we all will have on the culture.  We hope LYDIA LUNCH The War is Never Over, with its wit, honesty, balls out, mouth open attitude, will help us all to kick the ball forward, toward a future in which we truly have liberation of the mind and body and a new sense of healing from trauma.
SPREAD THE WORD
Word of mouth is how we’re going to build our audience.  Please email, Facebook, Instagram, Tweet…even pick up the phone!
WHY KICKSTARTER
I grew up in the New York underground film scene before indie filmmaking was even a phrase. We were idealists who were going to buck the system by making DIY confrontational films, uncensored and uncompromising.  I've been doing it for 40 years and my approach to this film continues the rebel independent tradition.  I'm working with Kickstarter because it is truly a platform that put the power back into the hands of the creator and the audience.  This film needs to be made and as an idealist, I know there are those like-minded people out there who want to see it as well.  There is an urgency to tell these stories!  We aren't getting any younger!
xox Beth B
Beth B & Lydia Lunch (Photo: Curt Hoppe)
REWARDS
*** NEW REWARDS FOR THE FINAL DAYS OF THE CAMPAIGN ***

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The great news is that we have begun production on the film and prior Beth B films have received critical acclaim and screenings at film festivals and theaters worldwide. With your support we will be able to pay for the first phase, which will cover the production costs and then be poised for post and finishing. With my track record, there is no doubt that we will be able to raise post-production and finishing funds and release the film.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: BIG APOLOGY for the delay in DVDs and streaming links...
updates.update_content:
Dear All,
I know that some of you have been waiting very patiently for the release of the film and then, the rewards that would be sent upon the DVD and streaming release, however, we must delay everything until the release of the film theatrically. Please know that we cannot wait for YOU to see it,  but because of COVID-19 we will be delayed until probably next Spring/Summer. I'm so sorry, but if we send files or DVDs out, we will be prevented from getting any distribution. 
We hope that you can be a bit more patient. It has been a devastating blow to have worked for years on Lydia's film, have it finally completed, invited to some incredible festivals, and to then been unable to show at these festivals we worked so hard to line up. Many thanks for your continued support and understanding.

updates.update_userinfo: LYDIA LUNCH - THE WAR IS NEVER OVER...A GREAT BOOK TO READ!!
updates.update_content:
LYDIA LUNCH: THE WAR IS NEVER OVER      
A COMPANION BOOK TO THE FILM BY BETH B       by NICK SOULSBY
GREAT NEWS--our book has been released on Jawbone Press. http://jawbonepress.com/

SXSW Official Selection
Hello to our wonderful supporters!! We hope you are all safe and healthy. 
The world is screaming--stay home...stay healthy...we are listening as we hope you are too. Sadly, we will not be screening anywhere until this state of emergency has passed. Thinking of everyone far and near and thank you for the wonderful ecstatic reception the film has already received.

updates.update_content:
Allow me to send thanks to all the incredible individuals who have supported LYDIA LUNCH - The War is Never Over, by contributing their time, talent, money and enthusiasm.
I was recently invited to experience Beth’s final cut of the documentary and it is, I must admit, overwhelming. Her understanding, insight and vision into the work I have done for the past 4 decades is soul searing. How she managed to extract the true essence of what I stand for, interview so many amazing artists and dig out a vast wealth of archival footage, is testament to her relentless pursuit and unbelievable passion, and I feel absolutely honored to have been the subject of such incredible dedication.

I thank Beth, Kathleen Fox and everyone who has been part of this amazing journey. Of course, there is still more work to do - editing, sound mixing, and color correction.

updates.update_userinfo: WE'RE ALMOST THERE...! AND, come to one of Lydia's upcoming shows!!!
updates.update_content:
Thank you for your incredible patience in this creative endeavor. We are inching toward a fine cut of the film...still needing to tweak and revise this 90 minute cut. It looks great, it sounds great, Lydia is great...the journey we take is great.
Fantastic news! We screened the cut for Lydia and she was ecstatic - "beyond my wildest expectations!" And, from Lydia (one of the most brutal critics alive) this is beyond my expectations. It's one of the most difficult things - screening the film for the subject of a documentary. Suddenly, they are seeing themselves up close and personal for 90 minutes. So, it's with great relief that I'm bringing you this wonderful news.

campaign.story:
Why are there hundreds of food magazines but none about the future of food? 
With your help, that can change today. I’m LinYee and I’m the founder and editor of MOLD, a platform about designing the future of food. Since 2013 we’ve published over 400 stories online, curated an exhibition, published a newspaper, hosted a pop-up food cafe and produced a beautiful, versatile kitchen product. We’ve grown our readership to over 20 countries, made 40,000 friends on Instagram and Facebook and met amazing chefs, designers, scientists and farmers along the way.
Now we’re ready to take our ideas to print. 
  Preview of MOLD Magazine Issue 01
  By the year 2030, the United Nation predicts that there will be more people on this planet than we can feed. Technology and science can change how and what we eat, but design is critical in bringing these ideas together to create products that are elegant, intelligent and useful in combatting the coming food crisis. It is now more urgent than ever to engage in this conversation about the future of food.
By backing our project, you’ll help launch the first print magazine dedicated to the future of food. You'll provide the seed funding to research, write and commission artwork for our debut issues—and, of course, you’ll get some fun, collaborative products from our generous community.
PRESS
MOLD's Debut Issue
Issue 01: Designing the Human Microbiome is almost done and it will be a groundbreaking, 100+ page full-color glossy magazine with 20 stories featuring the work of talented chefs and designers including:
We’ll be discussing everything from kimchi philosophy to natural wine, sewer robots to Japanese toilets, synthetic biology to fungal futures and how these ideas might help us feed a hungry planet in the near future.
Design
Heavy-hitting designers are not just our subjects but they’re also our collaborators. Issue 01 is being designed by the talented team of Eric Hu and Matt Tsang who have created a type treatment and unique system for showcasing these ideas.
Fungal Futures by Peter McCoy of Radical Mycology
    Geophagia by Abbye Churchill
  Geophagia by Abbye Churchill, Story Spread
  Toilet Technology from the Land of TOTO by LinYee Yuan, MOLD
               Let's change the conversation together.
We’re thrilled about the opportunity to explore topics around the future of food through issue-specific deep dives. We’ve planned the themes for the first six issues and are already working on Issue 02: A Place at the Table which will explore experimental utensils, virtual reality dining, nomadic furniture and more. If we reach our funding goal, we will produce the following issues:
02: A Place at the Table - experimental utensils, virtual reality dining, furniture, synaesthesia, dining rituals
03: Waste Not Want Not - reducing food waste, edible packaging
And it will be the seed money to work on more issues including:
04: Kitchen Confidential - smart kitchen, big data, custom meal kits, food "technology" in the home
05: New Agriculture - personal produce, lab-grown meats, insect farms
06: Terra Nova - farming on Mars, astronaut food, climate cuisine
Why $34,000?
There are a variety of costs associated with producing a print magazine. 
Based on 1000 Copies of Issue 01
  Your support will allow us to:
Print Issue 01
Research and write stories for Issue 02 and 03
Hire illustrators and photographers to create images for Issue 02 and 03
Build a foundation for the future: we’d like to publish two print issues a year and reaching our goal will help set us up to do that.
The Rewards
A .PDF version of MOLD Magazine Issue #01 and access to backer updates!
  MOLD Magazine Issue #01 at a Kickstarter exclusive price. Support the first magazine to focus on the future of food!
   MOLD Magazine Issue #01 and your choice of Market Tote OR Tea Towel PLUS a limited edition pineapple pin.
  MOLD Magazine Issue #01 and MOLD's Life Measured Pitcher, the most versatile tool for all your daily needs.
  A 2017 subscription to MOLD Magazine Issues #01 and #02, "thank you" in print and online PLUS a full product pack.
  Issues #01-06 of MOLD Magazine plus a "thank you" in our debut issue and online.
   Issues #01-06 of MOLD Magazine PLUS a signed copy of "On Eating Insects" (Phaidon) by the Nordic Food Lab and an Aketta roasted cricket sampler.
  Issues #01-06 of MOLD Magazine and a "thank you" in our debut issue and online. Plus a full product pack. BONUS: A private tour of the Museum of Food and Drink with MOLD's Editor and the Director of the Museum.
  A Kombucha Scoby, Sourdough Starter and handmade Fermentation Fan ‘Zine from the kitchen of our editor. And you'll get Issues #01-06 of MOLD Magazine and a "thank you" in our debut issue and online. Plus a full product pack.
  A 5-course homecooked dinner at our editor’s home. And you'll also get Issues #01-06 of MOLD Magazine, a "thank you" in our debut issue and online, plus a full product pack.
                       Co-publish a story on thisismold.com! And you'll also get Issues #01-06 of MOLD Magazine, a "thank you" in our debut issue and online, plus a full product pack.
   Your ad in an upcoming issue of MOLD Magazine. And you'll also get Issues #01-06 of MOLD Magazine, a "thank you" in our debut issue and online, plus a full product pack.
  Our editor will do a live workshop or presentation with you and your team. You'll also get Issues #01-06 of MOLD Magazine and a "thank you" in our debut issue and online. Plus a full product pack.
  Sponsor a single issue of MOLD Magazine with digital and in-book ad + sponsored feature story. And you'll also get Issues #01-06 of MOLD Magazine, a "thank you" in our debut issue and online, plus a full product pack.
 Why Kickstarter?
We wouldn't be able to do this without you. Since we started MOLD, we have been an advertising-free platform solely dedicated to sharing the inspiring work of innovative food designers around the world.  Kickstarter is an incredible opportunity to connect with people like you who are interested in the future of food. Plus, it'll provide seed funding for our print efforts.
Thank You
When we launched MOLD in 2013, we didn't anticipate the interest and support in our independent media platform—it has been a humbling and exhilarating ride. We are so thankful for all the designers, farmers, scientists and artists who have trusted us to share their stories with you. 
Thanks to everyone who helped make this campaign a reality. We couldn't have done this without the support of our collaborators.
And most importantly, THANK YOU for liking, commenting and sharing stories with us. We're so thrilled to count you as part of this community.
Video Credits
Produced by Carlos Carneiro, London Sessions
Video by Simon Benjamin, All Courtesy Of
Motion Graphics by The Tremellings
Edited by Alex Kasstan
Research by Emilia Morano-Williams
Download Press Kit
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Even though this is the first issue of MOLD Magazine, the team behind it has been making magazines for years including stints at The FADER, Core77, Pin-Up Magazine, Theme, The New York Times Style Magazine and Verso Books and more. Johnny Drain, the co-editor for Issue 01, holds a PhD in Material Science and conducted research at NOMA’s famed Nordic Food Lab. 

We have identified a printer for Issue 01 and have begun researching collaborators and stories for Issue 02: A Place at the Table. 

Additionally, our vendors and distribution for all of our collaborative reward products are in place and ready to go. 

If we reach our funding goal, we can guarantee three solid issues of MOLD Magazine and delivery on all rewards. This fundraising effort is seed money for us to get this print magazine off the ground but we’ll continue to look for sponsorship for Issues 04 and beyond.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
She Found Fossils is a children's book about women in paleontology. It details the history, present diversity, and up-and-coming paleontologists in a storybook way with original illustrations that kids will love. It will be published in English and Spanish so that it's accessible to a wider audience.
We want this book to showcase the diversity of careers and ethnicities that are present in paleontology today, while highlighting the scientific accomplishments of women worldwide.
The book will be 8.5x8.5 inches and softcover and also available in ebook format.
The fundraising goal we've set here is the minimum we need to cover illustration, translation edits, and publication costs.
Funds exceeding $4000 will be used to print additional copies of the book for donation to libraries and schools worldwide. Funds exceeding $5000 will be used be used to cover the voluntary work of writing and advertising the book.
UPDATE on March 14, 2017: New fundraising goals: at $15,500 we can translate the book into 2 additional languages. At $20,500 we can translate the book into 3 additional languages.
____________________________________
Ella Encontró Fósiles es un libro para niños sobre mujeres paleontólogas. Es un libro sobre la historia, la diversidad presente y las paleontólogas que vienen en la forma de cuentos con ilustraciones originales que encantan a los niños. El libro será publicado en inglés y en español para hacerlo accesible a una audiencia más amplia. Queremos que este libro muestre la diversidad de carreras y etnicidades que están presentes en la paleontología hoy en día y, al mismo tiempo, que destaque los logros científicos de mujeres en el mundo.
 El libro será de 8.5x8.5 pulgadas y con tapa blanda y también estará disponible en formato ebook.
 Los objetivos de fondos que establecimos aquí es lo mínimo que necesitamos para cubrir el costo de las ilustraciones, edición, traducción y publicación.
 Los fondos que excedan los $4000 serán usados para imprimir copias adicionales del libro para ser donados a bibliotecas y escuelas en todo el mundo. Los fondos que excedan los $5000 serán usados para cubrir el trabajo voluntario de escribir y publicitar el libro.
INFORME el 3 the Marzo, 2017: Tenemos nuevos objetivos para los fondos: con $15,500 podemos traducir el libro en 2 idiomas adicionales. Con $20,500 podemos traducir el libro en 3 idiomas adicionales.

updates.update_userinfo: End of Summer Updates/ Novedades del fin del Verano
updates.update_content:
Hello!
We have been hard at work since the end of our fundraising campaign. We completed all of the research for the historical section, conducted interviews for the present section, and collected photos for the future section. Most of the writing is complete. All of the draft images are complete for the historical section. As of right now, we seem to be on time for publication in December. 
You can look for monthly updates here:
http://www.drneurosaurus.com/she-found-fossilsella-encontro-fosiles/
Thank you for your support! 
- The  Team (Eugenia, Abby, and Amy)

Hello everyone! We've now successfully fundraised the money for this project and it's time to get to work! Thank you all for your support.
Hola a todos! Ya terminamos de juntar los fondos para este proyecto y es hora de trabajar! Gracias a todos por su apoyo.

Hello! We're entering our last week of fundraising so there's still time to preorder a copy of the book and other fun goodies. If we raise another $4000 we'll be able to translate the book into a 4th language, making it even more accessible to children across the globe. Thank you all for your generous support.
Hola! Ya estamos en la semana final de juntar fondos, así que aún hay tiempo de encargar una copia del libro y otras cosas divertidas. Si juntamos $4000 más, vamos a poder traducir el libro en un cuarto idioma, haciéndolo aún más accesible para niños a través del globo. Gracias a todos por su apoyo generoso.

Hello! We've reached the halfway point in our fundraising campaign and with 2 weeks left, we'd like to announce a couple of stretch goals. We currently have enough funds to translate the book into 1 additional language. If we raise $15,500, we'll have enough money to translate the book into 2 additional languages. If we raise $20,500, we'll have enough to do 3 additional languages! These additional translations will not be available through the Kickstarter, but will be available for purchase through Amazon shortly after the English and Spanish versions are released. Additional languages will be chosen soon, but we're looking into French, Mandarin, Arabic, German, Portuguese, and Korean. Thank you all for your support!

Hello! After 1 week of fundraising we've reached, and exceeded, our initial fundraising goals. We are now looking into partnering up with a book distribution service to donate books to institutions all around the US.
We've had requests for the book in additional languages (French, Madarin, Korean, German, Portuguese) so we are also getting quotes on additional translation services. Stay tuned for an updated fundraising goal with these objectives in mind later this week.

campaign.story:
1) Pair it with Your Social Media Apps
Works with Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Snapchat, stock alerts, weather, and emails - any app that has a notification on your phone!
Soshees is the world’s first life-like robot dog. It fits in the palm of your hand and interacts with your social media!  
                Media can contact us at media@soshees.com
Designed by renowned animatronics creators at John Nolan Studio in London  
We partnered with the best experts in life-like robotics at John Nolan Studio in London (Harry Potter, Pirates fo the Caribbean, and more), to bring to bring the first life-like robot dog into your home.  
  Utilizing the best in Bluetooth and smartphone apps to connect to your world  
We use Bluetooth technology and an app for your phone to give you programmable functions that you can sync with Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or any other app that has push notifications.  
  Small enough to fit in your pocket, or sit on your office desk, a Soshee is the cute and cuddly way to get the alerts that you care about. 
  Soshee comes in three colors – black, white, and brown
    PLAY

  1) Pair it with You Social Media & Apps 
Works with Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Snapchat, stock alerts, weather, and emails - any app on your phone that has a notification!
2) Select Desired Responses
Tail wag, bark, growl, sit, stand, stretch, shake head, wag tail - you pick the responses and sync it with the different app notifications.
3) Wait for Notification...
A like, a tweet, a comment, a friend request, a message - any notification you set will trigger a different reaction from your pup.
4) Soshee Delight!! 
    Soshees started with an idea in 2015 - what if you could combine a life-like robotic with your every day social media use? We immediately began looking for the best in animatronics to design our first prototype. This led us to John Nolan Studios in London
By the spring of 2016, the design plans began coming into place. 
  By the Summer of 2016, our first prototypes began to take shape. 
    PLAY

 By the fall of 2016, the design was (literally) taking on a life of its own.
In October, our prototypes arrived from the UK to the USA!
  We spent the rest of the year working out all of the kinks, and finishing the software development. By January, our Soshees was humming along, and ready for its public debut!
  $5 – Coffee and a Shout Out! 
Our team is working 'round the clock to make Soshee come to life. We are consuming tons of coffee. Help us out by buying us a cup of joe, and we will give you a social media shout out! 
$25– Soshees T-Shirt 
The robots are coming... and they're freaking adorable!! Get our Soshees Classic Tee - be a part of the revolution in life-like robotics! 
$149 – Soshees Early Bird + T-Shirt 
Be the FIRST to receive your Soshee with this LIMITED Set - the first 50 to purchase will receive a Soshee, a T-Shirt, an early adopter shout out on our social media. 
$169 – One Soshee 
It has fur. It's cuddly. It doesn't poop or pee on your rug. It doesn't chew your charger cord. It connects you to your world. You MUST have one! 
$299 – Two Soshees 
If one Soshee is good, two must be better – right?? 
$1,299 – Soshee Ten Pack 
Want to retail Soshee? Get a whole litter!
SOLD OUT $129 – Soshees Super Early Bird & Beta Test
  John Nolan is an award-winning animatronics designer based in London. While you may not have heard of him, you have definitely seen his work in movies such as Harry Potter, Clash of the Titans, and on programs on the Discovery Channel and PBS. 
Jason Buzi is an entrepreneur based in the San Fancisco Bay Area. He gained world-wide recognition in the summer of 2015 with the social experiment for good, Hidden Cash. He came up with the Soshees concept. 
Savannah Peterson is a tech advocate and evangelist. She was named Forbes 30 Under 30 list in Consumer Technology and teaches at Stanford, NYU, and PACE University. 
Jon Copper is a tech enthusiast and digital strategist that joined the team in 2015. He runs Flourish Digital, a marketing agency focusing on the success of start-ups.
Igor Dralyuk is a software engineer based in Silicon Valley. 
  Weight: 10 ounces
Height: 4.5 inches
Length: 6 inches
Width: 2.75 inches 
The Soshee weighs in at 10 ounces (about the weight of an iPad mini) and is 4.5 inches tall (the height of a regular smartphone) and comes with four servo motors that bring it to life!
Accomplished
Final Physical Prototype Completed - October  2016
App and Software Development Completed - January 2017
Moving Forward
Crowdfunding Campaign - March 16th - April 13th, 2017
Manufacturer & Materials Search - March and April 2017
We are currently using our design connections through John Nolan studio in London to find the right partner to manufacture this product in scale, as well as identify the best companies to provide the materials needed for larger production of the Soshee. 
Initiate Manufacturing - May 2017
Once source materials  and a manufacturing partner have been vetted and selected, we will begin manufacturing in order to remain on our fall delivery timeline. 
Beta Testing - July & August 2017
Work out all the bugs and kinks with field testing of our product with actual consumers. Want to beta-test? See qualifications for pledge level!
Kickstarter Order Fulfillment - September 2017
We are ready to give YOU the SOSHEES!! Ship 'em out!

support.title: Kollabpromat (Collaborative Kompromat).
support.descp: Interest in being part of this project is at an all time high. But the limited edition rewards of fictional kompromat I'll be creating are all gone. To empower the vast community of potential backers who want to be part of this project, I've created this new reward. By pledging $2 I will allow you to doctor up one fictional kompromat on me, your creator. When you and your comrades send me all of the alleged dirt you have on me, I will edit and publish a short dossier including every tell-all detail in the form of an open Project Update for all to see. Entries must be submitted by mid-April 2017.

support.title: Full Kompromat Dossier.
support.descp: You thought what Christopher Steele found was dark? Wait til you find out what I have on you. I have two kids and a full-time job so I have no time to really produce this incredible dossier on your truly lurid and unproven behavior, which is why this is so expensive. But should you pledge for this dossier, I will pay a designer to design it, I may or may not pay a someone to do some light opposition research on you, and it will be fairly lengthy, say five to ten pages.

support.title: One Kompromat. (No loyalty edition.)
support.descp: I will imagine out of thin air and write down one completely outlandish "fact" about you that — should it ever be made public — would do irreparable damage to your reputation. Pledging for this reward does not ensure my loyalty. I cannot promise this will not be publicly revealed.

support.title: One Kompromat.
support.descp: I will imagine out of thin air and write down one completely outlandish "fact" about you that — should it ever be made public — would do irreparable damage to your reputation. Pledging for this reward ensures my loyalty that it will not be publicly revealed. You and you alone receive this kompromat.

support.title: One Pin (early bird)
support.descp: One McMansion pin.

support.title: One Pin
support.descp: One McMansion pin.

support.title: Two Pins (early bird)
support.descp: Two McMansion pins (one for you and one for your scathing architectural critic friend).

support.title: Two Pins
support.descp: Two McMansion pins (one for you and one for your scathing architectural critic friend).

support.title: THREE Pins
support.descp: Oh, ok, moneybags over here wants a small HANDFULL.

support.title: Lost Boy
support.descp: You're a lost boy! You'll get a special thanks as well as exclusive access to the behind the scenes content of the film. You might even learn to fly.

support.title: Rufios Army
support.descp: You're part of Rufio's elite squad You'll get all the above, as well as a personalized thank you letter from Dante and the filmmaking team.

support.title: You're Believing Peter
support.descp: You're starting to believe in the magic of Neverland. You'll get all the above AND a signed and exclusive Rufio (Dante Basco) photograph. NOTE, this will be a DIGITAL COPY.

support.title: Bangarang Rufio
support.descp: All the above and a SIGNED physical copy of a photo of Dante Basco as Rufio PLUS all digital assets from storyboards, to concept art, and the MP3 of the score!

support.title: In Your Face, Camel Cake!
support.descp:
All the above and Dante will create you a custom voicemail message as either Leader or the Lost Boys, or Prince Zuko!
You'll also get access to early cuts of the film!

support.title: You Are The Pan
support.descp: Everything up top, as well as an ASSOCIATE PRODUCER credit, which grants you an exclusive set visit. Welcome back Pan the Man.

support.title: You Can Fly! You Can Fight! You Can...
support.descp: You are a PRODUCER, and have all the awards above. As well as a VIP meet and greet and hang out with the full cast of the project at the Los Angeles after party screening. You'll also receive your OWN title card for your credit.

support.title: Lookie Lookie I Got Hookie
support.descp: All the above rewards and EXECUTIVE PRODUCER credit. This earns you a seat in video village during your set visit. Hang with the cast, the crew, and hell, you can even call action...once...

support.title: Sketch of Clean Labor Choreography
support.descp: We'll email you a hand drawn, original score of Clean Labor, showing you how Brendan imagined and envisioned the performance.

support.title: Clean Labor Video
support.descp: Receive a downloadable video documenting the performance and rehearsal of Clean Labor.

support.title: Clean Labor Door Sign
support.descp: Uniquely designed "Do Not Disturb" door sign created just for Clean Labor! Let your roommates and loved ones know when you're in or out.

support.title: Artist Designed Iron On Patch
support.descp: Created just for this Kickstarter Campaign and inspired by Brendan's much lauded From Hiz Hands project, a reimagining of the African mask presented at the Seattle Art Museum, these artist designed iron on patches are a great way to wear your support for Clean Labor.

support.title: Artist Designed Pin
support.descp: Inspired by Brendan's much lauded From Hiz Hands, reimagining of the African mask presented at the Seattle Art Museum, these custom made pins are a great way to wear your support for Clean Labor.

support.title: Tote It!
support.descp: Custom tote bag designed by the artist

support.title: Clean Labor at the Wythe's Ides Bar
support.descp: Join us for Clean Labor at the Wythe Hotel Ides Rooftop Bar. This 1 hour performance with 6 dancers will be followed by an artist talk with Brendan.

support.title: All Three From Hiz Hands Pins
support.descp: Inspired by Brendan's much lauded From Hiz Hands, reimagining of the African mask presented at the Seattle Art Museum, these custom made pins are a great way to wear your support for Clean Labor.

support.title: Still Move Monograph
support.descp: Published by Black Dog, Still Move is the first monograph to focus on Fernandes’ use of language and dance as a means to explore power, endurance and resistance. Receive this beautiful 160 page monograph signed by Brendan as our gift!

support.title: Wythe Hotel Performance of Clean Labor
support.descp: Join us for the Performance of Clean Labor in the Wythe Hotel rooms. This special performance has a very limited audience capacity. Guarantee your RSVP with this backer level!

support.title: Limited Edition Clean Labor Poster
support.descp: Adorn your wall with a custom designed Clean Labor poster created and signed by Brendan.

support.title: Armory Day Pass
support.descp: Receive as our gift a day pass to the Armory Show as well as an invitation to a toast with Brendan.

support.title: MARKED SPACE Caution Tape
support.descp: Commissioned by Socrates Sculpture Park, MARKED Space customized caution tape, provokes questions about borders, migration, and movement in public space. "Until we fearless," it reads, the syntax suggesting the voice of a non-native English speaker. The phrase alternates with its translation into a font designed for the artist based on Morse code.

support.title: 2 Tickets to Wythe Room Performance
support.descp: You and guest can join us for the Performance of Clean Labor in the Wythe Hotel rooms. This special performance has a very limited audience capacity.

support.title: The Whole Experience
support.descp: Guaranteed spot at the exclusive Wythe Hotel Room Performance of Clean Labor as well as a day pass to the Armory Show where you can enjoy a toast with Brendan.

support.title: Armory VIP Pass + Wythe Room Performance
support.descp: Be a Clean Labor VIP! Receive a VIP Pass to the Armory Show that gets you access to the VIP Lounges, exclusive VIP events, and numerous other concurrent art fairs. You'll also get a guaranteed RSVP to the exclusive Wythe Hotel Room performance of Clean Labor.

support.title: Limited Edition Move in Place Print
support.descp: Move in Place is a series of photographic collages inspired and informed by objects of African art. Images were unfolded, reassembled, and juxtaposed with body parts of ballet dancers, combining these two languages to raise questions about the ideas that shape understandings of African art within Western museums. Show your support by backing our project for this signed limited edition Move in Place Digital 16x20 framed print.

support.title: Move in Place + Wythe Room Performance
support.descp: Receive a limited edition Move in Place Digital 16x20 framed print as well as a guaranteed RSVP for the exclusive Wythe Hotel Room performance of Clean Labor.

support.title: Seven Imitate Limited Edition Print
support.descp: Seven Imitate is a unique siligraph print that plays with the notions of the imitator trickster character in West African masquerade. In this print, Fernandes takes on the role of the imitator, playfully combining images of ballet body parts with images of artefacts from the Justin and Elisabeth Lang Collection of African Art. The recombinations explore the simultaneity of Fernandes' experiences as a classically trained ballet dancer, and as a Kenya immigrant. Show your support by backing our project for this signedlimited edition Seven Imitate Digital 16x20 framed print. At this backer level you’ll also receive a guaranteed RSVP for the exclusive Wythe Hotel Room performance of Clean Labor.

support.title: VIP Pass, Performance, & Print
support.descp: VIP Pass to the Armory which includes exclusive events and previews as well as toast with Brendan at the fair. You'll also be able to attend the very limited capacity performance of Clean Labor in the Wythe Hotel Rooms and a signed limited edition Seven Imitate Digital 16x20 framed print.

support.title: Attend the Armory VIP Dinner
support.descp: At this level, you'll be invited to attend the Armory VIP dinner, reserved for 100 exclusive guests at the BMW Chelsea Showroom sponsored by Sotheby's. Our Kickstarter Campaign is the ONLY place to get a ticket for this event where you will also be able to see a special performance of Clean Labor.

support.title: Private Performance
support.descp: Host a private performance of Clean Labor at your home, office, gallery or event space accompanied by an artist talk with Brendan. Limited to residents of New York and Chicago.

support.title: Stay at the Wythe Hotel
support.descp: Want to really participate in Clean Labor? At this level, you and a guest will be able to stay in either the Baby or Brooklyn Queen Room at the Wythe Hotel and your room will be used in the performance. You'll also be able to see the entire performance, as well as the Ides Rooftop Bar Performance.

support.descp: 1 bumper stickers + 1 flair button

support.title: The #RESIST package
support.descp: You get a hat, bumper sticker and a flair button.

support.title: The "Nasty Woman" package
support.descp: You get a dozen hats, a dozen buttons and a dozen stickers to share with your friends.

support.title: JOIN THE MISSION
support.descp:
Ready to team up and help us make BEYOND THE ELEMENTS? We’ll let the world know! Chip in at this level and receive an official thank you on the NOVA website.
Plus, get more than a year of exclusive BACKER UPDATES, including fun and unexpected dispatches from David Pogue and the NOVA team.
INCLUDES:
Exclusive Backer Updates
Special Thanks on NOVA website (Only real names, please! See FAQ)

support.title: DOWNLOAD THE SPECIAL
support.descp:
You're helping make BEYOND THE ELEMENTS, so we want you to have a copy to keep for yourself. Get your very own DIGITAL DOWNLOAD* of the finished special.
* See the FAQ for more details.
INCLUDES:
BEYOND THE ELEMENTS (digital download)
Exclusive Backer Updates
Special Thanks on NOVA website (Only real names, please! See FAQ)

support.title: WEAR THE SHIRT
support.descp:
Wear your love of science loud and proud with this exclusive premium-quality tee produced for this campaign.
Plus, get everything in the previous packages!
PLEASE NOTE: Shipping costs are NOT included now. You'll pay them separately after the campaign ends: we estimate around $8 - $10 in the USA. Also, rewards will arrive at different times over the next 6-24 months, and delays are always possible.
Please see the FAQ for more details.
INCLUDES:
NOVA Kickstarter T-shirt (exclusive)
BEYOND THE ELEMENTS (digital download)
Exclusive Backer Updates
Special Thanks on NOVA website (Only real names, please! See FAQ)

support.title: HANG THE ART
support.descp:
New York Times best-selling author and illustrator, Rachel Ignotofsky, has created an exclusive 11x17" art print just for this campaign! Celebrate the everyday tools that make science happen. This piece is only available here and will be a one-time, limited run!
Plus, get everything in the previous packages!
PLEASE NOTE: Shipping costs are NOT included now. You'll pay them separately after the campaign ends: we estimate around $8 - $10 in the USA. Also, rewards will arrive at different times over the next 6-24 months, and delays are always possible.
Please see the FAQ for more details.
INCLUDES:
Rachel Ignotofsky Art Print (exclusive)
NOVA Kickstarter T-shirt (exclusive)
BEYOND THE ELEMENTS (digital download)
Exclusive Backer Updates
Special Thanks on NOVA website (Only real names, please! See FAQ)

support.title: CHOOSE A BOOK + GET THE POSTER & DVDS!
support.descp:
We'll send you an autographed copy of either the THE ELEMENTS book or MOLECULES book, both by our friend Theo Gray. These detailed books are gorgeously designed and illustrated to let you see substances up close, at the atomic level, and to appreciate the full wonder of Earth’s elements and molecules!
Plus, get the official CAMPAIGN POSTER (a big one! 27”x39”) featuring the periodic table, and DVD or BLU RAY COPIES of both HUNTING THE ELEMENTS and BEYOND THE ELEMENTS. If you’d rather stick to digital, we’ll let you choose to donate your DVD copies of the specials to a school library!
PLEASE NOTE: If you're choosing between two rewards, you don’t have to tell us now — we'll ask you for your choice after the campaign ends!
Shipping costs are NOT included now. You'll pay them separately after the campaign ends: we estimate around $28 - $30 in the USA for all the stuff in this package. Also, rewards will arrive at different times over the next 6-24 months, and delays are always possible. Please see the FAQ for more details.
INCLUDES:
PICK 1: "The Elements” Book OR "Molecules" Book
Official Campaign Poster
"Beyond the Elements" & “Hunting the Elements” (DVD or Blu Ray)
All $100 LEVEL Rewards

support.title: VIDEO CHAT w/ DAVID POGUE
support.descp:
Need someone to help Dad set up his new iPad? Computer taking forever to start up? If only you could call Yahoo’s chief tech critic…Oh wait: Now you can!
Get a PERSONALIZED TECH SUPPORT VIDEO CALL with David Pogue himself, lasting up to 30 minutes, to ask for tech help, life advice, or anything else you want!* Plus, you'll get everything in the $250 package.
Shipping costs are NOT included now. You'll pay them separately after the campaign ends: we estimate around $28 - $30 in the USA for all the stuff in this package. Also, rewards will arrive at different times over the next 6-24 months, and delays are always possible.
*Please see the FAQ for more details.
INCLUDES:
Live Video Chat w/ David Pogue
All $250 LEVEL Rewards

support.title: PRIVATE LUNCH w/ DAVID POGUE
support.descp:
You and a friend will meet in New York City or San Francisco* for a LUNCH WITH DAVID POGUE at one of his favorite spots. Pick his brain about hosting NOVA, current technology trends, or writing for Yahoo! David’s done it all, and he has incredible stories to share with you. Meet up, chow down, and be entertained.
Plus, you'll get everything in the $100 reward package!
* Your choice of NYC or SF, but travel and accommodations are not included.
PLEASE NOTE: Shipping costs are NOT included now. You'll pay them separately after the campaign ends: we estimate around $8 - $10 in the USA. Also, rewards will arrive at different times over the next 6-24 months, and delays are always possible.
Please see the FAQ for more details.
INCLUDES:
Lunch for 2 w/ David Pogue
All $100 LEVEL Rewards

support.title: FIELD TRIP: SPEND THE DAY AT NOVA HQ
support.descp:
Always wanted to know how NOVA gets made? Are you an avid public television fan? Know an aspiring science documentary filmmaker?
Come to NOVA HQ at WGBH in Boston and spend the day like a producer! You and a guest will be invited to our offices* where you’ll tour WGBH, participate in the screening of a past NOVA program with NOVA producers while they explain the behind-the-scene decisions that led to the final product, visit with a NOVA editor who will show you how a documentary gets assembled, and even drop in on the other national television and radio productions made at WGBH. At the end of the day, Senior Executive Producer Paula Apsell will treat you to a dinner with other key NOVA staff.
*Travel costs to Boston/accommodations not included. See FAQ for more details.
INCLUDES:
A day for 2 at WGBH in Boston, MA
Dinner for 2 with key NOVA staff
All $250 LEVEL Rewards

support.title: FIELD TRIP: PHYSICS DAY AT FERMILAB
support.descp:
Spend the day at the Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory - or Fermilab, home of the famed Tevatron particle accelerator - in what is sure to be the ultimate field trip for any science enthusiast. You, a friend, and a small group of backers will join David Pogue at Fermilab in Batavia, Illinois* for a once-in-a-lifetime look at the workings of a landmark lab dedicated to understanding the smallest building blocks of the universe we live in.
Your day will include an exclusive tour of the laboratory, meetings with physicists in the lab’s control rooms, lunch and dinner with Fermilab scientists and David Pogue, a mini-class on particle physics, dark matter, and dark energy presented by a Fermilab scientist, a Q&A session, and more!
*Travel to Fermilab and accommodations are not included. Please see FAQ for more details and limitations regarding this reward level before purchasing.
This level is generously sponsored by by the Fermilab Friends for Science Education, who arranged the tour exclusively for this campaign.
INCLUDES:
A day for 2 at Fermilab with David Pogue
A comprehensive tour of Fermilab
Lunch and dinner with David and Fermilab scientists
Meetings with top Fermilab physicists
A mini-class on particle physics and dark matter
Merchandise from the Lederman Science Center
Photos of your trip
All $250 LEVEL Rewards

support.title: LIVE ELEMENTS EVENT w/ DAVID POGUE
support.descp:
NOVA always brings science to life, but with this reward, David Pogue will bring NOVA right to your school (or museum) to host a LIVE PROGRAM about the wonders of chemistry and the periodic table!
He’ll do live experiments, tell amazing science stories, and captivate the crowd with his infectious enthusiasm.
PLEASE NOTE: This is a standalone reward. It doesn’t include any other rewards and is not included in other reward packages.
* This pledge covers David's travel and accommodations covered up to $500. Reward only available in United States and Canada. Some locations may require an additional travel fee. See the FAQ for more details.
INCLUDES:
A Live "Elements" Event with David Pogue

support.title: GET THANKED ON AIR!
support.descp:
PBS programs have a long history of thanking their major funders and “Viewers Like You” at the beginning of the program. Now have your name appear there! At this level, you’ll be thanked by name in the opening funder credits of Beyond the Elements when it airs on PBS stations around the country. And you’ll deserve it!
PLEASE NOTE: Broadcast funders cannot be anonymous or have a close connection to the program content (e.g., advocacy or business interests related to program subject matter, production process or the production team). All pledges must be made by private individuals only, be in their legal name and meet applicable PBS funding guidelines. Please see the FAQs for additional information we will need from you after the campaign ends.
INCLUDES:
On-air credit on public TV broadcast of Beyond the Elements
An on-site visit to spend the day at NOVA's offices in Boston, MA
Dinner with Paula Apsell, long-time executive producer of NOVA
5 schools of your choice will receive both NOVA Elements specials
All $250 LEVEL Rewards

support.title: LIVE SCIENCE EXPERIMENT w/ DAVID POGUE
support.descp:
For a truly unique learning experience, David Pogue will link up with you in an online video chat to do a live science experiment with your family or class! We’ll even send you the materials ahead of time. It’s like being a part of your own personal science show! Plus, you'll get everything in the $250 reward package!
Shipping costs are NOT included now. You'll pay them separately after the campaign ends: we estimate around $28 - $30 in the USA for all the stuff in this package. Also, rewards will arrive at different times over the next 6-24 months, and delays are always possible.
Please see the FAQ for more details.
INCLUDES:
Video Chat Science Experiment w/ David Pogue
All $250 LEVEL Rewards

support.title: PETITS RATS
support.descp:
Petits Rats (as dubbed by the Paris Opera Ballet): Fledgling dancers whose artistic contributions ensure a troupe’s future success.
Each donor will receive a signed copy of A BEAUTIFUL TIME FOR DANCERS (May 2017 publication anticipated). The volume will not be available commercially, but will be given to today’s leading artists in the field—dancers and choreographers who command the public eye—and donated to dance archives and university-based dance departments nationwide.

support.descp:
Join us in Boston or India during our next video shoot and help us fight air pollution using one of humanity's most powerful tools–art. In the process, you’ll get a behind the scenes look of how we capture pollution and create AIR-INK (subject to IP terms and approval).
We’ll get one of our artist friends to create a custom canvas for you on the spot.
+
A goodie bag that includes one 2mm marker, one 15mm marker, one 30mm marker, one 50mm marker, 150ml of screen printing ink, and two wooden blocks
+

+
Thank you on the AIR-INK mural!
* Travel and accommodations not included

support.descp:

+
A goodie bag that includes one 2mm marker, one 15mm marker, one 30mm marker, one 50mm marker, 150ml of screen printing ink, and two 2 wooden blocks
+
Two t-shirts printed with AIR-INK
+
Thank you on the AIR-INK mural!
You will also join our list of close friends for any future environmental science related pilots.
* Travel and accommodations not included.
* This reward is not to be used for any commercial purpose including media campaigns.

support.title: Watercolor Rose (or any other flower)
support.descp: I will create a beautiful and unique 5 in x 7 in watercolor painting of any flower of your choosing in any color you would like and ship it to you.

support.title: Member - Governors Island Minigolf Club
support.descp: You will become a member of the Governors Island Miniature Golf Club for the summer 2017 season and will receive a handsome membership card. The card will have the club logo on one side and the club rules on the other. Rule 1) Play miniature golf on Governors Island this summer. Rule 2) Have fun observing rule 1. You will receive periodic email updates as the hole designs are selected, constructed and installed.

support.title: Lighthouse member
support.descp: You will receive all member benefits as well as an oval shaped bumper sticker bearing the club logo. In addition, your name will be displayed on the clubhouse wall as a Lighthouse member.

support.title: Windmill member
support.descp: You will receive all of the benefits of Lighthouse membership as well as recognition on the clubhouse wall as a Windmill member. In addition, you will receive a booklet featuring behind the scenes construction shots and photos of the Artist-Designed Minigolf Course in action.

support.title: Loop-de-loop member
support.descp: You will receive all of the rewards of windmill membership plus recognition on the clubhouse wall as a Loop-de-loop member. In addition, you will receive a golf ball bearing the club logo. Test it out on the Artist-Designed minigolf course this summer - it should bring you good luck!

support.title: Inside-the-ropes member
support.descp:
You will receive all of the benefits of Loop-de-loop membership as well as recognition on the clubhouse wall as an inside-the-ropes member. Your membership also includes an invitation to the inside-the-ropes get-together on the afternoon of Saturday, June 24 to thank you for your support. You will receive a club logo golf ball and poker chip ball marker when you arrive. You will meet the artists who designed and built the course as you play it. They will share the inspiration behind their design as well as tips for how to play their hole.
The first 9 to sign-up as inside–the-ropes members will have their name included on a hole flag as a sponsor.

support.title: Magic Golf Ball member
support.descp: You will receive all of the rewards of the inside-the-ropes membership as well as recognition on the clubhouse wall as a magic golf ball member. And your membership comes with MAGIC: a bag of 5 golf balls designed to answer your most pressing questions. Maybe the answer will be that signs point to yes or maybe it will be somewhat hazy. But that you will support Artist-Designed Miniature Golf is decidedly so.

support.title: Minigolf Masters
support.descp:
Care to test your minigolf skills against your fellow New Yorkers? You and 3 friends will be invited to participate in the Minigolf Masters to be held on the afternoon of Saturday, July 15. Trophies will be awarded for low individual score, low team score and for the most holes in one. The curators may also be inspired to offer style-based awards: most creatively attired, best exhibiting the spirit of minigolf, or whatever else strikes us.
Minigolf Masters entry comes with a membership card, bumper sticker and club logo ball for each participant. Winners will be recognized on the clubhouse wall, just like at the big time golf events.

support.title: Club Champion
support.descp:
Want to host an event that your friends and family will never forget? Four supporters will be designated club champions and will have use of the course to host their own event. It’s great for kids’ parties or for groups of friends. The Artist-Designed Minigolf Course will be yours for two hours for your special event. On weekdays you can reserve any two-hour time slot in which Governors Island is open. On weekends the 10:30 to 12:30 slot will be available.
Club logo balls, bumper stickers, score cards and FUN will be provided.

support.title: Golf Course Architect
support.descp: A highly experienced minigolf hole builder will construct a hole based on a theme you suggest. Perhaps your hole will be inspired by the A train? Or maybe by a trip to Rock-Rock-Rockaway Beach? You decide, and the flag for this hole will bear your name as its sponsor and source of inspiration. There’s only one Golf Course Architect – do you have the Wright stuff?

support.title: Chairman of the Board
support.descp:
As Chairman of the Board of the Governors Island Miniature Golf Club you can host a party on the course and participate in the inside-the-ropes and Minigolf Masters events. You will be recognized as a special friend of the Artist-Designed Minigolf Course with your own sign on the clubhouse wall.
It will take a dynamic and public spirited individual or non-profit organization to step up and be Chair.

campaign.story:
We all know Marie Curie.
Born Maria Skłodowska, she was a Polish/French scientist who did pioneering research on radioactivity. The first woman to win a Nobel Prize, the first person ever to win it twice, and the only person to win it in two different sciences.
She was a badass, no doubt.
But there are many other women scientists, mathematicians, and engineers who have made incredible advances in their respective fields, and never earned the recognition they deserve. I want to change that.
Beyond Curie is a celebration of badass women in STEM, including all 16 female winners of the Nobel Prize in Physics, Chemistry, and Medicine / Physiology, as well as another 16 lady bosses who have accomplished extraordinary things in these fields.
In this project, I will create a print for each one of the 32 women, connecting their faces with the work they've achieved into a unique collage. Every dollar this Kickstarter raises beyond my production costs will go toward the Association for Women in Science.
NEW! MARCH FOR SCIENCE POSTERS
Get the hi-res digital download in time for the March!
A SNEAK PEEK OF THE PRINTS
Lise Meitner collage. Her work laid the foundation for the creation of the Atomic bomb. She should have gotten the Nobel Prize along with Otto Hahn.
  Katherine Johnson. One of the women who inspired the movie "Hidden Figures". Among her other significant contributions, she calculated the trajectories for John Glenn's orbit and the Apollo 11 flight to the moon.
  Margaret Ann Bulkley Collage. She was a woman ahead of her time, who pretended to be a man to pursue her passion for medicine. As James Barry she became a renowned military surgeon, and rose to become inspector general of hospitals.
  Grace Hopper, Admiral of the Cybersea, invented the compiler and known for popularizing the term "computer bug" among her many contributions to the field of computer science
  Chen-Shiung Wu Collage. Also known as "The First Lady of Physics", her research contributions include work on the Manhattan Project and the Wu experiment, which contradicted the hypothetical law of conservation of parity.
  sneak peek of some of the rewards
  WHY DOES THIS MATTER?
Our society was built on a foundation of scientific discovery. We should know the names of the women who have made these extraordinary contributions to move our societies forward. From discovering literally 70% of the universe (dark matter) to having to pretend to be a man in order to practice medicine, these ladies show us that there's nothing that can be discovered by a man that can't be done by a woman. 
As the project progresses, beyondcurie.com will be updated with new collages and scientist profiles. Check out the ones that are up now.
HOW IT ALL STARTED
Last year I started an illustration project called Creative Habit. I'd spend up to an hour every day to make a design and release it to Instagram. Check out the stories behind them at creativehab.it and a blog post I wrote about the project. I enjoyed it so much and got such a positive response I wanted to do something similar but with a cause.
Printed Creative Habits
  ABOUT AMANDA
My two loves are design and science.
Before I became a designer, I studied Neuroscience at Columbia and worked in an Alzheimer's research lab. My last Kickstarter was for an initiative called The Leading Strand that brings scientists and designers together to co-create experiences that translate research. We reached our goal and put on an exhibit that was covered in Fast Company, The Verge, Smithsonian Magazine.
This time, I wanted to find a way to support women in science while incorporating design. Enter Beyond Curie.
WOMEN IN STEM
Since about 2012, half of all science, math, and engineering undergraduate degrees have been awarded to women. But only 17 women have won Nobel Prizes in scientific fields, and that's because for a very long time, there has been a tremendous bias against having women in these fields. They were barred from entry to institutions and from holding prestigious posts simply because they were women. And as a result, they've disappeared into anonymity.
This is the perfect way to support friends and family who work in STEM fields. Progress has been made but sexism still persists — one in three women in STEM say they've experienced sexual harassment.
And yet, there is a rich history of women kicking ass in STEM fields that we can't ignore. And that's what this project is all about.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There's very little risk involved. I've spent a year creating illustrations and collages similar to the ones I will be making for Beyond Curie. And I've pre-sourced the materials and vendors required to create the rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for helping Beyond Curie support AWIS!
updates.update_content:
Hi backers,
I wanted to send a note of thanks for enabling Beyond Curie to donate $7500 to the Association for Women in Science. With your help, their work to support the advancement of women in science through data driven and research-based initiatives can continue to create sustainable and equitable change. 
Below are some of the legendary AWIS members who were included in the Beyond Curie series:

updates.update_userinfo: Beyond Curie cards on their way!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
Again, thank you so much for your patience. I wanted to share a snap of the thick luxe cards as they go out this week. Last but not least I'll be shipping out notebooks this weekend.

updates.update_userinfo: Rewards update and Beyond Curie in the wild
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Thank you again so much for supporting Beyond Curie and for your patience as we package and mail out rewards. By now, most, if not all, of the posters and pillows have been shipped, and we are now tackling the decals, notebooks and cards. The decals are shipping this week into next week, and next are the notebooks and cards.

Hi friends,
Thanks for your patience and understanding. After the site went down today and a couple other hiccups over the past few days. I'm excited to say that all the posters are up for viewing on beyondcurie.com. We'll be adding their stories over the next few days.

When I was 7y.o. my grandmother, who was doing research and testing of the affects of high speed air against missiles skins in WWII, gave me a book on famous scientists. It had only two women in the book and they were Madam Curie and Maria Gaetana Agnesi (the Witch), one of my favorite mathematicians. I have since met many wonderfully gifted women in all fields of science and have noted that they tend to get lost in time and receive little recognition for their accomplishments. campaign.story:
Desperate times call for dastardly magazines.
And so, ladies and gentleworms, we are very proud to introduce Paul Ryan magazine, an all-star, single issue, Kickstarter-only, large format (7"x10"), full-color, 160+ page behemoth of a satire magazine.
We asked ourselves: What if there was just one magazine in this great nation—specifically, Paul Ryan magazine?
With Washington in the thrall of a cabal of idiots and crooks, Paul Ryan is a chance for us to launch an armada of judgments, jabs, and jokes in the one vehicle politicians fear most: a parody magazine.
And it's not just a parody magazine about Paul Ryan, it's also a parody magazine about magazines. We're satirizing every glossy you find in your mailbox, at your doctor's office, at CVS: Muscle mags. Fashion. Tabloids. Zines. Sports. In-flight magazines and alumni magazines and High Times, Vanity Fair, Boys' Life, TV Guide, Architectural Digest. The New Yorker.
And speaking of The New Yorker.
This isn't our first rodeo. It's our second rodeo. Our first was The Neu Jorker, a cover-to-cover parody of New York's most stimulating, mid-to-high-brow magazine.
WIRED said it was "a parody so perfect it's scary." The Onion's AV Club said we deserve a Pulitzer. The New York Times said "it’s refreshing to find comedy that delights in language not only as a means but as an end in itself." We also got love from Adweek, Splitsider, Time Out New York and more.
But we've got bigger fish to fry than those elbow-patched dandies. 
And who better than the once and future dark-princeling of the GOP, the 47-year-old, Ayn Rand-worshipping, barbell-pumping, mean, lean, rights-limiting fiend Paul Ryan?
We called on the most talented writers, designers and illustrators we know to help us satirize as many aspects of the Speaker as we can think up. So far, our staff's credentials include The New Yorker, The Onion, McSweeney's, Saturday Night Live, ClickHole, Letterman, Colbert, MTV, VICE, MAD Magazine, The Paris Review, a National Book Foundation 5 Under 35, Reductress, GQ, Esquire and more.
And here's where you come in.
The Neu Jorker was digital-only, but this bad puppy's gonna kill some wood if it's the last god-spurned thing we do. By helping us reach our goal of $10,000 you enable us to:
produce an initial run of 1,000 copies, and work with a very (very) fine printer
executive a single issue editorial vision much weirder and more ambituous than even that of The Neu Jorker
fairly compensate those creative souls who spend their time on Paul Ryan
throw a banger of a launch party—and if you want to be the belle of the ball, you ought to check out the reward categories
We keep on saying "we." Who's "we"?
Great question, voice of the reader!

Andrew Lipstein is a Brooklyn-based writer. He co-founded The Neu Jorker, created 0s&1s Reads (a digital bookstore and literary website), and works at Meural, an art tech startup.
James Folta is a Brooklyn-based writer and comedian. He performs at the UCB Theatre and his writing has appeared in The New Yorker, The Onion, McSweeney’s, Funny or Die and more.
We met doing improv years ago, and haven't looked back. And why would we? Those were dark, dark times. And we're not actually Republicans. The times weren't that dark.
Can we see that pic of Paul one more time?
Don't see why not. (Illustration by the very talented Kevin Alvir.)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Paul Ryan takes stern legal action AND this alone doesn't get us enough press to afford a lawyer AND the ACLU is not available.

We, as a country, run out of both glue and staples.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
