campaign.story:
Help support the creation of a limited edition book chronicling a journey throughout the USA that follows the lines contained in the palms of two brother's hands.
When my brother Mark was 6 or 7 years-old he wiped out while rollerblading down a hill in the neighborhood where we grew up. The impact and the abrasion of his hands upon the asphalt lodged a stone in his palm, where it remains. This little stone, an element of the outside world, a relic of place and time and action, that assimilated itself into Mark's hand has been the locus of a project that might well span our lifetimes, and continue to reveal our country. This project is called A Country Divine. 
Locus. Ink on paper. 8 x 11 inches. 2013.
Since 2013, Mark and I have journeyed more than 11,000 miles throughout the United States according to a map generated from within the intimate, human-scale space of our hands: the lines contained within the palm of my right hand were connected with those contained within my Mark's right and transposed upon the veinous infrastructure of interstates, turnpikes, and streets that have come to both dictate and liberate our access to the United States. Particularly in light of the current intensity of political and social discourse concerning the United States, Mark and I now find ourselves at a place where we feel good about sharing some of the work from this project via what we are calling A Country Divine (Dispatch 1), a limited-edition book featuring photographs, writing, and drawings that explores ideas concerning map-making, home, randomness and fate, de-mediated experience in a world increasingly mediated by technology, and the complicated layers of the American landscape and society.  
Powhattan, West Virginia 2013
After two journeys, spanning 2 years--the first from Cranberry Twp., PA to outside Denver, CO (curtailed by severe strep throat) and the second from Cranberry Twp. to Lost Hills outside of Bakersfield, CA (where Marlon Brando last pit-stopped his Porsche before crashing six miles down the road), we are prepared to publish the first of what will be several limited edition books that begin to chart this vast space of process riddled with discovery, confrontation, and speculation.  Only 100 editions, via Edition One Books, of this first dispatch will be created.  We are elated by this first opportunity to share these ideas and realities with the world! Thank you for your support! 
Chester, South Carolina 2014
  North Carolina 2013
 Digital maquette of 3 pages from the book, A Country Divine (Dispatch 1)

updates.update_content:
Happiest New Year, dear friends and supporters ~
We just want to let you know that all books, if you pledged in return for a book, have finalllllly been completed and should be within your hands next week :) if you have not yet received yours, we sincerely apologize. Handwriting each one, and including original art, turned out to be a slightly bigger task than anticipated. We appreciate your patience.
We hope you enjoy, and are so grateful for your support to bring the 1st dispatch to life.

Dearest supporters ~ "A Country Divine" has arrived! As we noted before, these are turning out to be like small artworks, versus sheerly publications, so they require a bit more work upon arrival--each is filled with all hand written text and original art. They are looking more beautiful than we could have imagined and we can't wait to send you yours! We will send them as each copy is completed. For now, please note the survey we have sent out regarding your shipping information. Until soon ~
Matty and Mark

Dearest Supporters ~
Our publisher in Oakland has shipped the 100 edition first dispatch of "A Country Divine!"  It should arrive to us in Brooklyn next week.  We are making this edition a little more involved than we originally conceived.  Each book will contain unique drawings/objects! You should have this unique edition in your hands by the end of the month!
Thank you so ~

Dearest supporters, At the end of last week, we received a proof of the publication. It was so wonderful to hold the book physically! Marky and I have conferred and shared notes regarding minor changes, such as a slight color tweak to the cover. We have sent our notes to the publisher and are simply waiting to hear back before proceeding with the final printing. You will certainly have your edition by the end of the month!
Sincerely, Matty and Mark

Dear all ~
We just wanted to notify you that the books have shipped for print!  We should receive a draft of the book this week.  We will let you know once we have received the books and have prepared them, along with remaining rewards, for shipment to you.  
Thank you so for your support and continued patience!

Dearest friends and supporters ~
Marky and I have been chugging along, working with Bobbie Richardson to design the textual layout, and we nailed down the cover.  We will have the book done by the end of June. Tomorrow I head to Vietnam for 2 weeks for a friend's wedding, hence some further delay . . . We can't wait to share the work in all its forms with you ~
Thank you for your support and patience ~

Dear supporters, all original artwork will be sent and deliver to you by the end of May! We started silk-screening today. Thank you, again, as always, for your support, and for your patience :)
Warmth, Matty and Mark

Dear Supporters,
We are unfortunately delayed with printing the publication due to Matty's healing.  We plan to have the publication completed by the end of May.  Thank you so much for your patience!
Warmth,
Matty and Mark

Are underway! We are also in the final editing stages of the publication :) Thank you fit your support!
Matty and Mark

Dear Supporters,
We just wanted to offer an update since some time has passed.  Matty had a horrific accident at the very end of January that severely injured several fingers on his right hand, the hand, ironically enough, that is 1/2 the center of this project.  He had to go into immediate surgery involving a small amputation, two bone fusions, and a slight bone graft.
This has set us back a bit, with the intensity and disorientation of his recovery.  We nevertheless have your rewards in progress, and publication still slotted for April!

campaign.story:
About the project:
Inspired by Kickstarter's Make 100 project I am going to make 100 landscape photographs in 2017.  

The main reward on offer for this project is a limited edition of one of the 100 prints. Each print will be unique, just a single print will ever be made of each of these photographs. 
For your chance to own a limited edition unique print you can purchase one for only $50. These prints will be professionally printed on archival fine art paper.
Who I am:
I am a photographer based in Adelaide, South Australia. With years of experience shooting everything from the largest music festivals to weddings; my true passion is landscapes. Capturing the raw beauty of nature and showing the fantastic vistas we have on planet earth are what drives my interest in photography.  

For any people interested in equipment I would like to give a shoutout to the fantastic gear and manufacturers listed below:  
Fujifilm X Series cameras and lenses  
3 Legged Thing tripods  
Lee Seven5 Filters  
Peak Design capture camera clip
Existing Work:
Here are some of my landscape photography. Please feel free to navigate to philbrown.com.au to see a large variety of the work I have produced over the last decade.
  Mornington Peninsula, Victoria
  Glenelg, South Australia
  Fleurieu Peninsula, South Australia
  Barossa Valley, South Australia
  Barossa Valley, South Australia
The Rewards:
All shipped rewards come with FREE SHIPPING inside Australia. Shipping is a flat rate of $20 to anywhere else in the world.
$10 - Digital Access
For this tier level, you will get a password to a secure gallery which will be updated through the year as images are taken and subscription to the mailing list for updates. This will allow you to follow the project and see all 100 images as they are taken and uploaded.  
The digital gallery will only contain low resolution photos that cannot be downloaded and printed.  
$50 - Make 100: Print
This is the main reward. Each person who backs at this level will receive a completely unique photograph captured in 2017. Each image in this series will be printed once and once only. These pictures will never be offered for sale again. The print you receive will be a randomly selected image of the Make 100 series.  
The specification of the print is that it will be 12" on the long side, some will be panoramic so vertical height will vary. The print will be professionally done on fine art archival paper.  
Options for different sizing will be offered when printing is organised, pricing for increased size will be announced when it is organised.  
This tier includes full digital access throughout the year.  
If you would like a print and the coffee table book please select this tier and set your pledge amount to $200 to receive both items. 
$150 - Coffee Table Book
After the conclusion of the Make 100 series a book comprising of all the pictures and a few stories behind will be compiled. Backing at this tier will get a copy of this book sent out to you after the completion of the project.
This reward tier will include digital access throughout the year.
Please note if you would like a print and a Coffee Table Book please back for $50 - Make 100: Print and set the pledge amount to $200 to include a coffee table book as well. The prints are limited and once they are sold out no more will be offered.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Shooting 100 unique landscapes within a calendar year requires an average of two a week. This is an ambitious goal as it will require regular shooting. However, this is a manageable level that should be accomplished without major issues.

Printing and delivering before the end of 2017. Printing will all be performed locally in Adelaide with a professional print lab so I will be able to get all rewards out during 2017.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Remember in school how important Valentine’s Day was? 
Would that person you were crushing on notice you? 
Would they give a card that secretly meant they liked you too? Or would they give you a card that didn’t even have your name on it? Yuck.
Show someone how special they are by making something unique to them.
A few year’s ago I wanted to tie my work in generative art to that feeling. Everyone wants to feel special, and Valentine’s Day is as good a day as any to show you care about someone. So that year I decided I would make every one of my friends a custom Valentine’s Day card.
A card from 2012
  Variations among the cards
I’m not a traditional artist. I suck at drawing and I’m honestly a little lazy. But I know how to write code. So that year I made cards utilizing data from each recipient. If they were a couple they got two hearts, if they were close to me (using zip code), etc. I made about 100 cards—each completely unique. My local digital printer hooked me up with his new HP Indigo and off they went.
After a few years (and a few breakups, tbh) I wanted to get back to sharing the love. A few months before that February I’d started getting into pen plotters, old drawing machines from the 80s. What I love about pen plotters is they bring some of the aspects of traditional art (little imperfections, the randomness of a dried out pen, etc) to my less traditional practice. So I made 2016’s cards on my pen plotter. 
One of last year’s cards
  variations among last year’s cards
That year I included a survey for people to fill out. Sometimes I’d use the person’s name to generate something. But the main thing in the survey was a question: How do you feel when someone mentions Valentines Day? Depending on your answer you got one algorithm or another, the drawing printed on one color stock or another. It was a lot of fun.
Last year I made 175 cards! One hundred and seventy-five. I did most of them in one sleep deprived week. 
And I want to do it again—and maybe top 175.
We could use a little more love in 2017.
2016 was a rough year and I think everyone is ready to feel a little more loved. So this year I’m expanding my card making practice. Would you like one? Great, I’d love to make you one.
This year will follow much of lat year’s model, but will have a couple upgrades.
First, I’m updating the algorithm. It’s still WIP but here’s a preview.
NOT FINAL ART!
Next I’ve got a new machine to use. I bought a Silhouette Cameo last year and have started to introduce various cutting and scoring abilities into my work. I have some fun ideas about how to add it into the Valentine’s work.
How I’ve used the Cameo in past projects
And lastly...I’m making some sculptural versions of the cards. I’ve started working on scripts to generate 3d shapes from the cards. It’s gonna be really cool. My inspiration for this was the amazing Irving Harper, who made beautiful paper sculptures for himself and family members.
Irving Harper’s paper sculptures will influence this year’s 3D cards
  prototype pyramid
I’m really looking forward to mailing you some love.
Backers can buy a single card for themselves, or buy a group package to send a bunch of cards to friends, family, and loved ones. Not sure what to get that special person in your life? Maybe dinner, a movie, and a custom Valentine.
Since they’re quite labor intensive, I can make a very limited set of 3D sculptures for some very special backers.
If you’re not really into physical goods, I have a couple rewards for digital backers. And if you really want to back a digital project, you can sponsor me to build a webpage so that anyone on the internet can create a card and download it themselves.
New Rewards as of January 5: Valentine + Art
I’m so happy that this project is getting some love, but its gonna be tricky for me to produce more Valentines than already allotted for—the powers that be won’t move Valentine’s Day for me. So here’s what I’m going to do: As of today you can now order a Valentine and get a piece of art from me (you can choose from something I already have produced, or we can discuss a custom commission). 
You have two options for art types: a drawing or a collage.
Here are a few drawing types I’ve done in the past year
Ghost Series
  AcidBlotBot series (also can do color)
  Letterforms
 And here are some collages
Circle Packed collage
  Collagen

updates.update_userinfo: 2018’s Valentine’s Day Project is now live!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
A few have asked, and yes, I’m doing the Valentine’s Day project again this year.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/derrick-schultz/make-100-personalized-valentines-day-cards-made-by
This year’s project is all about the message—you can create a custom message to send to a friend and have it set in one of many text layout algorithms.

I hope everyone had a great Valentines Day. Couple updates on my end.
First, I was so amazed by the overwhelming response to this project that I decided to give a little back. I took the final $175 of backed funds and donated it to Black Girls Code. I think learning to code is an increasingly important skill—and not just to learn to become an engineer, but to use it as another basic skill like math or writing in whatever you choose to do. So thank you all for being a small part in allowing me to donate to this great organization.

Since it’s probably Valentine’s Day somewhere (hi Aussie friends), I can share the #bbvday2017 website. You can generate digital cards for your friends using the same algorithm I used to draw your cards with it.
http://bbvday2017.com
And thanks to Bre Pettis who backed the I Love the Internet reward so that I could build this and share it with you all.

I put this project up on Kickstarter on a bit of a whim. I’d seen the make 100 announcement and decided to give it a go. Really, I assumed I might just send my girlfriend $100 to close the campaign out and avoid total embarrassment. I never expected this much support. So thank you from the bottom of my no very busy heart.
More updates to come soon, but just a quick reminder. I’m going to start to put international cards in the mail as soon as tomorrow, so please make sure your info is in and your payment clears ASAP. (If you haven’t gotten a message from me yet, expect a survey or message from me very soon.)

Hi! 
We’re only 3 days out from the completion of this campaign and I’ve been busy prepping for the rush that will be the 14 days after it closes.

Hey all!
Making really good progress on cards. Thank you to the many people who have already sent in your names and addresses. This update will be super quick and it’s mostly promo—feel free to skip!
Handmade Valentine Exchange

campaign.story:
THE FINISHED PRODUCT
Pictured above is a sample of what you will receive as a backer. The 5" x 7" paintings are matted on a white, beveled matboard measuring 8" x 10", and protected by a plastic sleeve. The white matboard is numbered (1/1), titled, and signed by me. I will send a survey to backers to pick a predominant color of their choice.
THE PROCESS
Alcohol inks have a mind of their own! These highly concentrated dyes blend, swirl, bleed, and bloom on the surface of polypropylene paper. I use isopropyl alcohol and a blending solution to move the ink around the paper in different ways to create interesting, unpredictable colorscapes. To add depth and shine, I often incorporate metallic watercolors. 
THE INSPIRATION
Colorful agates, geodes, and light filtering through foliage | Nebulas, universes, and stormy skies | Auras, chakras, and zodiac signs | Even Rorschach's famous inkblot tests.
"Aquatic"
"Darling"
"Witchy"
"Venus"
"Teardrops"
THE PURPOSE
Painting these abstract studies is a very meditative process. The layers and complexities that exist in a seemingly simple colorfield are what makes these works so special. They are a unique addition to any gallery wall, as a pair, trio, or even as a singular statement piece in a small space.
THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST & SUPPORT!
Please message me with any and all questions. Want more? Follow me on Instagram: @RivaraArtandDesign

Time flies when you're painting and shipping rewards! It's already the end of JUNE and the last of the rewards are shipping out. If you have not received your painting (or don't receive it in the next week or so), please message me and I will get you a tracking number.

updates.update_userinfo: Sneak Peek: June Delivery Reward Tier
updates.update_content:
Thanks to all the backers that pledged to reward tiers with April delivery -- you should all have your paintings now and I'd love your feedback!
Those of you that pledged to reward tiers with June delivery -- get ready! You should be seeing your paintings arrive in the next few weeks. 
In the meantime -- here's a sneak peek of some of my favorites from this week:

Your surveys are rolling in and there has been a lot of interest in the "Experimental Option"! I wanted to post an update showing examples of what I'm working on. The layers of paint, collage, and penwork add depth to the organic alcohol ink auras and I'm loving it. Tell me what you think!

Thank you to all my backers who made this project a crazy success -- over 1,000% funded, woo-hoo! Production is in full swing, and I look forward to receiving your surveys.
For those of you viewing this project for the first time -- know that I aim to deliver ahead of schedule for both April and June delivery reward tiers, and you will receive a survey to specify a color preference. $25 for a one-of-a-kind work of art, hand signed and titled -- you won't be disappointed!

Only 10 DAYS LEFT to snag an original alcohol ink painting, hand-signed and thoughtfully titled by Gina Rivara of Rivara Art & Design. 
Once this project meets it's deadline, you will be receiving a survey asking for your preference of predominant color. Please note -- most paintings have 1-3 colors incorporated. The survey will also have a "surprise me" option because who doesn't like surprises!?

Due to the incredible support from you all (and the first Make 100 paintings being snatched up in just a few days), I have added additional reward tiers to my project. As a thank you to my first 100 backers, I will be sending a little surprise with your alcohol ink painting.
I'm blown away by all the support! We've hit a new milestone -- 100 BACKERS! Thank you ALL and keep asking questions, sharing and commenting!

...IN ONE DAY!
Thank you all from the bottom of my heart for making this Kickstarter project a wild success. Time to clear off my desk and get STARTED! 
Over the next few weeks, keep your eye out for a survey asking for your color preferences and shipping address.

Thank you for getting this Kickstarter started! Your early support is much appreciated.
Keeping the momentum going -- this project has already been selected as one of Kickstarter's "Projects We Love"! 
Questions? Feel free to message me!

campaign.story:
Only 24 hours left to help us reach our goal! Check out a special end of year message from our Artistic Director Dan Nuxoll and make a donation to Rooftop Films before time runs out:
As we enter into a new year and a period of great change in our city, country and world, Rooftop Films’ programs are more important than ever, and we’ve never been more passionate about, inspired by, and committed to our mission and work. 
Now more than ever we believe it is our job to help our community:
To RESIST the urge to curl up in apathy
To remind you to REMEMBER the things that matter to you
To EMBRACE your desire to see, feel, and experience new things, places, and ideas
To PROTECT the institutions and values that you think are vital to your city and your country
As a nonprofit organization your support is vital to our unique work--no other organization does what Rooftop Films does. Make a donation or become a member today, and support Rooftop Films as we continue to create unforgettable events. 
By bringing the best new independent films directly to diverse communities in every borough of New York City, Rooftop creates inspiring environments that truly change the way people feel about the spaces they inhabit and move through, and how they interact with and think of their community, their neighbors, the city, and the global issues that affect us all. 
And never have we needed your support more. We can’t do this alone.
We need YOU—our audience members, supporters, friends and neighbors—to help us continue to bring films and experiences rooted in compassion, learning, togetherness, and exploration to tens of thousands of people.
We simply cannot do all of this without you. Together, we can make sure that our programs continue to thrive, expand and grow. 
Help us continue to be an indispensable source for community building, filmmaker funding, and economic development in New York City.
Help us improve the quality of life throughout the city by creatively activating outdoor public spaces as safe places for all residents to gather, share ideas, and co-create a sense of community.
Help us inspire and empower individuals and neighborhoods by bringing public art directly to communities.
Help us teach, lead and give individuals and communities the tools needed to create their own programs and events, helping them to stimulate their local economies and increase innovation, cultural diversity, and civic engagement.
And, of course, Rooftop Films believes in achieving all of these things while still having as much fun as humanly possible. We bring the most talented emerging filmmakers on earth to New York City to create some of the most innovative, exciting and inspiring film events anywhere in the world.
Your support is vital and will help Rooftop Films… 
Sustain our Rooftop Films Summer Series, which brings independent film and live performances to spectacular venues in all five boroughs; with more than a third of the screenings taking place in the highest-need communities including Staten Island, The Bronx, Coney Island, Downtown Brooklyn, Red Hook, and Sunset Park
Free Screenings Across NYC in 2016
Support independent filmmakers' new projects through our Rooftop Filmmakers Fund grant program. In 2016, Rooftop Films will give away over $30,000 in cash grants, as well as equipment and service grants valued at more than $200,000. 
Rooftop Filmmakers Fund Grantees 'Casting JonBenet', 'The Fits', and 'Beasts of the Southern Wild'
Empower others to create their own events through the Rooftop Community Fund, through which we make all our film/video exhibition equipment, as well as our event production expertise, available to the public through low-cost or free rentals. In 2016 we donated and discounted $175,000 worth of equipment and services to artists, non-profits and community groups.
Community Events in Staten Island, Brooklyn, Louisiana, and Pittsburgh
Launch a new Free Public Film Series and Job Training Program in 2017. In this program we will produce free community events aimed at the most vulnerable, culturally underserved, low-income neighborhoods of our city. The program will include a 4-month apprenticeship with highly experienced program and technical staff that will empower youth from each neighborhood with the technical and outreach skills to produce their own own sustainable community events. Your support will lay the groundwork for us to pilot the project in Brooklyn in 2017 with the intention of later implementing it throughout Brooklyn and in all 5 boroughs of NYC.
Demand is increasing for Rooftop Films community events. Though our audiences have never been bigger, we have seen that each year there is less and less funding available to support such events, especially in the communities that would benefit most. 
Rooftop Films is your community organization. We are so grateful for the support and love of our community and the work that we can only accomplish together. 
Rewards!
As a thank you for your generous support we have some amazing rewards for you, including…
Plus, two tickets to the 2017 Summer Series just for signing up!
Blu-rays, DVDs, VHS, Posters, & More!
Plus an invite to our backer party!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a non-profit organization we will always face the challenge of relying on the support from our backers to sustain Rooftop Films. This Kickstarter project is not a means to an end; it is a stepping stone for us to grow and expand. And with that growth comes greater responsibility, challenges, and needs. We are a hard-working team of six year round employees and we work tirelessly to provide a unique experience for all who come to our shows. There is still work to be done and we are glad that you are on this journey with us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Let's create thousands of new moments together
updates.update_content:
As the year ends and we enter our 22nd season we want to thank you.
   
Because of you we are able to travel the city, presenting events on rooftops, in parks, and along waterways--celebrating film, music, and spectacular locales. Because of you we are able to support emerging filmmakers and connect them with new audiences across the city. And because of you, we all get to explore hidden corners of the city together; from the top of the William Vale Hotel, 25 stories above Brooklyn, to the graffiti covered roof of New Design High overlooking the Lower East Side. 
Let's create thousands of new moments together. We've launched a Kickstarter campaign to fund our 2018 season. To continue to bring innovative film events to outdoor locations across NYC. To bring communities together through film.

Dear backers and friends,
Happy New Year! With all of your support we made it to our goal! Woo-hoo!
Though our campaign is over, memberships and gala tickets are still available! If you still are interested in become a member, click here. And if you'd like to buy tickets to our first annual gala, click here.

updates.update_userinfo: A year of Rooftop Films - one day left!
updates.update_content:
Dear friends and backers - 
With just one day left in the year (and 24 hours left in our Kickstarter campaign!) we wanted to share some of the highlights from our past season with you, and thank you for being a part of it. Year after year, our screenings are made possible with your help. So if you haven't already, please make a donation or become a member today, and we’ll see you on the roof next summer!
Uc

updates.update_userinfo: 48 Hours Left: A Special Message from Artistic Director Dan Nuxoll
updates.update_content: Only 48 hours left to help us reach our goal! Check out a special end of year message from our Artistic Director Dan Nuxoll and make a donation to Rooftop Films before time runs out!

If you're looking for a way to support Rooftop Films that offers benefits all year round, look no further! Starting at just $40, you can enjoy incredible savings while being a vital part of keeping the spirit of independent film alive and thriving in NYC!
Support Rooftop with a membership today and we'll give you the gift of film year round. And, for the rest of this week, members that join at $135 and above will receive a print from one of our incredibly talented alumni animators!

We're excited to announce the first Annual Rooftop Films Gala. This isn’t going to be your run-of-the-mill fundraising party: no black tie and no gown required (unless you want to wear one). Just a fun party for the lovers and leaders of the film community to come together and celebrate another year of Rooftop Films.
The evening will also include a performance of animator Brent Green and Oscar-nominated filmmaker Sam Green's critically acclaimed LIVE CINEMA, which combines film, musical accompaniment, and live narration in an immersive and innovative way.

campaign.story:
Full Grown Furniture – the story so far...
We design and grow furniture, lighting and beautiful objects. 
It starts with a unique design for the piece of furniture - then we add the modular frame around which we grow and shape the tree 
Everything is grown as a single piece
We work with each tree, shaping, clipping and nurturing it into shape to encourage it to grow and strengthen in just the right way, at just the right time 
There are no traditional joints – we graft where necessary – and we don’t use glue 
We hand finish every piece in our Derbyshire workshop
Each piece is truly unique and will carry the Full Grown Brand with a Certificate of Provenance
Gavin adjusting a Spiral Square Lumsdale Lamp
Our ultimate aim is to continue developing a seriously viable, scalable and eco-friendly manufacturing system which challenges and adds to the traditional manufacturing process 
We do not strip forests of their trees and their eco-systems
We plant our own trees and by refining and developing the ancient skills and techniques used in coppicing and woodland management, we maintain and nurture our raw materials
The majority of the waste we create is turned into compost and fertiliser - the rest is recycled
We harvest products annually and re-use the root stock the following year to grow another piece
We have around 500 pieces in production with more to follow 
The grass really is greener in the Furniture Factory
Our open-air factory is powered by the sun, rain, and wind. It is also a biologically diverse polyculture, and is carbon neutral.
Our factory floor is a four-acre field, planted with three thousand trees 
It is powered and sustained by the sun, the rain and the wind. It is open to the elements all year round
As we grow, we invest in renewable technology for our energy requirements.
We are carbon-neutral, and we may even off-set carbon - more research is needed but we're concentrating our energy on growing our products
We only use a small amount of fuel to power our cutter, mower, and wood chipper  
A row of Nelson Chairs, thickening after being shaped.
We want to create a ‘Grown Furniture Industry’ which is capable of transforming how we produce beautiful objects, reduces damage to the environment, encourages creation of new eco-systems, and inspires people and organisations to get involved around the world 
We know we can design, grow and produce high quality and functional furniture and accessories that will stand the test of time.
We hope other designers will see the potential too and want to get involved
From high-end, one-off designs to high volume utility items we believe that growing is more sustainable than traditional manufacturing – and ultimately more rewarding
We are constantly learning about wood growth and how and when to make the very necessary and important interventions to ensure the ultimate quality of our products
Who knows how many different types of trees there are in the world which can be planted, coppiced and used to grow beautiful furniture and everyday objects? We look forward to finding out...
One of our prototypes, available as an A1 print.
We want people to relate to our project in the way they might relate to wine makers and whisky distillers. It will take several years for our crops to reach maturity but they will be worth the wait.
Gavin and an early Spiral Hexagon Pendant
The 'Lumsdale' Hexagon Spiral Pendant Lamp - Started in Spring 2012 and grown for 4 years
 We are at the start of a journey to develop the Full Grown brand and, most importantly, to stimulate the growth of a new industry which can meaningfully challenge the traditional, resource-hungry industries which devour the world's natural resources and leave scars on the planet. Will you help us to make our vision a reality?
Full Grown - The Story So Far - Our Coffee Table Book - Available as one of our rewards
Packed full of beautiful photography, this book tells the Full Grown story. A great addition to your coffee table!
Our un-dyed canvas tote bags are 100% ethically sourced, and printed with our Nelson Chair Evolution, as well as the Full Grown Logo
Our t-shirts are 100% ethically sourced, and printed with the Full Grown logo on the chest, and our Nelson Chair Evolution on the reverse
The Nelson Chair Evolution printed on the base of the reverse - Available as one of our rewards
An example of our Square Spiral "Lumsdale" Lamps
The Floating Green Chair - Available as a A2 print
Botanical Illustration of the 1st Edition Nelson Chair
Botanical Illustration of the 1st Edition Lumsdale Spiral Lamps
Botanical Illustration of the 1st Edition Åsa Geometric Lamps
The Scuttler Table Lamp
Our Prototype Willow Armchair - This piece is a Kickstarter exclusive, and only one will be given as a pledge reward

support.title: Grown Willow Chair Model
support.descp:
An early model of our Full Grown Willow Arm Chair, harvested from our Furniture Orchard in Derbyshire. This is an incredibly rare opportunity to own a beautiful piece of design history, usually reserved for museums and galleries. This exclusive piece is a wonderful example of our growing methods. Grown from Willow (Salix Viminalis), beginning in 2012, the sister chair is currently touring the design academies and museums of Spain. Due to the nature of our growing process, this piece has no double; It is completely unique, one of a kind, so don't miss your chance to own such an important part of our story, and the ever changing face of art and design.
Please note, this is a piece of art, not a functioning chair.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU!
updates.update_content:
Our apologies for the delay in communication, but we've been processing what has happened over the past few weeks.
First and foremost, you are absolutely wonderful. Your incredibly generosity to our cause has resulted in a final total of £26,679.00, a sum that will go miles in realising the Full Grown dream!
The pledge process now takes around two weeks to complete, so you should expect your various items just after that, however we will give you a much better update than this when we've finalised things!

updates.update_userinfo: Hours left, and something a little different...
updates.update_content:
Only hours left, so if you know somebody who'd love to be a part of the Full Grown mission, this is their last chance to get involved!
For something a little different, here's something that's caught our eye.
Lund London, another small British start-up, has developed some of the most beautiful storage boxes we've ever seen.

Hello all! 
This is just a quick update, inspired by the fact that we've now surpassed 200 individual pledges! 
This is absolutely amazing! We've already smashed our target, and now we're on for doubling it, and it's all because of you. The amount raised may be nearly £20k, but your support is invaluable. Because of you, we have reached around the globe!

updates.update_userinfo: Wooo! THANK YOU! We made the goal.
updates.update_content:
Apologies for the delay. I was overwhelmed and didn't know what to say.
 It's rather simple though - 
Welcome and thank you every single person for sharing, pledging and being part of the dream.

Well that is possibly the best start to the year we've ever had. We at Full Grown would just like to take the time to say... THANK YOU!! 
We've smashed our target, and with 24 days remaining! 
But remember, every penny counts, even over the posted goal. Every backer from now on will be helping us continue this project just that little bit longer, and that is something we desperately need!

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Holidays, Gratitude and T-Shirt Sizes

We're now 33% of the way there - still £7,000 to go so please do keep sharing and pledging and help us make the making of objects subtle and beautiful!

campaign.story:
Be part of this experience / Se parte de esta exoperiencia 
- - - > English below.
Mi nombre es Miguel Rodríguez Sepúlveda y soy artista visual desde hace más de 20 años, además un gran aficionado de la comida con insectos y desde hace algunos años he estado desarrollando esta receta.
 - - - > My name is Miguel Rodriguez Sepulveda and i´m a visual artist since more than 20 years a go, beside I´m a huge fan of food made with insects and I´ve been working in this recipe for a few years.
ESCRITO SOBRE EL HIELO es una obra comestible, es un llamado poético a nuestros recuerdos e historias personales. Son brochetas de corazón de pollo al grill con un alacrán encima servido en un poco de salsa agriducle color sangre y aromatizado con perfume (loción) para él o para ella, según quién desees recordar.
 - - - > WRITTEN ON ICE is an eatable art work, it is a poetic recall to our memory and personal history. It´s a skewer with a grilled chicken heart with an scorpion on it served on sweet red (like blood) sauce and perfumed with for her and for him fragances (lotions), it depends whom you want to remember.
  Con esta campaña de Kickstarter estoy recabando los fondos para 5 metas:
1- Perfeccionar la receta. Para esto necesito los materiales para experimentar y hacer pruebas. 
2- Hacer un recetario con sus diferentes variables e ilustrado con los ingredientes y las ideas conceptuales de usar estos. (Puedes obtener su versión digital, impresa o la edición limitada coloreadas a mano y firmada en las recompensas). 
3- Una serie de obras (dibujos, fotografías, serigrafías y otros) sobre la receta y las ideas involucradas. Algunas de estas también puedes adquirirlas en las recompensas de esta campaña. 
4- Un recetario en un breve video para que circule en redes sociales. (Tu nombre o logo de tu empresa puede estar incluido aquí, busca esta opción en las recompensas. Si lo deseas incluye factura fiscal). 
5- Si alcanzamos la meta final de MX$200,000 haremos una fiesta de presentación de la receta y proyecto completo en el cual degustaremos las diferentes versiones.
Ve a la sección de recompensas y adquiere todas las que te gusten y se parte de esta experiencia!
- - - > In this Kickstarter campaign I´m raising found for 5 goals: 
1- Improving the récipe. For this I need a bounch of ingredients.
2- Making a recipe whith the diferent versins of it and the conceptual ideas sketches (You can get one of this on PDF, printed or hand colored & signed by me versión. Find them at rewards section).
3- Some art work (drawings, potos, serigraphy and others) about the récipe and the conceptual ideas on it. You can have some of them at the rewards section.

Te invito a formar parte de esta experiencia, hay varias recompensas que estoy seguro serán de mucho interés para ti.

También te invito a seguir este proyecto y mi perfil para que estés al tanto de las actualizaciones. Durante estas semanas iré subiendo más de la historia, avances y nuevas recompensas.
- - - > Also I´m inviting you to follow this project and my profile to be updated whit this history. During the campaign I´ll be updating more about the history, advances and new rewards.
Estoy seguro conoces a alguien que le encanta la cocina o la comida exótica, o alguien con una historia amorosa a la que le será de interés este platillo, o que por otras razones le puede interesar esta historia y experiencia. Hazle llegar esta información, seguro le gustará, o al menos causará alguna emoción :)
- - - > I´m pretty sure you know some body who loves to cook or exotic food, provably some body who loves to eat insects, or some one with a such a love history who is going to be interested in this, or some one else who simple is going to love this experience. Please send and share this info whit this person.
Gracias por ser parte.

Miguel Rodríguez Sepúlveda

campaign.story:
Codex Valtierra is an Illustrated book that recounts the events of the war that the Aztecs had against the Spaniards. According to history, the Aztecs surrendered on August 13, 1521, giving the victory to the Spanish Crown. They destroyed many pyramids, killed thousands of people, and burned all the books they found. Therefore, there are just a handful of Aztec Codex still in existence.
Now imagine a world where the Aztecs had defeated the Spaniards. How would our world be different?
Codex Zouche Nuttall
We will present you our version of the story. The story will start with historical facts and figures, but as the story progresses, you will notice how everything will begin to change and open the gates to a completely version of the facts you know.
Codex Borbonicus
   We invite you to enjoy the first pages of the book.
CHAPTER 1
The elders recall, on behalf of those who were there to witness it and left it stated to be true, that almost 500 years ago the white man came upon these lands from beyond the sea through the coast of what was once the "Totonaca Empire."
They arrived with weapons of fire and covered in shining splendid steel, things never seen or imagined by the people; so terrifying was the sound of cannons that the people thought them to be gifts given to the pale visitors from one of their gods, working their horror with favor from the sun.
Spaniards landing in the new world. Tlatoani speech to soldiers.
Many deaths befell us in those times, as the caxtiltecas took to turning the pueblos against each other to gain their trust, only to betray them and treat them as servants. These were times when the bronze people felt abandoned by their creators, times to stop and reflect and organize some kind of defense against what the elders called, "teules".
Survival messenger sharing the tlatoani's ideals to all the tribes
Many a hero and warrior that faced the threat confirmed what the elders, in their great wisdom, denied to believe: that there would come a time where the teules would use us as slaves, destroy our temples, and burn our books.
Amongst those that braved the fire and metal of the foreigner's weapons, Tzilzcatzin, Temilotzin, Xicotencatl, Cuaupopoca, Erendira Ikikunari, Temoctzin, Cuitlahuac showed the bronze toed people of the various nations their own virtues. The importance of courage, intelligence, and temperance.
First night rebellion against the spaniards. Huitzilopochtli and Tlaloc helping
Elders tell children around fires of the great deeds of our people, when everything seemed lost, when our temples and the spirit of the warriors, old men, priests, and our women fell, that something unexpected happened from the land of the Itzaes when Tenochtitlan fell for the first time at the hands of the caxtiltecas. Amongst the last orders of Cuautemoctzin, an invigorating message roused in the hearts of every mexica. every purepecha warrior, tlaxcalteca, totonaca, hña-hñu, ben-zaa and nations that once considered each other enemies.
Spaniards surrounded in the woods. Kids and women join the battle
Our young lord of 21 years, sent paynani messengers to Tenochtitlan by various routes repeating the following:
"Friends, meditate in the depths of your hearts, and ask yourselves, 'Will we let these foreigners come here to make us their women? To erase from the land the greatness that with love and care our venerable grandfathers left us?
Aztec and European Gods. Cortes's death rumors. The robbery of the armory
Today is not the day we will break to a pale enemy sick with greed for gold; our children will not suffer knowing they are the sons and daughters of cowards. Let the plains boil, let a torrential rain of darts pierce the throats of our enemies, let the spirit of war spread, let our warriors emblazon themselves with their best weapons, their most beautiful feathers. Our lord of war has spoken, this has only been a test to prove our might. The drums of war call to us, and the whistle of death yearns to be heard.
We will eventually find ourselves in the land of the fleshless one way or another. Either one by one or all together. But there, we will finally awake from the dream of war.
Isn’t it not our obligation to preserve the order of the universe?
Looking for truce. The exchanging of plants and animals
Resuscitate mexica pride and let us show them why we are renowned as warriors; the children of the sun have yet to fall.
From this day onward we will unite; the nations that were once servants will join us as equals, and as owners of the land we will expel the foreigners. Tributes will be put to use in the protection of your families and the greatness of our cities
Pacts with other cultures. Studies of iron. Studies of ships
The Mexica do not want to be lords and masters of these lands unless it is at the side of all the nations of Anahuac. Let us be one with the Purepecha warriors, with the Mayan and Zapotec warriors.
Who here in their hearts truly prefers to serve the white men than die at the edge of their swords? Who here wants to hide in the temples, to witness the death of our deities?
Bronze footed people awake and arise to battle!
The book will be printed in Mexico simulating a real codex and the illustrations will be created with a limited amount of colors like in the old times. It will contain between 55 and 65 of written and illustrated pages. The books will be also printed and shipped from Mexico to support the country’s economy.
The printed version of the book will be available on English and Spanish. The digital version, to start will be available in Spanish and English with more languages to come.
The book will be divided in two, front and back. On the front part of the codex you'll see all the illustrations. The story and the description of every image can be found on the back.
We are still discussing the paper material. The options are a semi-gloss white paper or a brownish paper that simulates old and aged paper. This last one could make the codex look better but we are looking for durability too.
DIGITAL CODEX
Get the digital codex and take it with you anywhere on your phone, tablet or laptop! You'll get to choose the Spanish or English version.
THE CODEX
A full size printed version of the codex. ( 30cm x 15cm folded). Enjoy all the Illustrations and the story about the alternate reality of the Aztecs.
Digital sample of the printed book (front)
  Digital sample of the printed book (back)
 HARD COVER CODEX
A full printed version of the codex ( 30cm x 15cm ) with a beautiful hardcover to protect it. Enjoy all the Illustrations and the story about the alternate reality of the Aztecs.
Golden print on the hardcover
        Digital book in a different language $2.00
  15 postcards for $8.00
 More products soon...

updates.update_content:
Hello friends.
My friend Kevin Garcia (Marvel historian) just launched on KS a new comic book... guess who the artist is! YES ME! Please check it out, and if you can, back it. He is a great writer, you won't regret.
Click on the photo or link to learn more

Hello friends! I have big news for you. The book that you supported on this campaign just won the "Sidewise award" for alternative history. It is an honor for me have your names printed on the book. Without you I would have never get this award. I'll post a photo of it in a few days when I receive it on my instagram. In case you don't have me there, it is "emmanuelvaltierraillustrator"
In different news, my second book was just printed. The writer self-published and she gave me 20 of them to sell. They are 18 + 5 for USA shipping. Send me a message if you are interested. If you are from over seas or would like to add another Codex Valtierra you can ask and I'll get you a price. I'll leave some photos.

Hello people!
I have a new book on KS. 
Take a look if you are interested! :)
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/521277495/aztec-stories-in-rhyme

Hey guys!
If you liked my aztec art in the book, I'm here to inform you that I just launched a small reprint of my first playing cards deck, Aztec Glyphs, along with an Egyptian deck. If you feel curious or interested, I'll leave the link in the bottom.

I've been having some questions lately from y'all. Here you have the answers.
1. The book I have on KS at the moment is the same one. What happened is that I had to print 500 books minimum and now I'm stuck with 280 books and trying to get rid of them. So unless you want another copy of the codex, don't mind this new campaign.
2. I got a couple of people asking me that some parts of the story are missing on the book. The book is totally fine. The parts that look faded are there just to make the book look old and they're actually easter eggs to something else. Of course I won't tell you.

Our books have arrived!!!!
My pain hurts from moving everything to the garage but is a enjoyable pain. Tomorrow I'll go to Mexico for a family thing and I'll be back on Friday to start packing your books.
I will start with the books in USA then the ones in Mexico and Canada and finally with the rest of the world.

Good evening, afternoon, or morning! friends from all around the globe.
I'm still waiting for the big order of books. They say that it's gonna take less than a month depending on the schedule of the shipping company, but they have been sent already.
I'll leave you with some amazing photos that I took yesterday from the couple of copies they sent me.

How's everyone?
Finally the production has been completed!!! They are sending the batch tomorrow from China.
They sent me one copy trough FedEx so I could see it faster. I'm not in San Antonio Texas at the moment but my friend took a picture for me and said everything had a great quality. Here's the proof. When I'm back I'll take better pics.

Hello guys!
The people at the printing shop in China are taking longer than what I thought but your books are printing for sure. I've been approving materials, quality of printing, dummies and etc. Because they send everything from China to approve, it takes a bit more than what I expected. 
I hate having you waiting but believe me, I've got the best materials to make the book look great. Even put some money out of my pocket so you could have the best of the best.

campaign.story:
Brooklyn Ballet is launching our biggest production yet, the premiere of The Brooklyn Nutcracker at the world-renowned Brooklyn Museum. The Brooklyn Nutcracker is a updated take on a holiday classic, with multicultural dance forms, motion-sensor costuming, a digital set-design, and over 50 children performing from Brooklyn Ballet Youth Ensemble. Your support helps us provide choreographer and dancer fees, costume, lighting, and set design costs, as well as rehearsal directors, coaches, and Company faculty. We hope you'll join us in making this our most successful show yet!  
What's new this year?
This year brings us to a whole new venue: The Brooklyn Museum, where we are thrilled to perform The Brooklyn Nutcracker from Dec 7-9 & 11. It is our largest production yet, with more dancers, exciting guest artists, new scenes, and over 2,000 seats!
Dancers Paunika Jones & Elisabet Rubio at the Brooklyn Museum, photo by Stephan Moskovic
One of our brand new scenes is Waltz of the Flowers, with innovative costume design by Rebeccah Pailes-Friedman, Professor from Pratt Institute. The fiber-optic luminescent tutus give an added glow to choreography by Claudia Jeschke and Lynn Parkerson. 
photo by Rebeccah Pailes-Friedman
We're SO excited to have extremely talented dancers and guest artists joining us this year, featuring Nakotah LaRance, 6-time World Hoop Dance Champion. LaRance, from the Ohkay Owingeh Pueblo in New Mexico, performs his sensational mix of traditional hoop and hip-hop dance to open the second act. Nakotah’s participation in The Brooklyn Nutcracker is a wonderful reminder that our country, including the site of the Brooklyn Museum, was once all indigenous land. Nakotah's dance performance illuminates Native American culture as vibrant and contemporary, as well as ancient.
Nakotah Larance by Sandoval Photosynth
In addition to LaRance, we welcome back Ingrid Silva and Dylan Santos, courtesy of Dance Theatre of Harlem as Sugar Plum Fairy and Cavalier; Sira Melikian, choreographer/performer in the Arabian dance, Sydnie Mosley, collaborating choreographer of the Marzipans/Marzipettes, and the inimitable Mike “Big Mike” Fields as Drosselmeyer.
And of course we welcome back Brooklyn Ballet students (some returning and some brand new!) who will perform alongside our professional company. Continuing our mission to provide access to classical ballet to all communities, our youth dancers include scholarship students and recruits from Elevate, a program bringing free dance classes to under-resourced public schools. All Brooklyn Ballet's student dancers receive an invaluable performance opportunity dancing alongside world-class dancers.
What do your donations pay for?
Your donations will make this show possible. Ticket sales income only covers a fraction of the cost of production so your help is essential. Pledges cover choreographer and dancer fees, costume and design fees, lighting, and set design, as well as children's rehearsal directors. 
Note: Brooklyn Ballet is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. All contributions are tax deductible to the fullest extent permitted by the law.
Repertory Details & Collaborators
Concept/Choreography: Lynn Parkerson 
Music: Pytor IIyich Tchaikovsky 
Art Director/Set Design: Avram Finkelstein 
Costume Design: Rebeccah Pailes-Friedman, Leila Ligougne, Sylvia Nolan, YMX by Yellowman 
Technologist: Nicholas Vermeer, NYC Resistor 
Lighting Design: Ben Bauer 
Collaborating Choreographers: Thomas Baird, Michael “Big Mike” Fields, Claudia Jeschke, Nakotah LaRance, Sira Melikian, Sydnie Mosley 
Dancers: Katherine Norton Bliss, Courtney Cochran, Yinet Fernandez, Michael "Big Mike" Fields, Tristan Grannum, Paunika Jones, Miku Kawamura, Cortney Key, Nakotah LaRance, Bobby "Anime" Major, Sira Melikian, Sydnie Mosley, Allison Piccone, Kendra Ross, Elisabet Rubio, Yuriko Sakai, Dylan Santos, Christine Sawyer, Max Simoes, Angelique Smith, Keenen "Sylinsah" Thomas, Ladell "Mr. Ocean" Thomas, Candace Thompson, Eliza Tollet, Miranda Bishop (apprentice)
Managing Director: Cassandra Weibel 
Production Manager: Jaclyn Rose Wohl
Rehearsal Director: Richard Glover
Stage Manager: Kai-ti Kao 
Company Class Faculty/Coaches: Pascal Benichou, David Fernandez, Richard Glover, Nina Goldman 
Children's Rehearsal Coordinator: Rebecca Warthen
Video production: Sarah Dahnke / BRIC  
Thank you to our Kickstarter Launch Party Sponsors!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Live performance is always a bit risky - there could be injuries, technical difficulties, missed cues, or botched exits. But that is also what makes live performance so exciting and vibrant. Plus, we've been performing for 14 years so we're confident we can tackle whatever challenges come our way!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi folks! 
Thanks so much to our 60 backers and everyone who donated during the Kickstarter matching grant campaign! We raised $1,615 in seven days, which an anonymous donor doubled today. We're 22% of the way to our goal! We're on our way!
Yesterday we appeared on BRIC TV in our fiber-optic tutus. We had a great time, and we'll be posting an archive of the appearance soon. Check out some pics below!

Thank you so much to our first 42 backers! We're so grateful for the support. And thanks for those of you who tuned in for our Kickstarter LIVE rehearsal on Sunday! (Click this link if you missed it but would like to check out an archive). Dancers are working hard in the studio so they'll be ready to take the stage when we open December 7 at the Brooklyn Museum!
For those of you who have not yet made a pledge - tomorrow is the final day of our match campaign. If you become a backer by tomorrow (Tuesday, 11/29), your donation is doubled by an anonymous donor! It's also #GivingTuesday tomorrow - a global day to celebrate giving - so it's really the perfect day to donate!

campaign.story:
THE STORY:
SILENT FORESTS is an intimate, character-driven portrait of activists who are fighting to stop forest elephant poaching and other endangered species trafficking in Africa's Congo Basin.
After a 2011 survey revealed that more than half the Central African forest elephant population has been killed for ivory in just the last decade, there has been a concerted effort to save those that remain. SILENT FORESTS will explore this story through a range of dynamic subjects; including one of Cameroon’s first female eco-guards, a grassroots wildlife law enforcement group, a Congolese biologist studying elephant communication, a reformed elephant poacher, and a team of anti-poaching sniffer dogs led by a Czech conservationist.
This film will be an in-depth look at one particular under-reported region as a microcosm to understand the global poaching crisis we face, and what it is like for those who are on the front lines of this war to save wildlife.
We've already filmed a total of two months in Cameroon, and have gotten some exciting material. We followed our eco-guards deep into the forest as they patrol for poachers, and ridden along on undercover investigations to bust ivory trafficking circles.
Sidonie Asseme, one of Cameroon's first female eco-guards
Our next phase is to head to Congo-Brazzaville in January to film with a biologist who studies forest elephant "language" and communication, and an intrepid sniffer dog team that tracks criminals down who are illegally trafficking endangered species products.
BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP TO GET THERE! We've received great support from places like the Rogovy Foundation and Telluride Mountainfilm, but we are still short of our funding goal for our next shoot in Congo. Between permits, visas, equipment, travel and labor costs, the amount needed to make this shoot happen is $29,500.
Any money left over from this shoot will go towards our final shoot in Cameroon, slated for May/June 2017. From there, we’ll be heading directly into post-production, with the goal of having a rough cut done by September 2017!
WHY FOREST ELEPHANTS MATTER:
You may have already heard that we are in the midst of an elephant poaching epidemic across the African continent. Fueled by a growing middle class in Asia that is hungry for ivory status symbols, these iconic and intelligent mammals are being slaughtered for their tusks at an alarming rate. Experts say that if this trend continues, we may be living in a world without wild elephants by 2025!
While there has been a lot of media focus on savannah elephants in eastern and southern Africa, very little light has been shed on the forest elephant crisis in central Africa. Here, in what many call Africa’s last Eden, a battle is playing out on multiple fronts for the future of the elusive forest elephant. But it’s an uphill struggle: A June 2015 report in Science highlighted the Tridom region (Congo, Cameroon, and Gabon) as one of the top three elephant poaching hotspots in the world today.
This is especially bad news given the forest elephant’s important biological role within its larger ecosystem. Uniquely built for such a dense environment, the forest elephant makes its way through the thick underbrush by using its tusks to push plants and small trees aside. While this may sound destructive, it actually helps to let sunlight down to the forest floor, which allows new plants to grow and creates natural pathways for other animals to use.
Their dung is a useful fertilizer, and their herbivorous diet means that the elephants consume and transport seeds all across the forest, aiding in the distribution of plant species. In fact, forest elephants disperse more intact seeds than any other animal in the African forest – and their stomach acids help germinate many of these seeds at a much faster rate. They are true gardeners of the jungle.
African Forest Elephant
Aside from forest elephants, another unique thing about SILENT FORESTS that I believe makes it stand out from some other recent documentaries about poaching issues is that four of the five main characters in this film are from either Cameroon or Congo. This film highlights African activists, scientists, and eco-guards and who care deeply about what is happening in their own backyards. The very nature of their work can oftentimes put them at odds with their fellow countrymen, and the risks they assume to protect the animals of the Congo Basin are significant.
The eventual goal of SILENT FORESTS is to educate the public about this oftentimes overlooked elephant subspecies, and engage audiences to support groups dedicated to ending the Congo Basin poaching epidemic before it’s too late.
SILENT FORESTS TEAM:
Zebediah Smith, Director of Photography
ZEBEDIAH SMITH: Recently receiving an Emmy Award in cinematography for his work on Joseph Rosendo’s Travelscope, Zebediah Smith has worked in documentary television for the past decade from many angles including director of photography, producer, production supervisor, and editor. On the television and commercial side, he has worked with Travel Channel, Discovery, PBS, Verizon, Google, Virgin America, and United, but his passion lies in independent documentary work. He has traveled the world, filming in over 30 countries while trekking the Himalayas, joining tribal rituals in the high Andes, and communing with Gorillas in Rwandan jungles. At home in the U.S., Zebediah co-produced and edited the Sundance Documentary Fund winner WHATEVER IT TAKES, which won Audience Awards and Grand Jury Prizes at festivals across the US for it’s intimate, character-driven cinéma vérité style. He looks forward to continuing to be a part of in-depth productions that inspire, inform, and entertain audiences worldwide.
Mariah Wilson, Director, in canoe with eco-guards in Nki Park, Cameroon
MARIAH WILSON: You can read more about me in the bio link above, or check out my website at www.mariahewilson.com
SILENT FORESTS will be my third film that has to do with wildlife crime and illegal trade; it is a subject I am both passionate about and familiar with. My hope is that this documentary will shed light on the severity of the situation in this region, and how damaging the ivory trade is for all species -- humans included.
You can see more about our journey in this production so far on our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/silentforests/
Thank you so much for your help, we couldn't do this without you!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always challenges to overcome on filming any documentary, and certainly one that takes place primarily in remote African forests. We have already had some trying moments with acquiring visas for certain countries at certain times, but whenever we've hit a road block we've adjusted our plan accordingly. Our team is small and streamlined, so our ability to be flexible has been the key to our success so far. Also, lots of deep breaths help :) 

Another challenge we have faced is actually filming the forest elephants themselves. They are an elusive species even under the best of circumstances; and right now the poaching pressures are so great that the remaining herds are hesitant to come out into clearings where we can see them. 

However, the clearings that our biologist in Congo has been monitoring are fairly newly discovered, and don't have the same poaching pressures as other locations we have filmed. So we are confident that we'll be able to get some great shots of elephant interaction and behavior while in Congo, so we can illustrate what all of our film subjects are fighting so hard to protect. This is why it's paramount that we get to Congo to film as soon as possible, and why we have launched this campaign. 
http://kickingitforward.org
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Silent Forests "sneak peek" at DC Environmental Film Festival
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
Apologies for the delay in posting updates, but we've been busy working on post-production for Silent Forests! Over 100 hours of footage had to be logged and organized (many transcriptions and translations were involved) but we are now full steam ahead on our rough cut.
We will begin fine cutting in the next week or two, and hope to have a cut to submit to festivals for consideration by the end of this year. Fingers crossed :) Meanwhile, we got some good news.. Silent Forests was accepted into DOC NYC's 2017 "Only In New York" work-in-progress market. is the largest documentary film festival in America, and the industry conference and market is a great place for filmmakers to meet with potential distributors and outlets to help get their film out to as wide an audience as possible once it is complete.

updates.update_userinfo: Update: Silent Forests is in post-production!
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarters! I wanted to give you the latest field notes from our trip to Congo-Brazzaville.
First off, the big news... we finally were able to film forest elephants!!

updates.update_userinfo: Updates from the latest Silent Forests shoot
updates.update_content:
Thanks to you all, we're headed back to Africa next week! We're preparing to film with biologist Clement Inkamba Nkulu in western Congo-Brazzaville.
He's been seeing forest elephants in two different clearings there, both day and night, so our fingers are crossed that we get to see these incredible animals in action and learn more about how they communicate with each other.
In other good news from the past few weeks, China announced that they are planning to end all ivory sales by the end of 2017. Let's hope this will help the forest elephants have a better chance at repopulating the clearings of the Congo Basin in years to come.

WE DID IT!! Thank you SO much to everyone for your support - it really means so much to us. We are excited to continue making this film, and will keep you updated! Meanwhile, feel free to follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/silentforests
I'll be sending surveys soon to gather necessary info for your rewards :)
THANKS AGAIN!!!

We're in the home stretch, folks! That means it's time for another shoot anecdote! :)
So, when we were in Cameroon in July this year, we brought along a camera drone so we could get some nice aerial shots of the forest. We also used it to get some shots of the rural areas and countryside of southeast Cameroon. While we were with Jean-Paul (the former elephant poacher) in his village, we decided to fly the drone to get a few shots.

comments.content: I can't wait to see this! Please let me know when you are back in NY for dinner to tell all! Jane Tate

Supporting this project means you are helping to save the elephants and you are supporting the female voice when it comes to the arts and nature - we need to hear more from women, who are grossly underrepresented in this world when it comes to such issues. Good to see this project has a female director, and female eco warriors. Love it!

campaign.story:
Introducing HX-01, an animated short film by hexeosis.
Hi, my name is hexeosis. For a little over three years now, I’ve been creating and posting animated GIFs on the internet. I’ve been unreasonably lucky to have connected with thousands and thousands of fans from all over the world. Crazy, but awesome!
I’m launching this Kickstarter campaign to help fund the production of a full length, full color, full HD sized animated short film. 
As seen in the trailer, this full length video will be a journey in and out of forms and patterns, mandalas and psychedelic landscapes. Colorful calm moments, energetic dynamic sequences and thought-provoking, mind bending constructions woven together into an overall seamless rhythm and flow.
I've been working on this video on and off since the beginning of the year, and have several sections completed already. I decided to make it into a Kickstarter project to help raise funds to get the Blu-ray discs printed and to help spread the word about the video. 
As the video production progresses, I’ll keep all of you awesome backers regularly updated with a production blog. I’ll post a few clips, screenshots and GIFs as they are completed for some backer exclusive sneak peaks.
If you are familiar with my GIFs, this video is going to be like the GIFs, except instead of 540x540 pixel size, the video will be full 1920x1080 HD. It will have sound and music. It will be at least 33 minutes long. And you can get it on Blu-ray / DVD disc and Digital HD download. This will be a seamless, 100% animated sequence, timed to music and soundscapes, also created by me especially for this video.
I am creating all of the music and sound effects for the video as well, so that I can time the visuals and audio perfectly. Some sections will be mellow and slower, while others will have a faster pace to mix it up. 
ABOUT hexeosis
When I started the hexeosis project, my original idea was to create a visual representation of infinity. And when I originally envisioned this video, I was thinking about something that you could put on in the background at a friendly get together, while chilling out, meditating…. that kind of thing. It’s non-narrative.
If you aren’t familiar with the GIFs I’ve been creating, most of them are posted on my Tumblr page, I’ve created over 1000 of them over the past three years. I also really like Ello, and frequently post larger sized / less compressed GIFs there. You can also check out my Instagram and Twitter for even more images and GIFs.
I'm setting this up on Kickstarter for a couple of reasons. First of all, the idea of building a community of supporters and fans to help back the work is really cool and inspiring. This is the exact kind of project that crowdfunding is suited for, because it appeals directly to the fans.
Secondly, getting the physical Blu-ray discs pressed and the boxes printed is going to cost a bit of money. By running the Kickstarter campaign, I hope to raise enough funds to order a lot of discs all at once, thus significantly lowering the per unit price.
REWARDS !
I really appreciate your support, and have put together some awesome rewards. First of all, anyone who pledges any amount at all will have their name listed as a supporter in the film’s credits and on hexeosis.com as my way of showing thanks.
All of the physical reward levels include at least one hexeosis sticker. I’ve been selling stickers on my webstore for a little over a year now and I am super grateful to everyone that has ordered stickers, it’s been a very rewarding experience. I’m always excited to see where they are going, some to cities and towns I’ve never heard of before, and yet thru the internet we’ve been able to connect with each other.
hexeosis sticker (street light not included)
The stickers are made from weatherproof UV laminated vinyl and will last a long time. Each one measures about 3 inches across. They're really bright and durable. 
Here's a mock up of what the Blu-ray box will probably look like: 
Blu-ray / DVD cover art
The deluxe edition Blu-ray / DVD disc set includes a set of 6 postcards with images from the film, suitable for mailing (or whatever you normally do with postcards) plus three hexeosis stickers! 
deluxe edition postcard set. (final artwork subject to change)
  platonic solids sticker sheets
I am also including reward levels that come with even more stickers and some that come with platonic solids sticker sheets. 
And finally if you are a really big fan and want to support this project in a major way, there are producer and executive producer credits available, which will include having your name in the opening title sequence and a bunch of copies of the Blu-ray / DVD to share with your family and friends!
If you have any questions about the rewards, please don't hesitate to ask. (Note, the producer credit rewards don't confer an ownership stake in the final product.) (Also, international customers may incur additional taxes and custom charges not included here, that's up to your country.)
THANKS!
Thank you for reading! Please share this project with your friends, family, co-workers, strangers, corporate overlords, mortal enemies, local squirrels, community leaders and friendly robots and everyone else you think may be into this kind of thing and help me make this video a reality.
There are easy social media sharing links near the top of the page just under the video trailer. Thanks again! 
Also, if you want to see an HD version of the trailer, check it out on my youtube page: hexeosis youtube. Be sure to click on 1080p quality! 
If you want to write an article or blog post about this project, thanks, you are the best! Here's a press kit containing images, gifs and a brief write up.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I might get abducted by aliens.

Also, with any creative project there is a chance of delays from unforeseen challenges and obstacles, but I will be sure to be completely transparent about any such problems and keep everyone fully updated. 

As I mentioned above, I've already completed several sections of the film, and am estimating it will take about two months to complete the rest, get the discs pressed and shipped out. 

I've been successfully shipping out 1000's of stickers to people all over the world without any problems for over a year now and am completely confident I can complete this project in a timely manner as well.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hi Everyone, hopefully by now, you have received your rewards package in the mail! I've gotten a lot of really great feedback and would like to say thanks again to everyone for backing the project and for the kind words and for the social media posts and everything! Hope you all enjoyed watching the finished video!
Yey! Quick update to let everyone know the Blu-ray / DVD combo pack discs are done being manufactured and I received them yesterday!

Hi everyone! Couple of things to update you on:
1 - Wallpapers
The wallpapers / desktop patterns are ready to download! (finally, yey!) I had originally planned to create about 36 of them, but got carried away and now there’s a bit over 100. You can get them all at once in a zip file or check them out one at a time and just get the ones you like on dropbox. Check your email for a message containing those two links!

The final video has been completed and is now available to download! Please check your email for the link. Remember if you ever need to contact me, you can send a message here on Kickstarter or to erik@hexeosis.com. Thanks again and enjoy the video! 
P.S. I’ll also be sending a link for the downloadable wallpapers in a few days and if you ordered a physical copy of the film on DVD/Blu-Ray…. it will ship in just a few more weeks! Thanks again!

Hi everybody, I posted a few weeks ago that the completed film would be ready to download tomorrow, Feb 28th, but I am going to need just a few more days! :( :( :( 
Hopefully this doesn't inconvenience anyone too much, sorry for the delay! Instead of 1 more day, it's 4 more, I'll send out download links and instructions on Friday! 
The video is 99% done and looking great, can't wait to share it! Here's what the next few days involve for me:

Hi Everyone,
Thanks to everybody for responding to the survey from last week to double check the spelling of your name for the credits. Almost everyone replied, but if you didn't yet respond to the survey from last week, now is your last chance! You have about 48 hours left. Thanks! 
Also, as promised (sorry for the lateness) here's a few work-in-progress preview clips from the film. Each is about a minute long, check 'em out:

Final Stretch! 
The video is almost done and will premiere on February 28th! I plan to make the digital download version available on that day and then ship out the DVD / Blu-Ray discs in the weeks that follow. So if you pledged at the digital download level, you should be able to download the completed video in two weeks! Thank you all for your support and thanks for your patience as I wrap up all the final details. I’m excited to share the video and I know many people are eagerly awaiting the release!

Hi everyone and welcome to the first update after the funding period has completed. Thanks again everyone for helping to bring this project to life! I will post updates every couple of weeks to let you know how the project is progressing. 
I have almost all of the shots blocked out and the basic timeline roughed in place. Maybe about 90% there at this point. Once I get all the shots arranged in sequence, I will begin completing all of the transitions. My goal is for all of the transitions to be either invisible or really interesting.

Thanks to all 245 of you for backing the project! I'm extremely thankful to all of you for your support and comments and shares and reblogs and everything! Amazing! 
Now I need to get to work finishing up the video and getting it ready to send out to the world. Soon, I'll be sending out backer surveys to collect any needed important information and as the project progresses, I'll be posting regular updates, clips and behind the scenes photos.
