campaign.story:
PLATFORMS
Get Audio Game Hub now at: Google Play Store, App Store, or PC.
STRETCH GOALS
We have reached over 150% in under 10 days! Wohoo!
The team sat down to brainstorm stretch goals that would both encourage continuing pledges but also make a significant impact on the visually impaired community. 
And with that, we give you two of our new stretch goals:
- Stretch Goal 1 - $12,000 - 100 copies of Audio Game Hub will be sent for free to foundations around the world! As a pledger, you will have a say in which foundations will receive our games.
- Stretch Goal 2 - $18,000 -  The team will create 1 extra game out of the list of 12 possible games. This way, instead of voting for 5 games, you will be voting for your top 6 favorite games for us to create!
WHY?
 Good question!
“Nobody makes games for us.” were the words that launched this collaborative project, aimed at bringing the fun of video games to the nearly 300 million visually impaired around the world, as well as the many more who want to play by sound rather than sight.
Put simply, most of the games made for the visually impaired currently in the market are much more simple than traditional video games and unfortunately, many audio games are not as developed in terms of depth, diversity, multiplayer functionality or good replay-ability.
Clearly, there is a need and a responsibility to provide the visually impaired with richer gameplay than what is currently available. And this is where we come in to continue this good deed and expand on our original project.
Here at Audio Game Hub, we believe games should be for everyone! We specialise in using sounds and music to create a world for our players to immerse in without any limitations.
WHERE WE HAVE BEEN
The original Audio Game Hub was released in April 2016, and it is an application that contains eight audio mini-games, designed for both non-sighted and sighted users. Multiple genres of casual video games were adapted into accessible audio equivalents, each designed with unique interaction patterns and gameplay mechanics. 
Click below to preview gameplay from the already created games:
Since our original launch, the application has gathered over 30,000 downloads, excellent reviews, ratings and feedbacks and have even received awards from the Play by Play Festival and Royal National Institute of Blind People (RNIB).
WHERE WE ARE GOING
We have gotten over a hundred requests to make more games and many of you suggested that we should go for a Kickstarter campaign and so, we are doing just that. 
We want to add another 5 brand new games to our hub on all 3 platforms: PC, Android and iOS. 
We have loads of ideas to narrow down from but why let us decide when we have awesome people like you who can have a say in it all? 
By pledging at any level, you will have the ability to vote for your 5 favorite games out of the ones listed below:
Frogger - Left? Clear. Right? Clear. Cross! Listen for oncoming vehicles, dodge traffic, and mind any obstacles in your way.
Cricket - There is no longer a need to wait for a sunny day to play a good game of cricket! Put yourself in the shoes of a proffesional cricket player and test your reactions and reflexes by batting using your device just as you would if you were on the field!
Boxing (Punch-out) - Get ready to take on the world! Fight it out with boxing champions from across the globe, here to challenge you for your title!
Bowling - Ten pins, one ball. A classic game of knocking things over.
Runner - Through rain and snow, run for as long as you can! Duck under or jump over obstacles as you make your way through the course!
Minesweeper - Clear and mark each section of a grid, until you’re sure you’ve taken care of all the mines… or have you?
Road Race - Put pedal to the metal as you race from coast to coast, making sure to pick up fuel and smooth over any mangled metal along the way. A racing game based on arcade classics.
Poker - Texas / Poker - Classic - Just like in the casinos! Play either classic or Texas Hold’em poker in single-player against multiple AI personalities. 
Blackjack - 21 - The most widely played casino game in the world, blackjack is a race to reach 21, but don’t go over! 
Eggs - So many chickens, so many eggs and only one basket. How many eggs will you let break? A remake of the classic portable 1986 'Nu Pogodi' arcade game.
Roulette - Place your bets and spin to win! A longtime classic from casinos all over the world. 
Craps (Roll the Dice) - Kiss your dice for luck, then shoot some craps to see what you win! 
Simon + Super Simon - A game in the style of Simon, where you have to remember an ever-growing sequence of commands. Too easy? Switch to Super-Sequence in which you have to juggle multiple sequences to advance through the levels!
WHISPERING TUNNELS
A Diablo like audio role playing game speacially tailored for the visually impaired! Packed with interactive non-linear plot, character development, NPCs, quests and complex dialogues, create your own story as you escape from the whispering tunnels and the devious traps, monstrous creatures and puzzles that it may hold. Find a variety of weapons, tools or magical items to use at your disposal, and picklock a door or simply attempt to break through it with your own strength; the choice is yours.
You wake up.
It is pitch black and nothing can be heard but the echo of gentle drops and what seems to be a whisper…
Is it calling your name?
Your lips are cracked and broken and your mouth dry as a desert.
How long have you been asleep for?
You feel the coarse ground beneath you as you attempt to stand on your feet and almost collapse from weakness.
You need to get out of here. Now.
During the development of Whispering Tunnels, the team has expanded the scope of the game to a size much much bigger than we had originally planned. So much even that we have decided to release it as a stand alone app!
With all the new functionality, story and mechanics we have added, Whispering Tunnels could easily become one of the best Action, Hack and Slash, role playing games available for the visually impaired! Just think about the first time you played Diablo or a similar dungeon crawler game. We are bringing this level of quality to provide the best possible experience for our players.
The team has been busy working on the engine of Whispering Tunnels and are around 70% through in a lot of the mechanics such as navigation, combat, inventory and map systems which means a working demo should be here sooner rather than later!
Originally we had planned to give this game out as an exclusive for Kickstarter backers only. However, we started this project with the belief that games should be for everyone and so making our biggest game exclusive to only about 100 people is not staying true to who we are or what we want to do. 
This was not our goal and we are aware of our mistake.
Because of that, we have changed our approach of exclusiveness in a way that will still reward Kickstarter pledgers/backers but also will allow people from all over the world to purchase and experience the Whispering Tunnels in the future.
Pledge at a Gentle Whisper level or above and receive exclusive content for the Whispering Tunnels in the form of:
Access to Whispering Tunnels 1 month before release to public
Access to Whispering Tunnels at a lower price than public release price
Exclusive Kickstarter Backer Achievement
Exclusive Kickstarter In-Game Weapons and Items
and more to come…
WHERE YOU COME IN
We love what we do and want to create more high quality audio games for our players to love too. Unfortunately, as with everything, there are some costs involved in the project. These can be summarised to:
Hiring professional voice actors
Purchasing sound effects and music
Pizza costs for the team
These costs however, can be heavily reduced with your help.
Help - verb - to make it easier or possible for someone to do something by offering them one's services or resources.
That's right! Either pledge or spread the word about Audio Game Hub! Or even better, do both!
We believe games should be for everyone and the more people we have alongside us, the faster we can move and the bigger the impact we can make.
MILESTONES
Our goal for this Kickstarter is $6,000 as this is the minimum we would need to cover the costs of voice actors, sound effects and music.
After the Kickstarter campaign, the games would then be sold separately (except for the 'Whispering Tunnels' game) via in app purchases to the general public.
To summarise:
Our Goal - $6,000 - REACHED
- 5 new games will be voted on and then created.
- The Whispering Tunnels will be created.
- Games will be released and sold separately via in-app purchases for non-backers.
TESTIMONIALS
We have received a lot of touching feedback both supporting our cause and encouraging further development; but don’t take our word for it:
 “Hi, I wanted to write this email to express not only my thanks and gratitude but also my complete amazement of your Audio games hub app. 
I am partially sighted and my wife is fully sighted and to be able to play games with her is just fantastic. You made possible something I thought I wouldn't ever see. 
It's about the games yes certainly, but the experiences, the laughs and fun we can have because both sighted and visually impaired people can play these set of excellent games together. 
So for the fun we have had so far and the fun we will have in the future I can't thank you enough. I hope more games will be on the way!" - Riz
“Hello, I'm writing to tell you how much I love this app! I'm blind and use it on the iPhone platform, and it is so great to finally have an accessible game hub app.
Maybe you guys could create a pro version where one would have to pay a little bit and you guys can include some extra games as well, because I would love to be able to support you guys even on a fixed income as this is such a wonderful app!” - Mary
OUR AWARDS
  Audio Game Hub was awarded the application of the month by the Royal National Institute of Blind People (RNIB) in September 2016.
Royal National Institute of Blind People [website link]
September 2016, United Kingdom
Audio Game Hub was a category winner at the Play by Play Festival, winning “Excellence in Representation”.
Audio Game Hub was also a finalist in the event and was shown in the exhibition that accompanied the Festival.
Play by Play, International Games Festival [website link] [2016 video]
18th-23rd April 2016, Wellington, New Zealand
We were proudly selected as one of the top 10 most innovative startups out of over 100 others startups in New Zealand.
Lighting Lab Auckland [website link]
March - July 2016 
Our team received first place and the award for the AUTEL Innovation Challenge in 2015.
AUTEL Innovation Challenge [website link] 
 26th November 2015
  WHO WE ARE
We are a team of students from Auckland University of Technology who have devoted our free time to explore, innovate and create ways to provide the best gaming experience possible for those who are visually impaired.
Jarek Beksa - Originator, Team leader, Audio Engineer & Designer
Jeong Su Jeon - Lead Unity Developer
David Delgado (Twitter) - Unity Developer, Social Media Marketing & Writer
Vincent ‘Vinny’ Polehwidhi - Scripts & Social Networking
Juan Rodríguez (Twitter) - Web Designer & Unity Developer
Tarn Tarn - Website Developer & Unity Developer 
PLEDGE LEVEL INFORMATION
In this section you will find extra information on various pledge levels and their rewards.
Please note rewards and pledge levels are fixed however reward details are subject to change and this information is a close approximation of the final rewards.
Knock on the Door & Chirping Canary
Receive a physical copy of Audio Games Hub in our premium USB contained by our Original Metal Casing.

Risks and challenges
As in any game development scenario, there can be risks involved. However, because we have previously successfully launched the original Audio Game Hub, we know that our team has the skills, determination and drive to further develop the next stage of our project.

The app is already live on various platforms with excellent user reviews and ratings and because of this, most obstacles and challenges have already been overcome even before this Kickstarter and so we believe that continuing to expand should be relatively low risk.

campaign.story:
WHEN WAS THE LAST TIME YOU GOT SOMETHING IN THE MAIL THAT MADE YOU FEEL GOOD?
Getting something in the mail should be fun. Sending something fun in the mail should be easy. Help me send you weird postcards.
Some facts and observations:
I'm about to head out on a little trip faraway from my home
People often send postcards to friends when they go on trips
Postcards afford very limited space
Limits can be liberating
My mom always says I should draw more
I like getting mail, and I figure you might, too
you know this familiar format
 Some thoughts: 
We are accessible and connected to one another now more than ever before. And yet our communications don't always feel all that personal. We often broadcast ourselves to the world, but that kind of connection isn't satisfyingly direct or lasting. 
This is probably why getting something like a postcard in the mail feels exciting. It's not as fleeting as our other communications.
This is a thing I made with you - and you alone - in mind. 
Here I was, in this other faraway place, and I thought of you. 
This object traveled many miles to find its way to you. Who knows what journey it took to get here?
Here is this thing you can hold in your hands, hang on your fridge, put on your desk, talk about.
Today this memento arrived specifically for me from someone I know existing in a different time and place. 
What makes this postcard different from other plain old postcards?
Well, technically...nothing really. I'll be looking for fun and interesting postcards wherever I go on this trip. I'll buy the ones that catch my eye and then use the back of each one as my own little canvas. 
(theoretical image of me sorting through interesting postcards)
Here's a test version I made in a few minutes the other night using a postcard I picked up a while back in Roswell, NM:
front of postcard
  back of postcard (excuse the dad jokes)
When I was a kid and we'd go on vacation, my parents would encourage me to send my friends a postcard or two. I recall a visceral feeling of apprehension. What am I supposed to say? Where do I start? In those fleeting moments of terror I'd eventually find my way, jotting down notes about the scenery, the weather, mundane but pleasant things. I was at my best when I started to get weird and make little drawings to balance out the boring words. Those drawings made the postcard feel light, goofy, fun.
Skip forward. I haven't sent too many postcards since I was little. It just felt like something I'd outgrown, or maybe something that didn't feel worth the effort. Then, earlier this year, I spent a solid chunk of a Saturday afternoon soaking in this show of artwork that belonged to Sol LeWitt. Tucked away in the basement I found the most poignant part of the show, a tiny extension of the exhibit I nearly missed. 
Nested in a glass case was a collection of postcards exchanged between LeWitt and his friends. They were so simple: just a sketch here, a non sequitur there. A meditation on a spare phrase. Yet in many ways these postcards said so much more than plain old sentences ever could. This kind of correspondence was easy, playful, meaningful, light, and profound all at once. I instantly felt compelled to make my own odd postcards.
So now, here I am. With Sol and friends as my muse, and knowing that I'll be in a far away place myself very soon, I'd like to summon this magic and try it out for myself. 
there's a chance i might even draw you a postcard from a place that looks like this
Who knows what'll happen?
An Avant Card may include:
a drawing
a haiku or other sort of poem
simple prose
a meditation 
a written snapshot of a moment in my journey
whatever moves me at the moment
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
- I've been known to be a procrastinator. There is a chance your Avant Card or Digital Hello may be conceived hastily and on a bus or a plane - but not without thought!

- This project's running on a tight deadline. Assuming the project is successfully funded, I'll be depending on you, the backer, to send back your survey responses within 24-36 hours of receiving the survey so that I can collect all the info I need before I take off for my voyage. If I don't receive your info in time, or the wi-fi where I'll be isn't up to snuff and I can't download your info, you'll have to settle on having your postcard sent after I return from my trip.

- International postal service may be slow. While I plan to send postcards from my trip this month, I'm not sure how long they'll take to arrive in the mail...hence the estimated delivery dates way in the future.

- I've done my best to anticipate the cost of postcards and postage where I'll be headed, but I won't know exactly how much everything costs until I'm there.

- I'm a human.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

INCLUDES:
Avant Card (personalized, one-of-a-kind postcard)
Photo for you from me (delivered electronically)

updates.update_content:
Still readjusting to city life, but I'm back! I spent a couple weeks bouncing around Buenos Aires and Patagonia (Ushuaia, El Calafate, El Chaltén). I took a lot of photos and sent a lot of post cards. 
So how's the project going?

Well, here we are. I'm writing to you from a tiny cramped seat on an airplane, waiting to take off.
The project ended successfully yesterday. So many more of you pledged than I could have ever expected. Especially in uncertain times like these, your support gave me a much needed boost of positivity and confidence in humanity. Thank you so much. I hope I can reflect it back.
Now what? Now begins the actual project. I sent out most of the surveys yesterday. The only one left is for the "BETTER LATE THAN NEVER" tier, which is a little less time-sensitive, and I'll send that out as soon as I have wi-fi again.

There's a lot more going on in the world right now that's more important than this little project. But with only 20 or so hours left, I only have so much time to maintain this campaign and update you all.
Thanks to the encouraging words of friends, family, and backers like Norman and Jesse in the comments (special thanks to them for the public posts of positivity), I've added a couple new reward tiers:

updates.update_userinfo: there are so many of you and it's amazing
updates.update_content:
I'm blown away that all the physical rewards are sold out, even after I increased the limits late last night (!!). I wish I could offer more, but I also need to keep these reward limits in place to keep myself from spending every waking hour on my trip drawing on postcards.
At the moment I'm thinking up a couple ideas so that more folks can pledge if they like. I'll be sure to keep you posted, though I imagine we all have bigger things on our minds tonight...

A haiku for the end of today: 
in just fourteen hours
thirty two of you breathed life 
into one concept 
Well. Here we are at the close of the first day of this project and I'm feeling incredibly encouraged and humbled by all your support. Thanks so much to all of you who've pledged so far and helped spread the word.

comments.content: Got my postcard in the mail this week - what a treat! It's a real beaut, too. Thanks Noah!
I patiently await my poatcard.
(Consider publishing a journal of your travels and wisdom - I will be one of your first supporters)

campaign.story:
The Dance Gallery Festival needs your help!
We are celebrating the 10th year of presenting this festival in NYC and in honor of this anniversary we want grow in our support of dance by expanding our programming to showcase more artists and offering more support to up-and-coming choreographers.
Festival Artists with Directors Astrid von Ussar and Andy Noble
 Started in 2007 by Astrid von Ussar, the Dance Gallery Festival is a showcase of dance artists from around the country and world. This year marks the 10th year that this Festival has been presented and we are hoping to move into a year of both celebration and development. For the past 10 years, the Festival has grown slowly with new programs being added every few years. In this critical and important 10th year, we are hoping to expand further to offer more support and opportunities to up-and-coming dance artists.
This Kickstarter campaign will help us fund the special performances that we are having in celebration of our 10th year presenting this festival and, in addition, enable us to start working on providing new and more programs. Over the years, we have made this festival happen on smaller than a shoestring budget, but in order to grow and move forward, we need more support. And we are hoping that those who support here will consider making an annual donation to the Festival as well.
VON USSAR danceworks; photo by Lynn Lane
 This Festival started as a solution to a problem but has turned into a structure that supports and creates a rich community for dance artists and serves as a platform for dance artists to present work, but we still lack a base of financial support from which we can grow. We hope that with your help, we can change that.
Who is performing this year?
NYC
Best Of 10 - Friday, Nov 11 @ 7pm 
Gabrielle Lamb/Pigeonwing Dance - New York, NY 
Joshua L. Peugh/Dark Circles Contemporary Dance - Dallas, TX

Main Event - Sunday, Nov 13 @ 3pm & 7:30pm 
3pm

John Beasant III - Houston, TX

Joshua L. Peugh/Dark Circles Contemporary Dance - Dallas, TX 
Sean Aaron Carmon - New York, NY  
Texas 
Friday & Saturday, Nov 4 & 5** 
Amy Morrow/The Theorists - Austin, TX
Bruce Wood Dance Project - Dallas, TX
Christopher Rudd/RudduR Dance - New York, NY 
Jennifer Mabus - Houston, TX John Beasant III - Houston, TX 
Joshua L. Peugh/Dark Circles Contemporary Dance - Dallas, TX 
Mike Esperanza/BARE Dance Company - New York, NY 
Manuel Vignoulle - M/motions - New York, NY 
Rohan Bhargava/Rovaco Dance Company - New York, NY 
Susan Douglas Roberts/wild goose chase dance - Fort Worth, TX
**Not all artists will perform at both Texas shows.
Where Will Your Funds Go?
We are in need of this support to help with the many expenses that go along with running a Festival: we have to rent a theatre in NYC for four days, hire a lighting designer, a photographer, a press agent, and there are many additional costs that add to a pretty big bottom line. And we do it all in Texas too.
Please know that any size donation is greatly appreciated. We look forward to being able to offer more opportunities for artists with your support and we hope to see you this November in NYC and/or Texas!
Thank you!
Dance Gallery Festival 2015
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This Festival has been put on for the past nine years on trust. The Festival will happen this year, one way or another - but we are looking for support to give us the ability to start looking ahead to new things. We are looking for annual support that we can use to bring artists to NYC and Texas, that we can use to offer more commissions, that we can use to develop new partnerships and ways to support the incredible artists we have apply each year. 

The Dance Gallery Festival has always been a "risk", but it is one that we are happy to take if it means that the artists we present have new opportunities because of us. We are happy to say that many of our alumni have gone on to present at Jacob's Pillow and other festivals around the country. It is always worth it - we just want to get even better at what we do with your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Announcing the 2016 Audience Choice Award Winner!
updates.update_content: We would like to officially announce this year's Audience Choice Award Winner, Rohan Bhargava of Rovaco Dance Company! Rohan's work was outstanding and the favorite of this year's festival. Over the next 12 months, The Dance Gallery Festival will commission an original work by Rohan to be presented as part of next year's LEVEL UP program. This is such an honor and could not be possible without supporters like you! Stay tuned for next year and check out Rohan's new piece in the 2017 festival!

Dear Dance Gallery supporters,
We just wrapped our festival in NYC and it was a great success! We also were funded on our Kickstarter campaign! We’re really excited and thankful (and exhausted!). Thank you for all your support and we hope you enjoyed the shows if you were able to attend.
In the weeks ahead, we will follow up regarding Kickstarter rewards and also post photo and video updates. If you are interested in being involved with the festival on any level, please let us know. We are open to suggestions and appreciate all the outside support we’ve received.

campaign.story:
Fin is a small, wearable vibrator designed to feel like a part of you, so you can be a part of something amazing.
Unlike most vibrators, Fin is worn between your fingers like a natural extension of your body. It seamlessly adds vibration to foreplay and sex, without spoiling the mood.
Founded in 2014 by two smart women, Dame Products develop our products in-house using intuitive design, safe materials, and rigorous user testing. With these principles in mind, we made Fin small, simple, and powerful, using medical-grade silicone.
Pledge now to save 20% on Fin's retail price ($74.95)!!!!
   Watch the following video to learn a little about who we are, and what Fin's all about:
  Fin in Jade and Coral
 Small & Mighty
Fin was designed to optimize power in the most compact package possible. Fin won’t feel in the way, but you will certainly feel Fin. 
Three Speeds 
Low, Medium and High. We believe in keeping it simple! Too many modes means too much time finding the one you really want — and too much frustration in turning it off.
Medical-Grade Silicone
Like all our products, Fin is made with medical-grade silicone. The material is USP Class IV, not just "body safe"... whatever that means.
USB Rechargeable 
Fin can be recharged for use after use after use! The included USB charging cable lets you charge Fin across the globe.
Quiet
Keep your earplugs on the nightstand. We designed Fin to deliver a lot of power without a lot of commotion.
Fin will eventually retail at $74.95 — pledging to our campaign will get you one at a 20% discount or more!
Make sure to tell your friends and loved ones about Fin. We'd love for these goals to become a reality!
              The overwhelming response to that first campaign proved the need for well-engineered products that fit the needs of real people's sex lives. We hope that these principles will bring us the same success with Fin.
  Research shows women are four times more likely than men to call recent sex "unpleasurable." We call this the Pleasure Gap, and it's our mission to close it.
For most people with vulvas, physical intimacy is key to arousal, and clitoral stimulation is necessary for orgasm. As a vibrator company, we’re pretty good at stimulating clitorises. But you can’t create intimacy by just pressing a button. We knew we couldn’t reinvent the natural connection people feel when touching each other, so we decided to enhance it. 
    Alex Fine + Janet Lieberman
 Alexandra Fine (MA in Sexual Health, Columbia ‘11) and Janet Lieberman (BS in Mechanical Engineering, MIT ‘07) started Dame Products in 2014 to change the sex toy industry from the inside.
Having designed consumer goods and 3D printers at a number of firms, Janet noticed a conspicuous lack of quality in the world of sex toys. Alex's education in clinical psychology and sexual wellness gave her a keen awareness of the disparity in sexual pleasure between women and their partners. Fate brought them together in the NYC startup scene, and they immediately joined forces.
In October 2014, the duo made sex toy history with their first product, Eva — a hands-free vibrator held by the labia during penetrative sex. Headquartered in Brooklyn, NY, Dame Products has enjoyed incredible success. Eva is now available in stores across the globe, and the team has grown beyond its two founders.
Our continuing mission: to design well-engineered sex toys, to heighten intimacy, and to openly empower the sexual experiences of womankind. Supporting us and Fin will help us make better products at better prices.
Learn a little more about Alex and Janet, and their approach to the next generation of toys for sex:
  Our whiteboard is full of ideas for great sex toys, but we thought a vibrator that augmented touch would be the best fit as our second product. After launching Eva, we’d heard from some couples that while a hands-free vibrator is great, sometimes they wanted a hands-on experience, too. Vibrators worn on the hand have the potential to be great toys for first-time users, sex toy pros, couples or individuals. However, the market didn't have a standout finger vibrator that balanced quality and ease of use with a reasonable price.
We started by talking to stores and surveying the Dame Products community to learn about the features people look for in a finger vibrator, and how they use them. We tried to come up with as many ways as possible to attach a vibrator to a hand, and used our 3D printers to make sketch prototypes of each concept. We took that research and those prototypes and narrowed down what basic forms met the needs our users were most interested in.
Fin's small size requires even smaller components
By March 2016, we had selected Fin as the product concept. One of the main tradeoffs we identified was dexterity vs. power. If the product isn’t powerful enough, it isn’t worth using; if you can’t maintain dexterity, your movements don’t feel intuitive. Fin’s shape and placement between the fingers prevented the motor from interfering with testers' natural movements.
By June 2016, we had begun Alpha testing with prototypes integrating months of ergonomic, aesthetic, and engineering development into a single design. By the time the product ships, we will have incorporated feedback from over 100 Alpha and Beta testers into our design.
Some of Fin's molds and components, and the iterations that lead up to the current prototype.
We always test with women and couples from all different ages and backgrounds. If it doesn’t bring additional value to the sex lives of real people, we don’t put it on the market.
Beta testing is wrapping up, and Janet left for China mid-October to personally oversee tooling and pre-production. Learn more about the challenges that are ahead of us as we bring Fin to market:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are an established company with reliable vendors and tested prototypes, so there isn't a ton of risk in backing Fin. Our materials are sourced, and Janet is on the ground in China to oversee the pre-production runs and make sure the start of production goes smoothly.

The only remaining risk to backers is schedule risk. A range of issues can arise in manufacturing something for the first time, and while we're fairly far along, the devil is in the details. If something arises that will take time to fix, we’re always going to choose to take a week or two to figure out how to do it right over shipping a substandard product.

The other risk at this stage is interest in Fin itself. No matter how much research we do, there's no way to know the customer demand for a product until we put it out on the market. We hope that coming to Kickstarter will allow us to validate the need for a stand-out vibrator that enhances touch. If people like you aren't interested, we'll listen!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
That’s it!
What an incredible campaign. We raised $394,360 from 4,844 backers in just 30 days! We cannot thank you enough for all the support you’ve shown for Fin, and for Dame Products’ mission. As a small team with big dreams, we’re so fortunate to have a community of people lifting us up. Everyone on staff sends their sincere gratitude for making this happen. Even our Fins are celebrating:

Hey there, backers! As the campaign jogs into its final 48 hours (WHOA) we want to introduce you to another creator on Kickstarter doing awesome work: Let’s Be Clear. Because consent looks good on everyone!

Hey there, Fin backers! We have some news for you.
Stretch Goal Update
We’ve passed the $300,000 mark in Kickstarter pledges, but we still need your help to reach our first stretch goal. We're only 325 Likes away on Facebook, and 80 followers away on Instagram! There are so many of you backers out there, we just know you can do it.

As we announced during today's streaming event, our stretch goals are now live! We hope the mix of charitable giving, samples from our partners, and Dame swag will entice you to help drive this campaign as far as you can! If you've already backed Fin, make sure to like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram.

campaign.story:
The In my dreams Art Residency was created in the Summer of 2016. I thought at the time there are plenty of art residencies for an artist to go to but they all have restrictions, fees, applications, committees, etc, etc.
Here at the In my dreams art residency, everyone is invited, just show up in my dreams! There's endless supplies, support, and space available. You can stay as long as you would like! The residency happens while you are dreaming so you don't have to give up work, move, have someone take care of your cats, etc...and you get to sleep on your own bed!
There is not an application fee nor a bunch of red tape to go through...but it does not mean getting into my dreams is going to be an easy task. It will be the combination of a lot of cognitive thinking along with experimentation and play that one will find themselves at this very unique art residency. 
Now, you ask why do I need funding for this art residency? Well, I need a place to sleep while I am dreaming and I could use shelter and food too. All very important to maintaining a healthy dream state. The $3000 will help keep In my dreams art residency afloat for a month. It will pay for most if not all of the bills.
I believe that trying to harness the power of dreams and opening ourselves to the dream World is truly a rewarding experience. And it's something we all should explore at some point in our lives. I hope to see you in my dreams!
Thank you for your time and keep dreaming!
Mr Let's Paint (John Kilduff)
Check out some of the rewards I have below!
  Brian's Dream $200

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The major challenge with my project is the fact that dreams and dreaming are things we do when we are asleep. So, it's sometimes hard to know what and if we dreamt anything at all. On top of all that, it will be extremely hard to know if anyone will ever make it into my dreams. But I think the power of suggestion and the awareness of the idea itself will generate some interesting results. This is truly an experiment and hopefully a fun one too!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Our artistic community at Chez Bushwick faces the same challenge as many New Yorkers: RENT INCREASE. Together we *can* keep the doors open while maintaining the same affordable space and membership pricing! 
Chez Bushwick Studio truly is and remains a home for creative risk-taking and cross-disciplinary collaboration. We offer the most affordable rehearsal rates in New York City – just $8/hour for over 1000 artists annually.
Through our Artists-In-Residence program, we offer 12 artists each year the opportunity to experiment and present their work through peer showings in Chez Bushwick's studio and 2Night Show productions at CPR - Center for Performance Research.
Work-in-progress showing for peers in Chez Bushwick Studio.
CHEZ BUSHWICK PRESENTS nine productions annually: performances curated by special guests, featured works of Artists-In-Residence, in addition to commissioned evening-length works and Bushwick Open Studios.
Bushwick Open Studios: Liz Charky's "I'm Afraid of Everyone", October 2016
Please join us in our heartfelt commitment towards serving a unique and diverse community of artists by creating opportunities for art-making in Brooklyn! Pledge your support and make a donation today!
ABOUT THE REWARDS: We are thrilled to offer rewards uniquely designed for our community of Chez Bushwick artists and friends! 
Featured Rewards:
$35 or more.  Fifteen of our BACKERS will have the opportunity to explore dance practice with Sara Procopio. Hosted in Chez Bushwick’s Studio, Sara Procopio and Masterclass participants will explore and cultivate tools to engage dance practice in new ways. The class is influenced by Sara’s work with Shen Wei Dance Arts as well as her own movement research.
Sara Procopio
“Together we will explore and cultivate tools to engage our dance practice in new ways. We will begin with exercises that encourage an opening of the energetic channels of the body. From an open and aligned body, we will investigate movement based upon breath, flow, suspension, center-shifting, bouncing, momentum, spirals and joint rotations through simple exercises and traveling phrases. Special focus will be placed on transitions and floor work. We will experiment, we will share, we will play and we will honor the body. We will dance. ”
$50 or more. Thirty of our BACKERS will receive two complimentary tickets to see a Chez Bushwick Presents performance at CPR - Center for Performance Research!
Chez Bushwick Presents: Sarah Lifson and Lucas Crane, July 2015.
Chez Bushwick Presents is a nine-part performance series held at CPR - Center for Performance Research. This platform supports artists in many capacities throughout the different steps of the creative process. Chez Bushwick offers performance opportunities to artists to present new works in both shared and full evening length shows, to invite artists to curate, and present the works of Chez Bushwick Artists-In-Residence.
$500 or more. Four BACKERS will enjoy two complimentary tickets to a VIP pre-performance social and premium seating at the NYC premiere of Rules Of The Game, a new choreography by our Founder Jonah Bokaer as part of BAM’s Next Wave Festival on Thursday, November 10th!
Jonah Bokaer's "Rules Of The Game", May 2016. © Sharen Bradford
Hailed by Washington Post as “a groundbreaking performance piece”, Jonah Bokaer’s Rules Of The Game combines dance choreography with Daniel Arsham’s visual concept and an exclusive recording of Grammy Award winning Pharrell Williams’s original score performed by the Dallas Symphony Orchestra as arranged and conducted by David Campbell.
$1,000 or more. Each BACKER at this level directly champions an Artist-In-Residence as “Honorary Producer”. Honorary Producers directly engage with the Artists-In-Residence through a coordinated brunch or dinner hosted by Chez Bushwick, and enjoy premium seating at the premiere performance of their new choreography.
Chez Bushwick's Artists-In-Residence program offers a three-month residency comprised of 100 hours in our studio, peer feedback showings, and culminating with a 2Night Show at CPR - Center for Performance Research.
Past Artists-In-Residence include: Evvie Allison, Effie Bowen, Kelly Buwalda, Marc Crousillat, Gabrielle D’Angelo, Catherine Galasso, Danah Katz, LJ Leach, Sarah Lifson, Judith Locovozzi, Alessia Lovreglio, Mari Meade Montoya, Elisabeth Motley, Mina Nishimura, Goldie Peacock, Nicole Roerick, Alex Romania, Danielle Russo, Stuart Shugg, Samuel Swanton, Eli Tamondong, Nadia Tykulsher, Mariana Valencia, Connor Voss, Nicole Wolcott, Katie Workum, Mei Yamanaka, Laurel Atwell, Zavé Martohardjono, Lily Shaprio, Alina Folini, Emma Geisdorf, Chris Devita, Justin Cabrillos, Millie Kapp.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Chez Bushwick is encountering a challenge common to NYC's rapidly changing neighborhoods, especially due to its key location: rent increase. The organization cannot continue to cover the rising cost of the space AND keep the rental rate at the same low price for our community. Arts organizations that foster NYC performance-based artists are struggling to keep their doors open, and access to affordable rehearsal space is on the decline yet demand has never been higher. With the funds raised through Kickstarter, the goal is to maintain an affordable rehearsal space rental rate of $8/hour and to enable artists to continue presenting innovative ideas and works that reflect our community.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Project Tingler [True Name Concealed Until Release to Protect From Dark Magics] is a brilliant blend of classic adventure games, dating sims, and the world of Amazon Kindle Sensation and Hugo Award Nominee Dr. Chuck Tingle (Space Raptor Butt Invasion; Slammed in the Butthole by My Concept of Linear Time; Pounded in the Butt by My Hugo Award Loss) from game developer Zoë Quinn (Depression Quest; Framed; Betrayal at House on the Hill: Widow's Walk), to be released on computrons of the PC/Mac variety in early 2017.
We need the help of True Buckaroos like you to help us Prove Love Is Real, because we are making the entire game available to to the world without a mandatory price tag. In other words, it's pay-what-you-can. 
  A Vampire Night Bus cussing out local Unicorn Butt Cop propaganda
EXPLORE THE UNIQUE WORLD OF THE TINGLEVERSE IN GLORIOUS FULL MOTION VIDEO. Using long-abandoned Full Motion Video (FMV) game techniques to emulate the singular style of Chuck Tingle’s renowned stock-photo covers, the game not only looks like it was summoned directly from Chuck's imagination, it also evokes the joyful spirit of his stories that we love. That said, you don't have to know the Tingleverse to be a Buckaroo. Project Tingler is ultimately a story about positive sexuality, self-acceptance, love and personal growth. Like Doctor Tingle’s (Ph.d in Sensual Massage from DeVry Institute) 4,000 word masterpieces, Project Tingler will be a brief but sexily refreshing respite, rather than an hours-long epic journey.
NAVIGATE THE TINGLEVERSE in search of your cute son (name of Jon): Your cute son (name of Jon) is missing! To recover him, you’ll have to dive deeper and deeper into the tangled, wrangled, hard-bodied web that is THE TINGLEVERSE! Explore a magical world rendered in glorious FMV (Full Motion Video)! Visit exotic and erotic locations like the desert! A bus depot! The beach! the void. Annnnnd….jail!
HELP PROVE LOVE IS REAL for all who kiss through a variety of seduction minigames: As you journey to save your cute son (name of Jon), you’ll come face to face to butt to mouth with a variety of down-on-their-love foes who seek to get in your way and muss up your hair. But are they enemies of you or enemies... of themselves? Help them figure their biz out by tingling their minds, bodies, and souls. 
GET TINGLED BY OUR CUSTOM SMUT! The very nature of the Tingleverse is The Rawest of Graphic Sensualities, but players who aren’t down with visual depictions of sexual content needn’t fear. While we're working with video and real actors (the cast will most certainly SURPRISE and AMAZE you), there won't be explicit footage of people taking a trip to bonetown. Our salacious scenes are literary in nature and read aloud by talented performers, intended to pound the most sexual of your organs...Your imagination.
Our exquisitely handcrafted smut puts the anal in artisanal
We’re also including a Kitten Mode, where sexual situations will be replaced by footage of kittens playing. If you wish, you may also engage Kitten Mode on its own, just to watch some kittens playing, because why not.
CONFRONT THE ULTIMATE EVIL in The Tingleverse - The Dark Magician Ted Cobbler: Ted Cobbler, the *Dead Gobbler* (not his actual title) has spirited away your cute son (name of Jon) for reasons as inscrutable as they are unsettling. A virtuoso of Dark Magic—indeed, a veritable Dark Magician—Ted Cobbler has his fingers in many sinister stewpots. Take heed: despite the master-class glamour he casts to disguise it, all of Ted Cobbler’s fingers are exactly the same length. You’ll need to learn the true meaning of love to withstand his hideous, alluring powers, for Ted Cobbler claims that Love Is Not Real. 
  Chuck Tingle! Few would dare approach the Tae Kwon Do grandmaster and author of “Space Raptor Butt Redemption,” “Gay T-Rex Lawfirm: Exective Boner,” and “Turned Gay by My Existential Dread That I May Actually be a Character in a Chuck Tingle Book,” but beloved indie game developer Zoë Quinn took the Handsome Unicorn Butt Cop by the horn!
Every journey is better with hard buds. Zoe's core team includes Karla Pacheco (Inspector Pancakes; Dreadful Sirens; Marvel), Elby Teufel (hunktears.sexy), Seth Boyer (Welcome to Night Vale; Tiny Cartridge), and John Warren (The Sun at Night; Murder at Mystery Manor; Tumblewords).
To see some of us in action and better understand the story behind this game, check out this mini-documentary by Vice that followed us around for the early parts of development!
Our core team is joined by a motley crew of actors and voice actors, including Anthony Carboni and Jim Sterling, with more to be announced as we go! 
Your support doesn’t just bring The Gift of Tingle to True Buckaroos Around the World (though assuredly that would be reward enough); you can also get early beta access to the game, behind-the-scenes updates and exclusive Project Tingler rewards like having the butt-pounded star of an Original Chuck Tingle Story named after YOU! 
Choose a side; determine the game's ending
Our first support level is not only a pledge to Prove Love Is Real, it is a vote where you determine a key element of the game itself! Will you join TEAM SPAGHETTI SWEETIES or do you choose THE CHOCOLATE MILK CUTIES???? This may be the most sexy and important decision of your life. 
Early access to Project Tingler means you get the game before the public does. That's right, you get to prove love before the bucks and ladybucks who abstain from Kickstarting us in the butt. Backers can also get exclusive access to crude Photoshops, making-of clips, and general Tinglenanigans while the hard buds make Project Tingler.
We also have mugs and t-shirts.
      If you're one of the few who decide to be extra nice, you can get a custom Chuck Tingle-style cover with your face on it! These items will be delivered digitally directly to backers AND will be hidden objects to find in the game itself. YOU'RE A COLLECTIBLE NOW, BUCKAROO. (Limit 69)
What about the hardest buds who prove love with high rewards?? You could get a REAL PROP from the production of Project Tingler along with an attached card commemorating the occasion and describing the prop's use during production! Buttplug Bandolier? Executive dildo? Who knows what delights you'll pull from our exotic and sensual treasure box! (Limit 50)
  For buckaroos who want to BE in Project Tingler, we have two limited reward tiers for you. You could be a HANDSOME LIVING OBJECT in Project Tingler! If you're one of the ten who do this good way, you simply need to send us footage of your face (don't worry - we'll work with you through the process). That's right, buds need not be in Los Angeles to become a living object! (Limit 10)
For buds in (or visiting) city name of Los Angeles, you could be one of the three who dons full UNICORN BUTT COP REGALIA in Project Tingler! There will be a production day between November 15 and December 15 (relatively flexible) where YOU can join the game buds for a day of fun and booty shorts. (Limit 3)
Finally, buds who wish to truly know the way of love can be our highest reward bud and have the good Dr. Tingle himself name a protagonist after you in one of his Tingleverse adventures. This is a digital product and the three buds who do this way will need to understand they will be subjected to literary poundings in heart, brain, AND butt. Please understand. (Limit 3)
Project Tingler has two main physical rewards — If you want extras you will have an opportunity to add a UNICORN BUTT COP T-SHIRT ($35 for U.S. orders, $45 for International - prices include shipping & handling) or a TRUE BUCKAROO MUG ($20 for U.S. orders, $30 for International) at the end of the Kickstarter campaign. 
We don't have any. We have a specific vision in mind for the game, and overfunding will go to polishing & improving the game we already want to make. If we absolutely had to pick a stretch goal, it would be for 69,421 - thank you for not leaving the total as the sexweed number.
Chuck and the Project Tingler team want to make this game like the rest of Zoe's games - pay what you can. Crowdfunding gives us the freedom to make Project Tingler the loving gift to the internet we want it to be and provide voracious Tingle fans with early access to the game, special rewards, and an opportunity to be part of this Truly Magical Process.
The greatest funding requirement is the cost of filming the entire game as an FMV Adventure. Why are we going back to a decades-old form of game making that was hastily abandoned and literally no one asked for? Because we are dedicated to pouring our hearts into crafting ridiculously awesome things quite seriously, and FMV matches the stock photography style of Chuck's covers. We’ve spent a considerable amount of our own money and countless hours (we’re not joking. We’re too sleepy to count anything right now) to develop a game that truly emulates the distinct feel of a Chuck Tingle novel.
Over the last few months we’ve experimented with production pipelines and the tech, and we’ve done multiple shoots, so we know how to minimize risks and waste that can come from needing to re-shoot footage. We've prototyped out a level that meets our standards, because we didn’t want to come to you before we’d eliminated the biggest, girthiest risks in creating the game! Project Tingler has been hard in development for almost a year at this point, and we are well-equipped to handle the challenges that naturally arouse during the process, including ones that aren't exclusive to working in FMV.
The core team has shipped a combined 12 games in the past 5 years, and we're well-versed in how to finish a game and accurately budget (ignore what we just said about not being able to count).
Your support helps us pound the world in the butt with the Gift of Project Tingle...for all Buckaroos Who Kiss The Sky.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Modern-day FMV games are relatively uncharted waters, but thankfully we're coming to you after almost a year of developing the game. Physical rewards will be created and shipped by Amplifier, a top printing and fulfillment company who’ve worked with Nerdist, Geek and Sundry, and more. 

The biggest "risk" might be the fact that it's comedy that deals with sexuality - only the most subjective thing we could choose to do. Everyone has a different sense of humor, but we hope that you've got a good feel for what ours is. In case a few things aren't clear, here's what we do think is funny

-The human condition
-The Bigfoot Pirate Ghost condition
-Dogs (clothed)
-Dogs (natural)
-Unicorns that walk like men, yet are not bound by man’s laws
-The unexpected juxtaposition of disparate concepts (for instance: pirate, ghost, and bigfoot)
-The absurd treated as the mundane
-The mundane treated as the absurd
-Dad jokes
-Big Dogs (t-shirts) 

Here's what we DON'T think is funny:

-The twenty Twitter accounts that pop up immediately after a current event happens like Left Shark or Ken Bone
-Racism (stop it)
-Sexism (stop it)
-Any other mean-spirited shit where the punchline is punching down
-The basic concept of people of the same gender being in love and/or having sex with each other. We all take this one very seriously, and it's extremely important us, as we've only got like...one token straight person on the team. You know, just to keep it interesting.
-That dream you had once where Kevin from Accounting made this face at you, and you were like "whaaat", and- I guess you had to be there.
-People who don't read past the title of a Chuck Tingle book to discover the unironic beauty and joy he brings us.

Also my cat sits on my keyboard a lot which is a real difficulty and I want you to know that. It's an ongoing challenge and makes it hard to type. I don't have a solution to this problem.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
That's right - we're way overdue for an update post! Thanks for bearing with us backeroos. Here's what's been going on:
As some of you may know, I had a book come out this fall and a 3-month countrywide tour immediately afterward. Naturally I was hoping to get the game out before having to leave on that because I had some vague idea that it sounded like I might be a bit busy during that time and as the programmer and lead design, writer, etc etc that could possibly slightly result in a bit of a tiny delay. "Not a big one!", I told myself as even the work leading up to the launch started to get more and more intense. "Hell, I've done train jam, I've worked on the road plenty of times, I can still get stuff done AND launch a book AND be on the road for three months. How hard could it be? I don't even have to release a patch!"

Hey Backeroos,
Just wanted to say hi as we're pounding away at finishing the game! We'll have another BTS update soon, but we wanted to at least show you some cool shots from the most recent shoots in the meantime:

campaign.story:
The Project
In an ode to the country I have chosen to call home I have decided to bake 50 pies.

Each pie will represent one state and be inspired by the state fruit, state food, state pastry or something that I feel encompasses the state itself.
The timeline I have given myself for this project will be determined by how long my permanent US visa takes to process. (Hopefully sooner than later)

I will be gifting each pie to someone I know from the state the pie is based on. This is my version of working towards the American dream I've always dreamt for myself being an immigrant from another country. What better way to show love to the country I love the most than through warm flaky crusted baked goods. 
I have completed 7 out of the 50 pies and would like a little help along the way with completing the final 43 and at the end of my pie journey I have dreams of compiling all the recipes, stories and images into a book. 

From coast to coast and from sea to shining sea, America is the country I love the most!
This is my love letter to America!
https://fiftypies.squarespace.com/
                                               The Funds
Here is the breakdown so all is clear on where your hard earned money that you have chosen to donate to me will be spent!
What I will be using the funds for are the following:
• Baking supplies (flour, unsalted butter, etc.) Im only using the highest quality ingredients to produce a high quality project for the people I love. It's costing about $35-$40 a pie, more for a savory meat pie.
• Specialty ingredients for each state pie from local farmers. For example for the Colorado pie the bison in the pie was $40 since it was free range and organic from a local speciality meats supplier. (Roaming Acres - check em out they are awesome! Also they are in New Jersey. Currently as you read this there are bison in New Jersey!!!! Who knew?!)
• Paying my graphic designer for all the amazing hand done typography he is doing for me (logos, state names) they are a beaut! I want the aesthic of the project to stay consistent so that at the end of it, it can all be complied into a book. As a designer myself I want to make sure he is paid fairly and well for his hard, beautiful and time consuming work. It's $150 for each hand lettered state so $150 x 50. You get the picture!
• Maybe starting the possibility of shipping pies to people in different states. Pies that are able to be shipped to people in the corresponding states I would like to gift them too will go 2 day USPS Large Box Flat Rate Express. They actually make a flat rate box that fits a pie perfectly. 2 day shipping is usually around $18.00
• The Kickstarter fee. That 5% coming to get yah! Props for being such incredible hosts (hehe cause they are hosting the website)
• Getting all the reward swag made, personalized swag! (koozies, stickers, shirts, posters etc). Thank you Custom Ink!
The Rewards
Star Spangled vinyl stickers - Made right here in Brooklyn! "50 Pies" sticker color in your choice of Red, White or you guessed it Blue! 
“50 pies” magnet - Rep your love of America and pie on your fridge
 
“50 pies” Koozies! - Keep your beer cold and your pie warm!
Mini Pie-broidery by Kirsten Geiger! - my kick ass co-worker who always reminds me to find my beach has stitched up these wonderful mini pie slices! Get yourself one of three mini slices to Cherry-ish forever. Right now the available flavors for this tiny slice are cherry, apple and *~mystery~*
 Print of a Pie-llustration by Rachel Hauer - The amazing lady who is responsible for 80% of the tattoos on my body, my fellow Gucci fan girl and all round sweet sweet friend Rachel Hauer did this amazing pie-llustration now available as a reward in my Kickstarter!
Delaware "It's good to be first" Recipe print by Stephani Stilwell - The most lovely Stephani Stilwell who hails from Delaware did a most lovely illustration of my Delaware "It's good to be first" Recipe! Get em fast so you too can make your own 50 state pie for the first state in the United!
Pie Making Lesson (online)! - A little lesson on how to make a mixed berry pie with the help of an instructional video I'll put together.
“50 Pies” Ringer Tee! - I love ringer tees and there cool vibes! Enjoy wearing this "50 pies" ringer tee while eating a good slice of pie. 
One of the 50 pies of your choice! - Your choice of any one of the "50 Pies' made especially for you! (Ice cream pies won't ship)
Hand painted pie tins by Brian Kaspr! - Brian who I have dubbed the king of swoops and loops is responsible for all the beautiful type you see on my state pie posts and for my 50 pies logo! Pick one of two pie-some statements to ring true! 
"With Liberty and Pie for All" & "In Pie We Trust"
   
Two of the 50 pies of your choice! - Your choice of any two of the "50 Pies' made especially for you! (Ice cream pies won't ship)
Pie on your birthday! - A pie for you on your birthday in 2017/2018! Your choice of filling and your choice of pie design!  
PIE OF THE MONTH CLUB!  - Join a pie of the month club and I'll bake a pie for you one a month for a year! 12 pies in total! Pie flavors will be determined by whats in season. (no ice cream pies)
 What are you using the $10,000 for?!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have done everything in my power to eliminate all risks and challenges in this project by sourcing everything locally from stores around Brooklyn or from farmers markets around the tri-state area and creating relationships with them. 
The main challenges I am facing are financing the project (butter is not cheap! haha) and sourcing certain specialty ingredients that can only be found in particular states. 
I hope to complete this project sooner than later and with your help this will be a possibility.
Thank you for helping me make my dreams come true!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: THE BIGGEST UPDATE YET! - A COOKBOOK!
updates.update_content:
Hello my lovely kickstarter backers! 

DO I HAVE AN UPDATE FOR YOU! 
Who knew where this little project with your support behind it would go but here we are! A COOKBOOK!

Hello my most wonderful pie trip buddies!
Some most exciting news to share! On last night's All Things Considered on NPR I had a little feature! An interview by the wonderful Neda Ulaby! 
An Ode, À La Mode: 1 Baker Savors America, Creating 50 Pies For 50 States!
Please go check it out and give the clip a listen here.

updates.update_userinfo: A FUN UPDATE! AN EATER ARTICLE!
updates.update_content:
Hello my lovely pie trip buddies! 
some VERY EXCITING NEWS! 
The wonderful Elazar Sontag wrote a beautiful article about my 50 pies project and what I've been doing during 2020 while my project is on a pause. Click through to read the full article! Hope y'all enjoy!

Hello my wonderful pie trip buddies and kickstarter backers! 
I thought I would give y'all a little update on where i'm at in my 2020 pie journey. 
As I have said before my 50 pies project is on a pieatus since half of my project is me traveling to deliver the pie to the person it is for. Due to COVID 19 restrictions the last 6 recipients wouldn't get the full effect and we don't want them to miss out on the royal treatment the previous 44 got! BUT! that doesn't mean i haven't been busy baking up a storm! so many #sidepiesforsidepieces

Hello my lovely backers! 
My desperation pie video series has come to an end! 
You can find all the episodes and the recipes for the pies I made HERE If you are going to make any one of the desperation pies I highly suggest making the water pie it was delicious! Think about a pie that is filled with Krispy Kreme doughnut glaze. DELICIOUS! If you wanna skip ahead to the tasting on the pies here is the video:

Hello my lovely backers and fellow hunker downers!
Hopefully everyone is home safe with a tummy full of baked goods! Are y'all running out of things to watch? 
Well I have a tiny solution to that! 
I have officially started my Desperation Pies video series! YAY! In this series I take you on a journey through the world of Desperation Pies and what they are all about! I even bake a few! With all the time inside I decided to try my hand at filming and editing my own videos! The videos can be found on my as well as my brand new channel! Head over to YouTube and like, subscribe and hit that bell icon to be notified when I post a new video! For the desperation pie series I'll be posting a new episode every Thursday at 9:30am EST! There will be a total of seven episodes!

Hello my most lovely backers! I hope that everyone is staying home and well! 
Thought I would give you guys some light reading the afternoon with a little update on where I am pie-wise! Since we last spoke I have completed 4 more pies! Which means I only have 6 left!!!! Isn't that crazy! 
Here are the four:

updates.update_userinfo: WE ARE DOWN TO THE FINAL 10!!!!
updates.update_content:
Hello my wonderful backers!
What a journey we have been on so far! Together we have all made it to THE FINAL 10 PIES *cue the final countdown* DUN DUN DUN! Since we last spoke I have completed the following states, feel free to click through to see the posts for each pie on my website:

Hello my fine and lovely backers! 
I am officially out of the "N" states! and I've got 16 pies to go! I guess you could call this the home stretch?!
See below for my write ups on 50pies50states.com of North Carolina & North Dakota! Two lovely savory pies to round out the "N" states!

Hello my lovely pie-ackers!
Since they last time we spoke! I've completed 4 more states! with 18 pies to go! This is very exciting for me! I'm way past the halfway point and 18 is my favorite number!
Here are the pies i've completed since we last spoke

Congrats!!! Can’t wait to buy it!
