campaign.story:
$10,000 STRETCH GOAL!
With your help, we've surpassed our initial goal of $2,500, and now we set our sights on our ultimate goal of $10,000. This will allow us to have an extra shooting day, delve into the characters more, and make the film longer - in other words, you get a much better product! 
When we reach the $10k Stretch Goal, we will give every donor at or above the $25 level one-week access (10/24-10/31) to watch "Occupants," which just won first place for a sci-fi/horror film at the 2016 Shriekfest horror film festival! Directed by Russell Emanuel, Produced by Howard Nash, and starring Robert Picardo.
*Let's get to $10,000, and then celebrate Halloween week with your free viewing of an award winning sci-fi/horror film! 
 The Assassin's Apprentice is a story about a young apprentice assassin (Tarah Paige - True Blood, CSI: NY, Transformers, Star Trek: Renegades) whose first solo mission is to neutralize a notorious, and previously untouchable, drug kingpin. Because of her unparalleled athletic skills and insatiable thirst for adventure and excitement, she attempts to execute her hit in a different manner than her trainer (Robert Picardo - Star Trek: Voyager, Total Recall, Stargate: Atlantis, Supernatural) and handler (Marina Sirtis - Star Trek: Next Generation, Star Trek: First Contact, Star Trek: Generations) would like. 
The Assassin's Apprentice is a short film that will serve as the first step in a bigger plan to establish the Assassins franchise, which will include a trilogy of feature films, an Assassins mobile game, and exclusive membership into the world of secret assassins. 
      *Please take a look at Tarah's stunt reel. Her stunt, freerunning and parkour skills will be on full display in this film. 
  Our production team is made up of Hollywood professionals with combined decades of experience, directing and producing such productions as the award winning Occupants, Tiger, P.J., as well as the sci-fi/thriller 5th Passenger, and horror features When the Fever Breaks and Lure. These people include Howard Nash, Russ Emanuel, Ryan Husk, and Eric Brown.
We've come together to create this new, exciting action/thriller franchise, and to expand it into a multitude of forward-thinking media.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every production has risks and challenges - renting equipment and studios, unforeseen scheduling issues, etc.. - but your donations will help our expert team to minimize these potential pitfalls. 

Donate, if you'd like to. 
If you don't, please consider spreading the word for us - it helps immensely! 

Thank you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello!

Our friends have only FOUR DAYS LEFT in their excellent science fiction KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN. They've got tons of the biggest names in Star Trek and science fiction behind and in front of the camera, and many of our Assassins team are also a part of the Space Command team.

updates.update_userinfo: Check Out This Excellent Sci-Fi Campaign!
updates.update_content:
Our friends over at Space Command (starring Doug Jones, our very own Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, James Hong, Faran Tahir, and many others) have a Kickstarter campaign going on right now and it's doing very well!  
They've got set visits, producer credits, acting roles -- all kinds of great stuff!   
Check it out by clicking HERE.
Also, don't forget, we've got our own Indiegogo campaign happening right now, with awesome perks we think you'll love. CLICK HERE for that.

updates.update_userinfo: Only a Few Hours Left to Support Our Campaign at Discounted Rates!
updates.update_content:
Thank you so much for all your support so far!
We've got a brand new campaign for The Assassin's Apprentice 2: Silbadores of the Canary Islands, and we've got discounted rates for our repeat donors!
But in a few hours, those discounted rates will disappear and we'll go public. 
So please check out the campaign HERE and consider these amazing opportunities.

updates.update_userinfo: We've Just [Secretly] Launched Our New Campaign!
updates.update_content:
We just launched out new  INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN!
But we are not going public yet -- we are keeping it a secret from the public for our previous donors, so you get super discounts and first dibs on everything, including some very limited perks!
For the next 36 hours, all the perks that have a "RD" (repeat donor) in front of them (which is almost all of them) are very discounted just for you, our Repeat Donors! And all the perks with "" (repeat donor exclusive) in front of them are, not only just for repeat donors, but also exclusive to this campaign for just a day and a half.

updates.update_userinfo: One Day Left to Support the Nichelle Nichols Documentary Sizzle Reel
updates.update_content:
Nichelle Nichols Documentary

Friends, please consider donating to the Nichelle Nichols Documentary sizzle reel HERE.
The hope is to shoot this sizzle reel and present it to networks so they can film the entire documentary about the life and career of Nichelle Nichols, entitled "Breaking Barriers."

We've got 30 hours left in our Kickstarter campaign for The Assassin's Apprentice: Silbadores of La Gomera!
We've already hit our goal and surpassed Stretch Goals #1 and #2!
We're now aiming for one more Stretch Goal to hit the campaign's ultimate goal. 
So, if you haven't already, please go over to the campaign HERE.

ASSASSIN’S APPRENTICE NEW FEST! We just got word that “The Assassin’s Apprentice” was accepted into the Reel East Texas Film Festival taking place November 15-18 in Kilgore, Texas! Thank you to the Festival and Go Team Assassins!
http://reeleasttexas.com/

ASSASSINS APPRENTICE WIN! We just got word that “The Assassin’s Apprentice” won for ‘Best Action Film’ at the Short Cinefest! Thank you to the Festival and Go Team Assassins!
https://www.shortcinefest.com/

In just two days, the new Assassin's Apprentice film is more than half funded! 
To check out this excellent new film campaign, CLICK HERE.
Our cast is full of Star Trek and science fiction actors like Armin Shimerman (Quark in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine) and Gary Graham (Soval in Star Trek: Enterprise).

campaign.story:
TWO YEARS AGO…
We decided to take on the challenge of reviving Otown, a brand that had been lying dormant for a decade. It was not easy, by any means, but together along with our family, our fans, and a chosen few, we created the album Lines & Circles. We had no idea that taking that leap of faith would lead to such gratification and an overwhelming response by our audiences, our listeners, and even critics. The reaction has been unlike anything we’ve ever experienced in our careers, ever. So together, as a group, we made the decision that we can’t stop now.
FOR THE FIRST TIME...
For the first time in our bands history we are going to rely completely on our supporters to start this new chapter by looking to you to put us in the studio. Our 4th album will be financed 100% free from any label, which allows us to make our music directly for and responsible to only one party; you, our fans.
HOW THE MONEY WILL BE SPENT...
The album will be released in 2 parts; an A-side in the spring and a B-side in the summer.
The money we raise will be used for: Studio time with producer Mark Suhonen (Chasin' After You, Rewind, Skydive), engineers & musicians, editing, mixing, mastering, website design, album artwork, & updated photoshoot.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The music business is one of the most difficult and trying businesses that someone could choose as their profession. Throughout our career, we've had the opportunity to learn how to (and how not to) succeed from some amazing mentors.

We know exactly what we spent and how it was spent for the cycle of our last album, "Lines & Circles." While there will always be unseen obstacles, we are confident that we will accomplish this project as planned. 

This time we're going to do it better, smarter, and we'll allocate funds where we've proven they will be most effective. We can only hope our fans will be as supportive as they always have been!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The O.T.W.N. Album is ready for your ears!!!
updates.update_content:
THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!
We truly can't express how grateful we are for your tireless support and patience as we've spent the last couple years working on what we feel is our best work to date, ALL THANKS TO YOU! We know you've waited long enough so we wanted to share the first 3 songs as soon as we got the masters back :) The rest of the songs are being mastered now, and you'll have those as soon as they are complete! The first 3 songs finished are "Hello World", "So Goodnight", and "Whatchawannado"!! As you might have heard, Hello World came from my friendship with Colton Underwood when he was a San Diego Charger. Before he went to shoot this season of the Bachelor we met up and he asked me to write an anthem for kids who are suffering with Cystic Fibrosis, a cause that his charity,  Colton's Legacy Foundation, is dedication to fighting. He calls the kids his Warriors, so I made sure to write that int he first verse as a ode to them. All the proceeds from this song will go to the Legacy Foundation and we couldn't be more proud to be able to have this song on our album.

For those of you who are having trouble with the dropbox link, here's another way to download it that should work for everyone. Happy listening!
p.s.  TURN IT UP TO 11! 
https://spaces.hightail.com/receive/oBysJoOfE4

We just wanted to let everyone know we're SO close to having the EP done :))  It's being mastered now and will be done next week! We're trying to get it released before the April tour but its obviously getting very close and we want you guys to have it first so I'm hoping we'll have music to share within the next 2 weeks! Can't thank you guys enough for making this happen.. and we can NOT wait to share the new music :)

campaign.story:
A thoughtful, interactive new edible exhibition from the Museum of Food and Drink. Join us as a "Wonton" supporter or higher, and see it on November 4 and 5 – before it opens to the public.
Chow will celebrate the birth and evolution of Chinese American cuisine, tracing its incredible 170-year history and sparking conversation around immigration, cultural identity, and what it means to be American. And, in signature Museum of Food and Drink style, visitors will be able to explore, taste, touch, and smell.
With your help, this will be an exciting, multisensory experience. Here's a sneak peek:
Wall of 50,000: A 15-foot wall of suspended Chinese takeout boxes will showcase the cuisine's widespread popularity. Each side of every box represents one of the approximately 50,000 Chinese American restaurants in the US.
Menu Time Travel: View hundreds of original menus dating back to the early 1900s. Trace the evolution of the cuisine over time, and view the beautiful, colorful artistry in these elaborate designs.
Fortune Cookie Machine: Take in the intoxicating aroma of freshly baked fortune cookies as you watch our mesmerizing Rube Goldberg-like fortune cookie machine in action. Enjoy as many freshly baked cookies as you’d like off the conveyor belt, still warm from the oven!
Wok Tastings: Taste for yourself the differences between Chinese American staples of yesteryear, and the present-day versions of those same dishes. You'll experience how the cuisine changed in just a few transporting bites.
We're almost at the finish line to bring this exhibition to life, thanks in large part to our stellar partner, Infiniti. We just need your help funding final production costs. We ask you – kindly, humbly, enthusiastically – to please help us raise $80,000 so we can launch Chow next month at our Brooklyn gallery. By contributing, you'll enable thousands of people, young and old, to learn about this important cultural story.
We'd love to say thanks in our own way, and backer gifts range from a Chow recipe booklet and annual museum membership to pre-opening access and a VIP Exhibition Premiere, depending on your level. At the "Egg Roll" level and up, you can see Chow before anyone else does during a private opening on November 4 and November 5. 
Thank you for visiting our Kickstarter and supporting Chow!
     Meet some of our incredible staff and advisors:
   Chow Advisory Committee
Yong Chen: Professor, School of Humanities, University of California, Irvine; author of Chop Suey, USA: The Story of Chinese Food in America
Andrew Coe: Culinary historian and author of Chop Suey: A Cultural History of Chinese Food in the United States
John Eng-Wong: Special Advisor, American Studies, Brown University
Madeline Hsu: Professor, Department of History; Core Faculty, Center for Asian American Studies, University of Texas at Austin
Heather Lee: Assistant Professor of Global China Studies, NYU Shanghai
Mike Lee: Food Futurist, The Future Market; born and raised in Chinese-American restaurants
Anne Mendelson: Culinary historian and author of Chow Chop Suey: Food and the Chinese American Journey
Robert Sietsema: Senior Critic, Eater.com
Emma Teng: T.T. and Wei Fong Chao Professor of Asian Civilizations, MIT
Cedric Yeh: Associate Curator, Smithsonian National Museum of American History
    MOFAD is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit that is creating the world's first large-scale museum with exhibits you can eat. Our goal is to advance public understanding of the culture, history, science, production, and commerce of food and drink.
We got our start in 2013 with the mobile exhibition, BOOM! The Puffing Gun and the Rise of Cereal, which featured live demos of a giant 1930s-era cereal puffing gun. Last year, we opened MOFAD Lab, a gallery space in Brooklyn, NY. In this space, we debuted the smell machines and tasting exhibits of Flavor: Making It and Faking It. 
We are passionate about food education. We've hosted kids' cooking classes, debates on tough issues such as GMOs, school groups, community discussions about food and gentrification, food science workshops, history seminars, and much more. All told, we've reached over 30,000 kids and adults with our programs and exhibits.
By backing this campaign, you help create an important educational resource, and you support MOFAD's continued growth toward opening a full-scale museum.
                          We are a team of educators, designers, builders, scientists, historians, chefs, and scholars united by a passionate belief that food deserves a world-class museum.

Robert Sietsema: Senior Critic, Eater.com

Board

MOFAD would also like to thank all of our extraordinary volunteers for their support, including Jenny Acosta, Mary Casella, Ennis Chung, Alma Igra, Sara Kay, Mookie Kideckel, Paolina Lu, Juliana Malzoni, Jeff McGuigan, Carina Moreno, Janice Moynihan, Priyanka Ramakrishna, Lizzy Saxe, Rich Shih, and Narender Strong, as well as the dozens of volunteer docents who help us run our exhibits and programs.
  The New York Times: Museum of Food and Drink Takes a Look at Flavor
The Atlantic, Citylab: Museum of Food and Drink combines geeky food-science info with lofty social justice goals
The New Yorker: Puffed: The Magic of Cereal
The Wall Street Journal: Have Puffer Gun, Will Travel
Mashable: Inside NYC's first museum dedicated to food
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We take our mission and our work very seriously. However, as with any complex project, we may hit unforeseen obstacles. 

Having run one successful Kickstarter campaign already, we have our contingency plans in place. We have identified all of our vendors and will be ready to place orders once the campaign reaches its goal. However, there may be delays in fulfillment if we do not receive items on time.

While there are some things outside of our control, we will keep all of our backers updated on the project status. Thank you again for your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: We have only one week left of our Kickstarter campaign to fund African/American: Making the Nation's Table.

As I type this, we have 45 hours and $13,569 to go. With a bit of hustle on our end and, if you're willing, one post or tweet from you we'll make it - no sweat! If every backer influences an additional person to pledge $30 we will have made it. With your help, we will be able to build out Chow to its full potential!
If you would like to provide a bit of reading for your friends feel free to share the enthusiastic pieces from Food Republic, Gothamist , and Saveur!

The next chapter of the Museum of Food and Drink is currently being written with your help. Chow: The Making of Chinese American Cuisine is being developed as I type this, but with your help the exhibition will grow to its full potential! Thank you to all of our early backers: we're almost a half way there, but there are nine more days to go. Please share chow.mofad.org with your friends and colleagues so we can move this project forward!
Over here at MOFAD Lab we’re breaking down Flavor in order to begin setting up the new exhibition. As a backer, you saw a video of the fortune cookie machine running. We have been running the machine for a few days now, as it needed to be seasoned and to get used to its new home. We can’t wait to start making cookies filled with the fortunes you and our other fans are dreaming up for us (Tweet @mofad with fortunes #chowfortunes).

Meet MOFAD's New Toy: the Fortune Cookie Machine
Making a fortune cookie is a deceptively simple with the right tools. A pump squirts the same amount of batter into exact circles on a hot surface, where it begins cooking. Once it begins to set, a fortune is placed onto the cookie disk. Then the machine picks up the fortune-topped disk and folds it into the shape we know and love. We are excited for you to visit to see our very own fortune cookie machine in action, and eat and take home cookies!
